loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn is 33 years old, married and has two young children. She makes a living as a farmer in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband grow rice and work hard to keep their land as productive as possible. She is applying for a loan for 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner CEVI to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, Jenalyn hopes to help her children complete college and succeed. She also hopes to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: 3 Chợ Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Hạnh is the group leader of the 5.1.53 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Hạnh is 46 years old and married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Hạnh has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Sarah has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, breads and biscuits.

Sarah has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads and biscuits

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
This is Rodel , 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rosanna, a housewife and mother to their children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rodel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. Aside from the store, he has a small videoke machine at home. A videoke is a combined term for video karaoke. 

Rodel earns his income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece in his store; having his videoke machines for rent; and putting up a small area of his house as a small videoke area where people can hang out and sing. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 268 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory, and for maintenance of his videoke machines. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Rodel hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in his variety store

loans.name: Nyabihoko Twebiseho Group, Kihihi

texts.en: Onesta is the leader of Nyabihoko Twebiseho group, Kihihi. She is 50 years old and married with 4 children and all of them are in school. She has a retail shop dealing in general merchandise in Bigiri Trading Centre and it has been in existence for 17 years. Onesta is able to make 100,000 UGX as weekly profits selling mostly to the local population. She is also involved in the sale of tea since she has a tea plantation as her source of capital for the shop. She best describes herself as very hardworking and she needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, soap, pens, pencils and other merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, pens, pencils and other merchandise for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is 46 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of five adult-age dependents. Carmen has a backyard business raising cattle to earn a living. She uses the benefit of having a few hectares of land at her home to raise a few beef cattle. She raises beef cattle and butchers them to sell. She earns approximately PHP 2,200 extra money per month. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to buy additional cattle for fattening. Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for more than two years. In the future, Carmen hopes to have her own cattle ranch on one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy additional cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 28 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jiminez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of three school-age children.
Shiela has a buy and sell business to earn a living. She buys expensive fish and sells it in her neighborhood. Shiela sells expensive fish like grouper and tuna. She has been running this business for three years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Shiela requested a loan of PHP 16,000 from GDMPC to buy fish to sell. Shiela has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Shiela hopes to purchase a vacant stall in the market to sell fish.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a caring & supportive lady by nature. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well and also supports her husband in his grocery store business. 

Her husband runs a grocery store in the market where he sells household items such as sugar, spices, cooking oil, rice etc. to his clients at reasonable rates. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to buy groceries in larger quantities, which will help him to meet the timely needs of his clients and earn better profits. 

Najma hopes that an investment will help him improve the financial condition of his business and the living standards of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a grocery store business

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 30-year-old, married father of one child. Hamisi runs a food café in Bombolulu, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for 5 years and has been a success. 

He has been a KADET client and this marks his second borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to renovate his business premises. The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business.

Hamisi hopes to own a restaurant in future.

loans.use: to renovate his business premises

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man from Qana. He has been manufacturing aluminum windows, doors, and closets for two years. 

His work is of a good quality, and most builders in the region deal with him. In order to improve his business, Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time to buy necessary aluminum stock to finish a requested project. 

Ahmad works hard to improve his business and to increase his customer base. He's also building his own house and will invest part of his loan to buy necessary iron pillars and cement to finish part of it. 

He hopes to make a small loving family, in addition to owning a factory of his own and to stop paying rent for another's.

loans.use: To buy aluminum stock and to finish some home renovation

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rabecca is a 46-year-old single mother of one daughter. She is the family's sole provider. She has had a second-hand clothes business in Barsheba, Mombasa for the last three years. 

Rabecca joined KADET Ltd. recently and this is her first loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase more bales of clothes to sell. 
The anticipated profits will be directed to additional stock and also to provide for her daughter. 

Her dream is to diversify her business and try out other sources of getting an income.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a natural fruit juice making business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma also sells snacks  as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a fridge, flavours for juice making and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, flavours for juice making, and potatoes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 31 years old, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  He does small-scale farming and sells all his produce in the local market.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour as he will employ casual workers to help him in planting.

In future, Paul hopes to buy more land and practise large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has worked on his quarry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  He extracts stones to sell in the local market. He is 55 years old, married to Sarah and they have seven school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stones and add to his stock so that he can meet his demand.

In future, Francis hopes to grow his quarry stone extraction business.

loans.use: To buy more stones and add to his stock.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is 42 years old and a hard-working woman; she has three sons and one daughter.

Samar started almost five years ago with a small humble shop, a dry cleaning business in Al Zarqa, where she has special machines and equipment for cleaning clothes and ironing them. And since then she has expanded her services to include dyeing clothes and fabric in the same shop.

Living through these successful five years has given her the courage to expand the work area and try to recruit employees to help her serve her customers as fast as she can. That’s why she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To expand the work area and try to recruit employees.

loans.name: Ameerzadi's Group

texts.en:
Ameerzadi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He is a jeweler and operates his shop in the market. He sells specifically artificial jewelry sets. He makes good sales every month which helps his family to survive financially. With the loan, he will buy jewelry in larger quantity that will allow him to make more sales and earn better profits. 

Ameerzadi is a housewife as well as a working woman. She sells quilts and operates her business from her home. She has good business contacts and earns reasonably good profits every month from her business. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Aasasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 31-year-old married man, living with his wife and one child in Qana. Mhamad works at selling and fixing air conditioners. He's almost the only one in the region doing this. As we know, the summer season is his business's high season, and he has to be prepared for it. That's why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to buy air conditioners requested by clients. He doesn't have enough cash on hand to get them.

Mhamad opened his own shop in 2007, but he has 10 years of experience in this field which gives him a positive point and his customers trust him.

He hopes to expand his business further and to have employees to help in doing quarterly maintenance for customers.

loans.use: To buy air conditioners necessary for his business.

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia is 60 years old and is a married woman with 12 children. Her husband works as a farmer. He grows corn and vegetables.

Gelasia runs a "habal-habal" business (motorcycle transport). One of her sons drives the motorcycle to transport people in their community. Gelasia has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts like tires.

In the future, Gelasia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts like tires.

loans.name: Majallon

texts.en:
Majallon is 36 years old and married with three children. Majallon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as spices, bread, curls, etc., in her sari-sari (general) store.

Majallon has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari sari (general) store for the past five years and also earns an income from electronics reloading.

Majallon aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. He has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing from NATASHA & AVON. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON.

Ruel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 57 years old and married to Sarah.  He does small-scale farming and sells all his produce in Ndunyu Njeru market.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour as he will employ casual workers to help him in planting.

In future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & bread. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Nyabihoko Twebiseho Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Flora is the leader of Nyabihoko Twebiseho group B in Kihihi. She is 53 years old and married with two children over 15 years old and still in school. 

She has a produce-selling business whereby she sells fresh tea leaves from her tea plantation in Bigiri trading center and she has sold to Kayonza Tea factory for over 23 years. She is able to earn 120,000 UGX weekly. 

She started her business after getting seedlings from the factory and also receiving training in tea planting from the factory and the sub county agriculture department. She is very hard working and she wants to add on more tea gardens as well as improve on her homestead. 

So far, the loans have helped her with increasing her working capital in her gardens and being able to pay her laborers wages. She needs a loan to be able to rehabilitate her tea plantation.

loans.use: To rehabilitate her tea plantation through plowing and adding manure.

loans.name: Senzokuhle Group

texts.en:
Doris is 55 years old and single with four children between the ages of 17 and 25 years old. Two of her children attend school. She runs a food shop in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in business for two years selling drinks from her home. She also receives income from the goverment's child support grant. She says that she hasn't faced any challenges since starting her business and borrowing from WBD. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy drinks and chickens. Doris would like to see her business grow in the future. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her generate more income, which will make her stock more and she will be able to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To buy chicken and drinks.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and is a married woman with three children aged 5, 4 and 2. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store for five years. She sells items like noodles, canned sardines and tuna. She also provides prepaid mobile credit loads to the people in her community. 

Gemma plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and biscuits.

In the future, Gemma hopes to have a piggery and a fishing business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and biscuits.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
This is Leonila, 39, resident of GMA City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a Community Leader, and mother to a young working adult and a simple stay-at-home who manages the household while she attends to her business.

Leonila operates a candle making business. She buys raw materials used in candle making and processes them to make candle. Her finished products are distributed to markets, general stores and other places where she has contacts for her products and she earns a small margin for every candle that she delivers. Aside from her candle-making business, she also operates a small store where people can buy their basic school supplies. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in candle making and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leonila dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and she also hopes to tap more customers in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials used in her candle-making business.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a 54-year-old divorced woman who is also a handicapped person who has struggled with life’s difficulties. Three years ago, she started up a small business in tailoring and sewing.

She has prepared everything in her workshop to suit her situation so she can work freely and easily, and through these three years, Khawla has gained a very good reputation in her area. Now she has applied for this loan to buy more fabric and materials that can help her make more profit in order to expand the workshop and open a shop to sell her dresses and the clothes she makes.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and materials.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 30-year-old woman with three children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store for five years. She sells items like soft drinks, sugar, and tinned sardines to the people in her community. She earns about 6000 PHP per month from the store.

Gina will use her loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, detergents, spices, etc. Gina hopes to expand her business in the future. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, detergents, spices, etc.

loans.name: Oumran

texts.en:
Oumran is a 26-year-old single man from Qana. He owns a coffee shop located in a very special region in his village, in which competition has no place at all.

Oumaran's coffee shop belonged to his dad, and it was opened 10 years ago. He made the necessary changes to it, through decoration and changing most of the machines, equipment, chairs and tables.

He also added "Hooka" (bubble pipes) and a billiard table/pool game known by some, which helped a lot in attracting a new generation in addition to those who used to come when his dad was handling the business. 
 
Oumran is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to buy a refrigerator and a washing machine which are necessary for his business. He hopes to improve his business and open a bigger cafe with several new activities.

loans.use: To buy necessary refrigerator and washing machine for his business.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with two children; one attends school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, her potential customers are the neighbouring community members and parents with school going children. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

During holiday season the demand for uniforms decrease since students are on holidays while when they re-open the demand increases.   

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth and a sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Phelelani's Group

texts.en:
Elpha is 65 years of age, married with seven children, aged between 19 and 35, none of whom attend school. She also receives the government’s child support grant. She runs a small business selling from the pension points and in Durban, she has two employees for her business. She also takes care of  five relatives who live with her. In the photo above she is standing in the middle of her group, raising her hand.
 
Elpha has been in this business for 10 years. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy dye, wool, grass and buttons for decorating bags. She says that the main challenge to her business is that she has only a few employees so there is not enough customer service.

In five years' time, she would like to have her own space in the city for her business to run smoothly and to hire at least five more employees. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay for her children's tertiary education.
 
She appreciates WDB and Kiva for helping her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy dye, wool, grass and buttons for decorating bags.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her children’s school fees.

For the past two years, Mesaidi has operated a retail business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby.  She also sells clothes, which contributes to her income. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming self-reliant in the future.   With her KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, kikoys and shoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, kikoys and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Chynargul

texts.en:
Chynargul is the mother of four children. She graduated from Medical School and worked as a gynecologist at the local hospital, where she earned a reputation as a responsible professional.   As it was very hard to raise her children on a low wage, Chynargul decided to start her own business in the medicine trade. 

Starting in 2008, she managed to broaden her business by renting a pharmacy and achieving success. But in June 2010, violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in Osh city. Chynargul lost her business, which was robbed and looted.  She didn’t give up, however, and is ready to resume her lost business and to continue to work. That is why Chynargul is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. She plans to broaden her business by renting one more pharmacy. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is a group that uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to restart her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 45, a resident of GMA, in the province of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Carlito, a business man, and is the mother of seven children; one is already working, while the youngest is still in elementary school. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to college.  For most poor Filipino parents like Imelda, a college diploma is the best inheritance they could leave to their children. 
 	
Imelda operates a buy-and-sell business. Essentially, she buys wood scraps from factories, then sells them to communities as house repair materials. Customers are attracted to her business due to her low prices. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, Imelda is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will be using the money to buy more scrap wood. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap wood.

loans.name: Teriz

texts.en:
Teriz is a 51 year old married woman from Qana. She has been working in agriculture for 21 years. She plants vegetables, thyme and olives, and knows how to sell her products using her good communication skills. Her olive oil is number one in the region.

Teriz is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new seeds to increase the quantity and variety of her vegetables. She has very good land for planting, with very good soil quality.  She hopes to export her products to nearby countries in the future.

loans.use: to buy new seeds to increase the quantity and variety of her vegetables.

loans.name: Namulesa Womens Group

texts.en: 50-year-old Ruth got a foothold for her clothing sales business 20 years. Ruth, a happily married mother of three, says starting this business was in many ways her means to an end in her below breadline existence back then. She says with hard work, the business was on the up and up after only four years. She began this business with savings from her earlier farming business. Ruth anticipates making further inroads in her business with the acquisition of this Kiva loan. Monthly, the business generates her profits equal to shillings 240,000. The proceeds from this loan, she says, are for the purchase of more new clothes. She transacts her business in Lugazi.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to resell

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sisters). Aisha has a business of a food stall.  She has been in this business for three years and she works six days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market at retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cassava, bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes. She also generates additional income through her motorcycle. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are building rental houses. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes, and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sukla

texts.en: Sukla, 37 years old, is a grocery seller; her income is $3.50 per day. She is married to a farmer who can earn only $0.70 per day. They have three children who are aged 19, 6, and 3. One of her daughters is working in a factory earning $3 daily income. Every month, Sukla has to spend $25 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $35 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her career. If she has a motorbike, it would be easy for her to travel to buy things in the market for her grocery shop.  With the profit from her career, she wants to enlarge her shop and send the rest of her children to study so they can at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her career

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
This is Nelita, 49, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eleuterio, a teacher, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. Aside from the store, she has a small videoke machine at home. Nelita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nelita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling up to college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru:
Турсун родилась в селе Чорголо (Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). Мать пятерых детей -  двух сыновей и трех дочерей. Замужем и проживает со старшим сыном, снохой и внуком. 
Турсун родилась в простой семье фермера. Она с детства помогала маме по хозяйству и любила заниматься домашними хлопотами. После окончания школы устроилась в местном колхозе в качестве доярки. В 1971 году, через четыре года после окончания школы Турсун вышла замуж. В начале, вместе с мужем, проживали в доме его родителей в селе Сосновка (Жайылский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан) - муж работал в местном колхозе, а Турсун присматривала за хозяйством. Вскоре колхоз, в котором работал муж Турсун, выделил им участок земли под строительство дома. В течение 3-х лет муж Турсун строил дом и после рождения первого ребенка (дочь), они переехали от родителей. Хозяйством обзавелись не сразу, со временем появилась молодая телочка, а на выделенном им государством участке земли они стали выращивать клевер и ячмень. Спустя какое-то время Турсун устроилась в местной текстильной фабрике в качестве ткачихи, где проработала более 20 лет. Со временем семья росла, а также разрасталось хозяйство, за счет приплода скота, который продавали на рынке. В 2008 году Турсун выкупила торговый павильон по трассе Бишкек – Ош и начала торговать продуктами питания, по торговле ей помогает младший сын со снохой.
Сейчас в хозяйстве Турсун имеются 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 2 лошади и 12 овец. Для дальнейшего увеличения  поголовья скота, Турсун обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS). За счет доходов, она планирует дальнейшее расширение хозяйства и открытие новой торговой точки.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Tursun was born in Chorgolo village (in the Chuysky region of Kyrgyzstan). She is the mother of five children—two sons and three daughters. She is married and lives with her eldest son, daughter-in-law and grandson.

Tursun was born into a simple farm family. Since childhood she helped her mother on the farm and like to do housework.  After leaving school, she started work on the local collective farm as a milkmaid. In 1971, four years after graduating, Tursun married. In the beginning, she and her husband lived with his parents in Sosnovka village (in the Zhaiylsky area of Chuysky, Kyrgyzstan).  Her husband worked on a local collective farm, and Tursun looked after their household. Soon the collective farm where Tursun’s husband worked allocated them a plot of land in order to build a home.  Within three years, Tursun’s husband built a house, and after the birth of their first child (a daughter), they have moved away from his parents. They did not get a farm all at once.  In due course, they acquired a calf and on ground allocated by the state they began to grow clover and barley.  After a time, Tursun found work at a local cotton mill as a weaver, where she has worked more than twenty years.  In due course, the family grew, as did the farm, which was expanded after the sale of some cattle at the market.  In 2008 Tursun purchased a shop in the Bishkek – Osh road, and started to sell groceries.  She is helped by her younger son and daughter-in-law.

Now on Tursun’s farm there is one milk cow, one calf, two horses and twelve sheep. Tursun has applied to  Bai-Tushum  and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock.  With her income, she plans to further expand the farm and to open a new shop.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth, 38 years old, is a rice wine producer at her home and her husband is a carpenter. Both of them can make $12 per day. They have two children,  aged 13 and 9, both of them are in school right now. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $30 on transportation, and $30 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy rice to produce wine to sell. Because there are a lot of expenses she needs to pay for her family’s living, she wants to raise about 10 pigs to get more income and, with the profit she earns, she will send her children to school until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce wine to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling cosmetics in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the holiday and wedding season, the demand is high compared to other seasons. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her brother's children).  Leah has a business selling Cavendish bananas.  She has been in this business for seven years and she works six days out of every week. Leah sells her products at the market at retail. Leah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal.

The main business challenge for Leah is seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are having a bright future.   Leah lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity but she does have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and transport.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of cavendish bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice and beans

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old married woman, living in Qana with her husband and two children. She has been a baker for two years making saj bread — a type of flatbread baked on a flat domed, metal griddle, common in the countries of the Levant. Similar to a pizza, it can be topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat. It can be sliced or folded. Amal is well known in the region for her tasty food. She works hard to help her husband with their family's income and covering their expenses. She had her husband's support for her business endeavor all along.

Amal is requesting a loan from Al  Majmoua-Kiva partner to buy a power generator, necessary to keep her products fresh in the refrigerator, since electricity is a major problem in the region. She hopes to open her own big restaurant in the future and to sell her famous bread to other villages.

loans.use: To buy a generator necessary for her business

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than, 29 years old, is a security guard who earns $2 per day for income. His wife is a worker earning $3 per day. They have one child and he is two years old. Every month, Than has to spend $11 on food, $20 on electricity plus rent fee for the house, and $10 for other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work as it will reduce some of his family's expenses. He wants to send his son to study until he has finished university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Sainte Therese De L Enfant Jesus Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 11 novembre 2009. Le groupe est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Sabine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente des huitres. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was founded on November 11, 2009. The group has 11 woman members who live in the same neighborhood. They work together in small businesses.

Mrs. Sabine, on the right with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 45 years old. She is married and has one child. She also takes care of two other children entrusted by her parents.

She is in the business of selling oysters. She has a lot of experience as she's been in business for several years.
This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and further grow her business.

The profits will allow her to contribute in paying the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to purchase oysters

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 27 years old, is a soldier. He stays with his parents, one brother and his grandfather. He can earn $3 per day for his income. Every month, he has to spend $11 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on transportation and other expenses.  He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a small car to transport goods as he plans to sell groceries. If he did not try to have another career besides his work as a soldier, he couldn’t support his family at all. With the profit from selling groceries, he wants to repair his house for his parents.

loans.use: to buy a small car to transport goods to customers

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Рахим более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Он арендует четыре гектара земли, где сеет пшеницу и хлопок. Сейчас он посеял хлопок и для получения хорошего урожая ему необходимо внести удобрения. Поэтому он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Rahim lives in J. Rumy.  He is 49 years old, married, and has five children.  His wife is a housewife.  Rahim has been farming for more than fifteen years.  He rents four hectares of land where he sews wheat and cotton.  Now he has planted cotton, and to reap a good harvest, he needs fertilizer.  Therefore, he is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer to reap a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda lives in Uganda. She is widowed and has six children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. Imelda has had a restaurant for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Imelda sells her products from home. She also generates additional income through her rentals. Imelda has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, rice and charcoal. Her main business challenge is seasonality. Imelda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy another plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, charcoal and rice to make dishes to sell

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 10 décembre 2010; il est composé de vingt trois femmes issues du même quartier; elles sont voisines, parentes et amies. Elles ont comme activités principales le petit commerce et la couture.



Madame Coumba la responsable est âgée de 35 ans; mariée elle es mère de deux enfants. Elle est couturière et a un atelier au marché central du village; elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Sur la photo elle est tout à fait debout à droite habillée en tissu fleurette blanc vert.


Elle achéte ses tissus à Dakar et Touba, coud des draps,nappes de table,pagnes, robes etc.....et revend sur place dans le village.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt agrandir et diversifier son activité pour gagner plus de revenus.


Ses bénéfices obtenus lui servent à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille sur le plan nourriture,santé et vestimentaire; mais aussi de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was founded on December 10, 2010. It has 23 women members from the same neighborhood. They are neighbors, relatives and friends. Their main activities are managing small businesses and sewing.


Mrs. Coumba, the leader of the group, is 35 years old, married and has two children. She is a seamstress and has a workshop at the market. She has a lot of experience in this field. In the photo, she is standing on the right and wearing a green and white dress.


She buys fabric in Dakar and Touba, then sews sheets, tablecloths, long skirts, and dresses, etc...and resells them in the village.


She hopes that with this loan she will grow and diversify her business so she can increase revenues.

Her profits will help her to improve her family's standard of living with regard to food, health, clothing and also help her to save more.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make a variety of items

loans.name: Iksasalethu Group

texts.en: Nobuhle, with hand raised, is 41 years old and single with two children who are 20 and 22, neither of whom attends school. She runs an agricultural business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. She has been in this business for 5 years selling vegitables from her home and sometimes around the neighborhood. Nobuhle requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that she hasn't faced any challenges selling vegetables and that the extra income from this loan will help her business grow and she will be able to save money in the bank. In future she would like to see her business grow and build a shop to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталье  Николаевне 53 года, замужем, имеет  двух  сыновей  и дочь. Семья Натальи Николаевны  трудолюбивая и  дружная - дети учатся в школе, сама Наталья и ее супруг занимаются разведением скота в хозяйстве и выращиванием овощей. В настоящее время в хозяйстве она содержит  двух дойных коров, которые дают хороший удой. В Московском районе, где живет Наталья,  стабильно работает маслозавод, который  зарекомендовал свою  продукцию не только на внутреннем рынке, но и в соседних  странах. Наталья Николаевна ежедневно сдает молоко на данный завод  по 20-25 литров в день, что является стабильным доходом в семье. Ее супруг  помогает по хозяйству, а также работает в средней  школе с. Крупское охранником. Кроме  животноводства, семья занимается выращиванием помидоров и перца, арендуя ежегодно 1,5 га земли, свою продукцию семья заемщицы реализует на местном рынке.
Наталья Николаевна обратилась в компанию Бай-Тушум и Партнеры за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS), на которые планирует купить дойную корову. Это позволит ей получить большее количество  молока и увеличить приплод  в будущем, для содержания которого имеются  хорошие условия в ее хозяйстве. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Natalia Nikolaevna is 53 years old, married, and has two sons and the daughter. Natalia Nikolaevna's family is hardworking and amicable.  The children go to school. Natalia and her spouse raise cattle on their small farm, and they grow vegetables. Now their farm has two milk cows who produce a good amount of milk. In the Moscow area, where Natalia lives, there is a butter factory which produces, not only for the domestic market, but for neighboring countries as well.   Every day Natalia Nikolaevna delivers 20-25 liters of milk to the factory, which means a stable income for the family. Her spouse helps on the farm and also works at Krupskoe village high school as a security guard. Additionally, the family grows tomatoes and peppers, renting 1.5 hectares of land every year.  The produce is then sold in the local market.

Natalia Nikolaevna has asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) with which she plans to buy a milk cow. It will allow her to produce more milk and to increase a production in the future so that she can maintain her farm well.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Benkady Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 27 avril 2008. Il est  composé de dix femmes qui habitent le même quartier et partage les mêmes ambitions . Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Rocky qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfant confié par un parent.

Elle s’active dans la vente d'oignons et d'épices. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis trois ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et de mieux développer  son activité.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was founded on April 27, 2008. It has ten women members that all live in the same neighborhood and have the same ambitions. They are mainly involved in small business.

Mrs. Rocky, on the right with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 40 years old. She is married and has six children. She also takes care of another child entrusted to her by her parents.

She has a small business of selling onions and spices. She has a lot of experience, as she has been in business for three years.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and further grow her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's standard of living (health, food and clothing) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase onions and spices

loans.name: Ulyses

texts.en: Ulyses is 53 years old and lives in Map-an, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of 10 adult-aged dependents. Ulyses has a motorcycle transport service. For the last two years, Ulyses has operated his motorcycle passenger transport service to earn a living. He likes to operate it because he generates an income of PHP 3,000 every month. The motorcycle also is environmentally friendly, energy saving, quieter and easy to drive. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle tires and accessories. Ulyses is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Ulyses hopes to purchase more motorcycles for his service.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires and accessories.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en: Mateo is 55 years old and lives in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental Philippines. He is married and a father of two adult-aged children. Mateo owns and operates a motorcycle passenger transport service. According to Mateo, motorcycle transport is highly demanded mostly in sloping areas. Because of the dangerous road, the motorcycle can carry heavy goods and passengers at one time. He has had this type of service for 20 years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires. Mateo is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Mateo hopes to purchase more motorcycles for passenger transport.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
42-year-old Cristita has had a snack vending business for two years now. She is a mother of six school-aged dependents and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Cristita sells a freshly prepared snack like sweet potato and banana cue at the market everyday. She earns PHP 1,250 per month doing this type of business. She established the snack vending business as a way of generating extra income for the family, especially for the education of her children. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients for snack preparation.

Cristita has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Cristita hopes to expand her food business and gain more profits.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for snack preparation.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 56 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of 10 adult-aged children. Corazon is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables like cucumber, eggplant, bitter gourd and tomatoes to earn a living. She has cultivated land for 10 years with a monthly income of PHP 1,500. Corazon depends on land cultivation as a way of generating income for the family. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay the labor cost for weeding. Corazon has been a good member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Corazon hopes to have more hectares of land to cultivate for vegetable farming.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for weeding.

loans.name: Khaleil

texts.en:
Khaleil, who is photographed in Jenin's Branch, is a 41-year-old father of six sons. He is married and works with his wife at their house making clothes for the neighbors and some of the stores in the city of Jenin.

Khaleil's oldest son finished school and wanted to help his parents' work, as they are getting old and have a big family to take care of. Khaleil took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a sewing machine for his son, as he also learned the profession when working with his parents during summer vacations.

loans.use: to  purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Byambagerel

texts.en: Byambagerel is 35 years old and lives with her brother-in-law and daughter in a house in the Sansar area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 5, attends kindergarten and her brother-in-law manages a taxi service business. She conducts a meat trading business with the help of her older two sisters at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business after her secondary school graduation and gained much experience. With 10 years of business operation she has been able to stabilize her business and build a strong customer base. She is a diligent and responsible woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She says, "I am receiving loan many times from Xacbank, one of the famous banks in Mongolia. I understood that if I use my loan wisely I can improve both my business operation and living condition. In the future I want to have my own apartment using the loan money carefully." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Khadiji

texts.en: Khadiji is a 41-year-old married woman living with her family in Qana. Khadiji has owned a bakery, where she prepares and sells pastries and pizzas, for ten years. Khadiji is a hard-working woman, working on expanding her business through a loan she has requested from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner. In order to change her bakery to a big restaurant, the loan will be invested in buying plastic tables and chairs, a television, doing necessary electricity installations, and putting a banner with the shop's name on it as a marketing tool. She is also going to buy a big quantity of flour at a good price. At the beginning Khadiji had challenges to succeed since it was the first time for her to start a business. Then she got used to it and was talented too. She hopes to succeed in her important, new step, and some day open another branch.

loans.use: To put up a banner sign, add extra tables and chairs, in addition to doing necessary electricity installations and buying flour for her bakery

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Angella lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sisters). Angella has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Angella sells her products at the market at retail. Angella has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to add to her business. The main business challenge for Angella includes seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are building a house.  Angella lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marites has a food shop that sells viands like afritada & caldereta. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking a variety of dishes.

Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking a variety of dishes

loans.name: Abed Al Majid

texts.en:
Abed al majid is a 32-year-old married man, living with his wife and two children in Tayouneh. He has been selling men's wear since 2006, having worked for a shoe company before deciding to start his own enterprise.

Abed al majid is now requesting his second loan from Al Majmoua, this time in order to pay for his child's school expenses. His business is doing well, but because of unexpected business and family requests, it has been difficult to save money for such needs.

Abed works hard to keep educating his children and hopes to see them at the university one day. In addition to providing the best living possible for his family, he also hopes to open another branch and expand his business.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school expenses.

loans.name: Evanjelyn

texts.en:
Evanjelyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Evanjelyn has a shop that sells "ukay-ukay" (used clothing). She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more bundles of ukay-ukay. 

Evanjelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evanjelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of ukay-ukay (used clothing)

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a food cafe business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her products. Constance dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans, cooking fat oil and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans, cooking fat oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Nyam-Erdene

texts.en:
Nyam-Erdene is a bright young man who is trying hard to achieve great success in his life. He operates computer services business at a rented space in an indoor local market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the outer ger districts of Ulaanbaatar. His wife works as a designer at a private company and his son goes to kindergarten.

Nyam-Erdene offers services such as copying, scanning, printing, and photo printing on mugs/cups, as well as other computer maintenance services. He owns 4,200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) worth of equipments and machines at his office. 

He is requesting a 3,600,000 MNT loan to purchase additional photo sticker and mug printing machines. As he is usually overloaded with printing orders, he wants to buy one more of these machines with the intention of increasing the productivity of his work. Nyam-Erdene has been running his business for more than four years, hence he is quite experienced. His goal is to establish his own company in the future and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase photo sticker and mug printing machines

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.ru: Шомурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Его сын уехал в России на заработки. Сам Шомурод более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Shomurod lives in Shahrituz.  He is 69 years old, married, and has four children.  His son left for Russia to work.  Shomurod has been working as a herdsman for more than twelve years. He primarily makes money breeding cattle.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to expand his herd.

Шомурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Его сын уехал в России на заработки. Сам Шомурод более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Serigne  Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Serigne Bara du Banc Villageois Keur Meïssa est créé depuis le 17 mai 2010 et est composé de vingt quatre femmes qui sont parentes voisines et amies. Elles font toutes du petit commerce et sont en bonne entente.

Madame Awa (assise sur la chaise à gauche de la photo et mise en médaillon) est responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 37 ans ,elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants et a sa petite sœur en charge. Elle mène une activité de petits commerce de légumes et a une expérience de deux ans dans ce domaine. Elle est assise à gauche sur la photo est habillée en blanc.

Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires en tomates,oignons,choux, carottes,aubergines.....et revend dans son village.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter plus de légumes pour satisfaire sa clientèle et aussi se faire plus de revenus.

Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle aide son mari dans les charges de la maison pour un bien être familial et compte aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Serigne Bara of the Banc Villageois Keur Meïssa was founded on May 17, 2010. The group has 24 women members who are relatives, neighborhoods and friends. They work in small businesses and all get along together well.

Mrs. Awa (seated on the left and in the small photo) is the leader of the group. She is married, 37 years old and has two children. She also takes care of her little sister. She has managed a small business of selling vegetables for the past two years. She is seated on the left, dressed in white.

She purchases her merchandise, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, eggplant, at the weekly markets...and resells them in her village.

She hopes that with the loan, she will be able to buy more vegetables to satisfy her clients and also to increase revenues.

With her profits, she plans to help her husband pay the household expenses for the good of the family and also plans to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Marifel has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, breads and snacks to sell.

Marifel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marifel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads and snacks for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in  Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother and father).  Betty lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.   

Betty has a business of selling bitenge, colorful Ugandan fabrics used in making clothes. She has been in this business for four years, and she works one day out of every week. Betty sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale. She also generates additional income through motorcycle for hire.

Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of fabric.      

The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself from the Democratic Republic of Congo and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Noche

texts.en:
Noche is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Noche has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used in oil production). He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of bananas and coconuts.

Noche has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Noche hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas and coconuts.

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi is 22 years old. He is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than four years. Sadi bakes the national bread, “lepeshka,” at home. His wife helps him with his business. 

Having many customers, Sadi sells the majority of his products just from his place. However, he also runs a trading place in the central local market for selling the "lepeshka.” 

Now, Sadi requests 9,800 TJS. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale as required for his business. Sadi is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase flour in volume for baking the national bread “lepeshka.”

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a boutique business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his laptop and television sales department.

loans.name: Nyakinoni Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Jesca is the leader of Nyakinoni Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi. She is 39 years old and married with four school-going children. She is a hard-working and very trustworthy person who has owned a drug shop offering human drugs at Katete trading centre for over 7 years. 

Jesca says that her customers are good and most of all, they come from around her operating area. She started saving from her salary as initial capital for the drug shop. Her dream is to educate her children and expand her clinic / drug shop. This is Jesca's loan and she needs to restock her drug shop with more tablets, cotton wool, injectables and so on.

loans.use: To restock her drug shop with more tablets, cotton wool, injectables and so on.

loans.name: Machell

texts.en:
Machell is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a shop that sells T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy beauty & clothing products from NATASHA & AVON.

Machell has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Machell hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty & clothing products from NATASHA & AVON.

loans.name: Inass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 22 years old, married and the mother of one child.

Inass has been a tailor since 2009. She makes and repairs women's, men's and children’s clothing.

She gained her experience from her mother and she has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator, an air conditioner and a sewing machine. She is aiming to earn more profit so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator, an air conditioner, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school.  Teddy has a pub.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Teddy   sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.    Teddy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.    The main business challenges for Teddy include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to get permanent business premises.   

Teddy   lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Julius Jayson

texts.en:
Julius Jayson is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. He has an art shop that provides art work services. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for art works for sale.

Julius Jayson has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julius Jayson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for art works for sale.

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 27 avril 2008. Il est  constitué de neuf femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont les mêmes affinités. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en charge quatre autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre, de l'huile de palme et de pâte d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis trois ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was set up on 27th April 2008 and is made up of nine women who live in the same district and get on well with each other. Their main activity is small-scale trading.

Fatou, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 53 years old, married and mother to four children. She also has four other children entrusted to her care.

She sells sugar, palm oil and groundnut dough. She has good experience in this field, having carried out this activity for the past three years.

This loan will allow her to boost her capital and to build up her business. The profits she makes will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing,etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, palm oil and groundnut dough

loans.name: Bonns Club Group

texts.en:
Ntombenhle is 33 years old and single with three children between the ages of 9 months and 12 years old. Two of her children attend school. She runs an agricultural business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa.

She has been in this business for a year, selling fruits and vegetables at her home. 

Ntombenhle requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that she does not face any challenges. She says that this loan will help her clothes-selling business grow. 

Ntombenhle would like to see her business grow and generate more profit. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her business grow and help her manage to repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армен родился в 1967 г. в городе Капане, после окончания школы поступил в проф.тех. училище. Живет вместе с родителями пенсионерами, жена не работает, старший сын живет в Росси, а младший учится  на втором курсе Капанского Архитектурного коледжа. 
С 1991 г. Армен торгует фруктами и овощами на Капанском городком рынке. Сельскохозяйственную продукцию он закупает из близлежащих областей и деревень, а также из Еревана. Прибыль от торгивли Армен использует на содержание своей семьи, а также плати за обучение своего младшего сына.  
Кредит на сумму 500,000 драм необходим Армену для преобретения партии овощей и фруктов (в частности, черешни, вишни, помидоров, огурцов, перца, баклажанов и т.д.) для своего бизнеса. 
Данный кредит является для Армена 9-ым по счету, и он никогда не задерживал свои выплаты.
texts.en:
Armen was born in 1967 in the city of Kapan. After finishing school he started vocational school.  He lives with his retired parents.  His wife does not work.  His elder son lives in Rossi, and the younger one studies in his second year at Kapan Architectural College.

Since 1991, Armen has traded in fruit and vegetables at Kapan city market.  He buys agricultural products from nearby areas and villages, and also from Yerevan.  Armen uses his income from trade to support the family and also to pay for his younger son’s education.

Armen needs a loan of 500,000 drams to buy vegetables and fruit (in particular cherries, sour cherries, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, eggplants, etc.) for his business.

This is Armen’s ninth loan, and he has never been late with is payments.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Naumi has a shop that sells coconuts for copra (coconut meat used in oil production). She has had this business for three years. Her husband provides motorcycle services. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of coconuts.

Naumi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of coconuts.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Janat lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.  

Janat has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products at the market by means of wholesale and retail.    

Janat has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO that she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.     

The main business challenges for Janat include the ever-increasing prices of second-hand clothes and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes .

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is married, with 3 children. He sells various construction materials at the central market in Dushanbe. Said has been in this business for 20 years. He tried selling several types of goods, but then stayed with construction materials. There is little competition because most entrepreneurs at the market sell clothing.
