Said offers good quality products at fair prices and has gained a good reputation among his clients. He would like to widen the assortment of his inventory.  Said needs $2000 USD.  He finds this loan very helpful for his business development.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and household goods in order to widen the assortment of goods to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children. 

Marilou has a shop that sells vegetables, snacks, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional vegetables & snack foods.  Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables & snack foods

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.en:
Khisrav is an honest and hardworking person. He is married and the father of one child.  Khisrav is engaged in producing and selling dried fruit. He purchases fresh fruits from the villages of Khamirchu, and then he dries and resells them. He purchases about 1500-2000 kg of dried fruits.  After packing them, he sends them to the Russia Federation to fill orders.  He wants to increase his profit.

Khisrav would like a loan of 6000 TJS to purchase a car for the transportation of his dried fruits, in order to minimize his transportation expenses.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a car for his business

loans.name: Villa Concepción Group

texts.es:
El comité Villa Concepción, con 3 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La mayoría de sus integrantes realiza actividades productivas. Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso, entre otras.
La Sra Silvia, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, muy temprano, todos los días, se dirige a su local para poder elaborar y`posteriormente vender los alimentos que prepra. Ella, al igual que las miembros, anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación, y asi otorgarles un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, aguas, jugos e insumos para la elaboración de alimentos.
texts.en:
The Villa Concepción Communal Bank started three years ago.  The communal bank has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya for three years.  Most of the members are engaged in productive activities.  Among their business activities is the sale of handmade food like meat empenadas, chicken empenadas, and ham and cheese empanadas, among others.

Silvia is a tenacious and hard-working woman.  Every day she leaves very early to go to her place of business to be able to make, and later sell, the food that she prepares.  Silvia, the same as the other members, yearns for a better future for her children.  That is why they double their efforts in order to provide the materials for their children's development and education.  This way they will give the children a better future.

She is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks, beer, water, juice, and supplies for making food.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, water, juice, and supplies for making food.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.ru:
Спартак родился в 1960 г. в городе Капане. По специальности он повар. Спартак женат и у него трое детей: старший сын учиться на геолога на четвертом курсе Капанского Политехнического института. Также у Спартак есть 18 летние близнецы: сын, который в данный момент служит в армии и дочь, которая учится на психолога на платном отделении Ереванского Педагогического института. Жена Спартака домохозяйка.
С 1977 г. Спартак работает фотографом, сотрудничает со школами, а начиная с 2008г. он арендует небольшую постройку в парке аттракционов города Капана, где продолжает заниматься фотографией, а также торговать мороженым, чипсами, попкорном и т.д. Спартак работает без выходных, и благодаря выручке, полученной от предпринимательской деятельности, он содержит свою семью, платит за обучение дочери.  
Спартаку необходим кредит на сумму 400,000 драм на приобретение нового профессионального фотоаппарата. Спартак является клиентом 7-го цикла в кредитной организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon).
texts.en:
Spartak was born in 1960 in the city of Kapan. He is a cook by trade. Spartak is married and has three children.  His older son is in his fourth year studying geology at Kapan Polytechnical Institute. Also Spartak has eighteen-year-old twins:  a son who is serving in the army and a daughter who studies psychology without a scholarship at Yerevan Teacher training college. Spartak’s wife is a housewife.

Since 1977, Spartak has worked as a photographer, working with schools since 2008.  He rents a small building in an amusement park in Kapan.  There he takes photos and sells ice-cream, chips, popcorn, etc. Spartak works every single day.  Thanks to the money he makes, he is able to support his family and pay for his daughter’s education.  

Spartak is taking out a loan of 400,000 drams to buy a new professional camera. Spartak is a client of Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy a new professional camera for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the hogs

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 43 year-old married man, living with his wife and two children in Chtoura.  Ahmad has worked as a barber since 1985.   This long experience  gave him a special position in his region.  Ahmad loves his business and family alot and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary products for his business.  Part of the loan will also pay for a new car that he bought to take his family on some short trips around the region. 

Ahmad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles and is in good standing. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business.
Ahmad is a man with a good reputation.  He's liked by most of his customers and recommended to others. He hopes to expand his business by opening a big beauty salon for women and men.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his shop

loans.name: Kitumbua

texts.en:
Kitumbua is a single mother of two adult children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 16 years, she has operated a snacks business, selling from home to neighbors. In addition, she also sells charcoal and firewood, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal.  Kitumbua dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business .

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Don Marcial tiene 58 años, está casado con Norma tienen 4 hijos.
Se dedica a la dulceria hace mas de 20 años, realiza sus ventas en zonas de la capital de pais según los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes.
Cuenta con su clientela formada a quienes en forma semanal los visita dependiendo de los pedidos que recibe. Gracias al esfuerzo conjunto con su conyuge no precisan de mano de obra de terceros y el margen de ganancia es mayor.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar azucar en menor precio, ya que su compra fue en mayor volumen y en forma contada.
Con el credito podra seguir implementando su negocio, para poder comprar todos aquellos elementos que necesita, como azucar, y dulces esenciales.
texts.en:
Marcial, age 58, is married to Norma.  They have four children.  

He has had a sweets business for over 20 years.  He sells in areas in the capital of the country according to his customers’ orders.  He has regular customers who he visits weekly, depending upon the orders that he receives.  Thanks to the joint effort he makes with his wife, they do not need more workers.  This makes their profit margin larger.

With the loans that he has received from the Fundación Paraguaya he was able to buy sugar at a lower price.  This is because his purchase was in greater volume and in cash.

With the loan he will be able to continue implementing his business.  He will do this to be able to buy the things he needs like sugar and essential sweets.

loans.use: to buy essential ingrediants to prepare sweets (sugar and essential sweets, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add shelves and paint the walls of her store

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a young married woman with no children, Hana got married recently but her husband is a Palestinian National employee with a salary that didn't allow him to purchase all the home appliances. It's been a few months since they got married and they have paid back all the money Hana and her husband borrowed to have their wedding on time.

Hana took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a fridge and a washing machine, as she was using the ones of her mother-in-law who lives next to Hana and her husband.

Hana appears in the picture, above.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and a washing machine

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.en:
Asadullo is 30 years old. He’s married and has two children. Asadullo is in the business of growing onions and wheat.  He began this business on his own initiative and has 4 years of experience. 

With this loan, he would like to buy agricultural supplies to improve production. In the future, Asadullo hopes to increase his production and sales so that he can provide a good education to his children and have economic stability. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, eggs, noodles & beverages

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children. 

Rodelia has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & breads. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy eggs, snacks, biscuits & breads.  Rodelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, snacks, biscuits & breads

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.en:
Zafarjon lives and works in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. He sells household goods such as an irons, vacuum flasks, glassware, and paints. He started his business with the small amount of 600 USD. He learned this business from his father. Zafarjon wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. He would like to get a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase household goods in order to increase his working capital and to make a good profit. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It hosted a key post along the Silk Road and marked the extent of Alexander the Great's empire. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.


IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy household goods

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith, a resident of Uganda, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

For the past three years, Edith has been operating a business knitting sweaters seven days a week, selling her products from home by means of wholesale and retail. Her main business challenges include defaulters, the ever-increasing price of threads, and transportation costs. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and a motorcycle for hire.

Edith has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more threads and needles. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a knitting school and to recruit young girls to help her with knitting work.

loans.use: to buy more threads and needles for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité son de la ciudad de Caacupe.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Alicia, y vive con su marido, ella trabaja en la artesanía, fabrica sombrero piri(sombrero hecho artesanalmente de paja) y pantallas de karanday (elemento para aliviar el calor, parecido al abanico), que son articulos tipicos de Paraguay.
Ella como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas y agradecidas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
Con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida, no solo de ellas, sino tambien la de sus hijos y familiares.
Ella desea obtener el crédito para comprar los elementos necesarios para la realización de las artesanías a las que se dedica.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the city of Caacupe.  The committee president is Alicia who lives with her husband and makes handicrafts.  She makes 'piri' hats (hand-made straw hats) and 'pantallas de kandaray' (a means of providing relief from the heat, similar to a fan).  These are typical Paraguayan items.

Alicia and her fellow committee members are very happy and grateful for the support that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva are providing them with.  With this capital, the ladies are increasing their small businesses and also their income, so that not only they can enjoy a better quality of life but also their children and their family members.  Alicia would like this loan to buy the supplies she needs for making her handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making handicrafts (threads, needles, material for fans, hats, etc.)

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 31 год. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. В этой области он работает уже два года. Целью получения кредита является приобретения холодильника для торговли мороженного.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in Rudaki.  He is 31 years old and married.  His wife is a housewife and his children go to middle school.  He works in trade. He has a shop where he sells groceries.  He has been doing this work for two years.  He would like to take out a loan to buy a freezer to sell ice cream.

loans.use: buying a freezer to sell ice cream.

loans.name: Joesita

texts.en:
Joesita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Joesita has a shop that sells snacks, eggs, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads.

Joesita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Joesita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Don Ignacio  tiene 55 años de edad, está casado hace más de 25 años con la Sra. Dominga de 52 años de edad, tienen juntos 2 hijos todos mayores de edad.  
El señor Ignacio es hijo de un agricultor, creció en una de las compañías de Carapeguá, desde pequeño trabajó en el campo con su padre. A los 26 años, se casó con Sra. Dominga, quién es hija de una tejedora y empezaron a trabajar juntos.
Hoy en día, hace más de 20  años que se dedica a la venta de las tradicionales  sobrecamas y hamacas los que llevan a vender por la zona de Caaguazú y ciudad del Este a una  clientela bien  formada, incluso su señora, quien es artesana, le teje las frazadas y así tienen un menor costo.
Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los dos, pudieron construir una linda casa para brindar a su familia una vida honrada y digna.
Solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos para la elaboración de sus sobrecamas y hamacas, como ser: los hilos necesarios y las agujas o kits de costuras.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 55 years old.  He has been married to 52 year-old Dominga for more than 25 years.  They have two grown-up children.

Ignacio is the son of a farmer.  He grew up in one of the companies of Carapeguá and worked in the fields with his father since he was a boy.  At the age of 26, he married Dominga, who is the daughter of a weaver, and they started working together.

Ignacio has been selling traditional bedspreads and hammocks for more than 20 years.  He takes them to Caaguazú district and Ciudad del Este and sells them to a well-established customer base.  His wife, who is a craftswoman, knits the blankets that he sells and this saves them money.

Thanks to his work and the efforts of himself and his wife, Ignacio was able to build a beautiful home and thereby provide their family with an respectable and decent life.

Ignacio is requesting this loan to buy the supplies he needs to make his bedspreads and hammocks such as threads and needles, or sewing kits.

loans.use: Compra de telas y mostradores para la confección y venta de sus ropas

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
El Sr. Damaso  tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, dos en edad escolar y dos ya mayores de edad, vive en la ciudad de Carapegua, compañía Espartillar.
Don Damaso  trabajó  como empleado de un Surtidor por mas de 7 años y con el transcurrir del tiempo fue adquiriendo capital  para  comprar mercaderías y así  iniciarse como vendedor ambulante.
Recorre por ciudades de Alto Paraná ofreciendo y colocando  productos de primera calidad, transportándose en su motocicleta, que gracias a este trabajo logró comprarse todo esto con el objetivo de brindarle a su familia la manutención necesaria y un hogar digno y confortable.
Con el crédito realizara la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Damaso is 49 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of his children are school age and two are already grown up.  He lives in the city of Carapegua, in Espartillar neighborhood.

Damaso worked as an employee in a gas station for more than seven years.  Over time, he acquired capital with which to buy merchandise and he started working as a traveling salesman.  He travels through the towns of Alto Paraná, selling top-quality products, transporting them on his motorcycle which he managed to buy thanks to this work.  He does everything with the aim of providing for his family and ensuring they have a decent and comfortable home.

Damaso will use his loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, belts and sheets) since he has many orders for these products.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, belts and sheets to expand his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Ngalanka Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe de solidarité est crée le 31 Mai 2007. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent toute le même quartier (Amy prise en médaillon était absente lors de la prise de la photo du groupe).Elles ont formé le groupe par voisinage et affinité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou ( debout à droite de la photo et levant la main)est responsable du groupe elle est âgée de 48. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse au marché centrale où elle tient une table avec diverses marchandises que sont les produits de mer, l'huile de palme, la pâte d'arachide et les tissus thioub. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte acheter de la marchandise et renforcer son commerce.

Son objectif est de générer des ressources additionnelles pour une meilleure prise en charge de ses besoins familiaux. Mais également d'accroitre ses épargnes pour tendre à une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 31st May 2007. It is made up of 13 women who all live in the same neighborhood (Amy who is shown in the inset was absent when the photo was taken). They are all neighbors or friends. Their main activity is small-scale trading.

Fatou (standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand) is in charge of the group. She is 48 years old, married and mother to seven children.

She sells in the central market where she has a table with various goods such as seafood, palm oil, groundnut dough and special tinted fabrics (thioub).

With the loan she receives, she is planning on buying more goods and strengthening her business. Her aim is to generate more resources in order to be able to provide more easily for her family's needs. However, she also wants to increase her savings in order to gain financial autonomy.

loans.use: to buy various goods (seafood, palm oil, groundnut dough and special tinted fabric (thioub)

loans.name: Emme

texts.en:
Emme is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Emme has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, candies & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emme has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emme hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
La formacion del comité lo inicio la Sra. Amelia, domiciliada en el Barrio San Blas de la Ciudad de Carapeguá.
“San Blás” fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en la  novena etapa, con 16 integrantes. Es un grupo de señoras muy responsables, trabajadoras y sacrificadas, ellas se dedican a la realización de diversas actividades.
La Sra. Higinia, es una tejedora que reliza todo tipo de aritulos, es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, por medio del credito comprara los utensilios que necesite para la elaboracion de sus mercancias, ya sean hilos de todo tipo y los diversos kits de costura.
texts.en:
This committee was founded by Amelia, who lives in San Blas neighborhood, in the city of Carapeguá.  The committee was named 'San Blas' and it is currently in its ninth loan cycle with 16 members.  This is a group of very responsible, hard-working and self-sacrificing ladies who carry out a number of different business activities.

Higinia is a weaver who makes all kinds of goods.  She is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who will use her loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her goods: all kinds of threads and different sewing kits.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies (threads and sewing kits)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La señora Justina tiene 57 años de edad, está casada con el señor Victorino que es jubilado del SNPP. Era instructor en tornería, cuenta con dos hijos mayores que terminaron sus respectivas carreras universitarias.
La señora trabajó desde niña con su madre, la que fue su maestra durante varios años, se casó y viajó a la Argentina. No sabiendo hacer otra cosa que coser entro a trabajar a una fábrica, con los años y los ahorros que hizo pudo volver a su país, donde pudo estudiar alta costura y hoy día posee un taller con varios clientes ya bien formados, colocando más máquinas y contando con mas empleados.
Anhela tener un lindo taller donde podra ofrecer mejor servicio y calidad.
texts.en:
Justina is 57 years old.  She is married to Victorino who is retired from the SNPP (Servicio Nacional de Promoción Profesional) where he was a wood turning instructor.  The couple have two grown-up children who finished their respective university degrees.  Justina worked with her mother since she was a young girl.  She was her teacher for several years.  She then got married and traveled to Argentina.

As she didn't know how to do anything else other than sew, she started working in a factory.  Over the years, and with some savings that she had made, she was able to return to her own country where she studied fashion design.  She now owns a workshop with several well-established customers.  She has more machines and more employees.

Justina's wish is to have a nice workshop where she can offer a better service to her customers and better-quality goods.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines with which to equip her sewing workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stationery and a photocopy machine

loans.name: Makhmadrasul

texts.en:
Makhmadrasul, an entrepreneur from Kurgantube, Tajikistan where he lives with his wife and three children, has been in the grocery business for 12 years. He is requesting a loan of 5000 TJS to buy foodstuffs in order to generate additional profits. Very good with finances, Makhmadrasul knows how to manage money and make the right investments. We believe the current loan will allow him to maintain a good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support himself and his family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Darlyn is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Darlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Darlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Teo has a business selling animal and chicken feeds.  She has been in this business for nine years and she works seven days out of every week.  Teo sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Teo has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken and animal feed.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Teo include the ever-increasing prices of maize bran and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own on a delivery van and to build rental rooms.  Teo lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of animal and chicken feed

loans.name: Satira

texts.en:
Satira is 40, widowed and has two children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 10 years, which is the only means of subsistence for them. They started this business with an initial capital of 40,000 Kyrgyz Soms, which was used to purchase two cows. They managed to earn 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms monthly. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, Satira pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Also, she cultivates beans, potatoes and perennial herbs on the land area of 1.11 hectares.   With the revenues from these activities, she was able to open a small shop near her house with foodstuffs. Now Satira is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy more cattle. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding and pay for higher education for her children. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa tiene 51 años de edad, está casada con el señor Ricardo de 56 años, trabaja en la Ande hace 32 años, cuenta con tres hijos mayores, el varón estudia análisis de sistema y trabaja, las dos mujeres estudian periodismo y arquitectura respectivamente.
La señora la señora se dedica a la venta de ropas, con lo cual ha formado ya una clientela bien definida, ademas de eso vende productos Avon (cosméticos).
Con la ayuda del credito, podra ampliar la cantidad y variedad de sus mercaderias, ofreciendo asi mayor variedad a sus clienes y fortaleciendo asi su inversión.
Desea que sus hijos culminen sus respectivas carreras universitarias y contar con un negocio propio mas adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is 51 years old and is married to Mr. Ricardo who is 56 years of age and has worked in Ande (National Electricity Administration) for some 32 years. They have three adult children, the male studies systems analysis and works, the two women are studying journalism and architecture, respectively.

Mrs. Teresa sells clothing and has been able to have a steady customer base, she also sells Avon products (makeup).

With the help from the loan, she will be able to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandize and be able to give a greater variety of items to her customers, that will strengthen her investment.

Mrs. Teresa wishes that her children finish their respective degrees and be able to have their own businesses in the future.

loans.use: buy clothing to increase the variety of her merchandize.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 58 years old, has practiced small-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years, selling her produce in the local market. Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time, and plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow whose milk she will sell to boost her income.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a successful large-scale farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra Lidia, casada con el señor Rody quien es también de profesión comerciante, ellos  tienen una hija en edad escolar. La misma vive en una casa de alquiler, hace ya 12 años.
Es comerciante y se dedica a comprar y vender ropas nuevas y seminuevas, que adquiere por fardos y los trae de la ciudad de Foz de Iguazu(Brasil, también compra en su domicilio, su esposo cuenta con vehículo  propio y también realiza las ventas en forma ambulante por los distintos barrios de Asunción y por el interior del país.
Al principio sólo utilizaban su propio capital el cual era muy pequeño, eso impedía que pudieran acceder a comprar muchas mercaderías, entonces un día conversando con una vecina quien ya es cliente de la Fundación, esta le recomendó acudir a la Fundación para que pueda retirar un crédito y de esa manera invertir en su pequeño negocio.
Siguió el ejemplo de su amiga y desde entonces  ha mejorado su nivel de ingreso, accede a mejores precios de costos, y actualmente está  inviertiendo en una nuevo proyecto que es la compra de medicamentos para venderlos en las despensas, aprovechando la venta en forma ambulante que realiza su esposo.
Con el credito podra mejorar la calidad sus mercaderias y poder obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Lidia is married to Rody, and they are both merchants.  They have a school-age daughter.  They have lived in a rented house for 12 years.

She buys and sells new and gently used clothes.  She gets them in bundles, and she gets them in the city of Foz de Iguazu, Brasil.  She also buys at home.  Her husband has his own vehicle and also sells in an itinerant manner in the different neighborhoods in Asunción and in the interior of the country.

At first they only used their own capital, which was very little.  This stopped them from being able to buy a lot of merchandise.  Then, one day she was talking to a neighbor who is a client of the Fundación.  The neighbor recommended that she turn to the Fundación in order to be able to take a loan as a way of investing in her small business. 

She followed her friend’s example, and from then on she has improved the level of her income.  She has access to better prices, and she is currently investing in a new project.  The project is the purchase of medications to sell at pantries.  This will be taking advantage of her husband’s itinerant manner of selling.

With the loan she will be able to improve the quality of her merchandise, and she will be able to get more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes in order to improve her stock, and to offer a greater variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Jerryle

texts.en:
Jerryle is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jerryle has a shop that provides welding machines and other metal works. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos to buy tools and materials needed for the machine shop.

Jerryle has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Jerryle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials needed for the machine shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 45 years-old, married to David and they have four school going children.  

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid for her previous loan of KES. 30,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer, spraying chemicals and also to pay her casual workers.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, spraying chemicals and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Manos Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Amada, ella es una señora muy activa y trabajadora, es casada, vive en su casa con su marido y su hija, trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente.
Este comité es un grupo que se formo hace varios años, pero como todo comité habian conflictos y algunos problemas entre ellas, pero supieron sacar adelante el comité con integrantes nuevas y antiguas como es la señora Amada y supierón salir siempre adelante. La señora Amada es la  tesorera del grupo y siempre supo llevar muy bien su cargo y es muy responsable en cuanto a los ahorros de las integrantes.
Este es un grupo muy unido, son muy activas, todas ellas tienen su microempresa y algunas sus propios trabajos en donde invierten el préstamo.
Con el crédito podran comprar los materiales necesarios para poder realizar sus trabajo tales como agujas , hilos, etc.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Amada who is a very active and hard-working lady.  She is married and lives in her home with her husband and daughter.  They work and support each other. 

This committee is a group which was formed several years ago but, as is the case with all committees, there were conflicts and some problems between the members.  However, they knew how to make progress with both new members and old ones, such as Amada, and they always knew how to get ahead.  Amada is the group's treasurer and she has always carried out her post well.  She is very responsible with the savings of her fellow committee members.

This is a very united group.  The members are very active and they all have their own micro-businesses and work in which they will invest their loans.  

The group's members will use their loan to buy the materials they need to carry out their work such as needles, threads, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making handicrafts (threads, needles and other items)

loans.name: Mahram

texts.en:
Mahram lives and works in Kurgantube, Tajikistan. She owns a business of selling shoes in the local market. Her vending kiosk offers a wide variety of merchandise which is regularly restocked. Affordable prices and a nice selection have helped Mahram stay afloat with her business for six years. In fact, she has not only managed to keep her business sustainable and profitable, but has also increased her working capital. She feels comfortable selling this type of inventory. Mahram is a focused entrepreneur looking for growth and further expansion of her venture. She believes an increase in assorted merchandise will guarantee increased sales and consistent development of her business. Mahram is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS to increase her working capital.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new seasonal shoes to sell.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Espíritu Santo se denomina a el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Nilda, quien se dedica a la venta comidas y bebidas, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
La Sra. Nilda es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, lucha dia a dia por procurar el sustento de ellos, gracias al credito pretende ampliar su local de venta de comidas y bebidas, para ofrecer asi a sus clientes mas confort y variedad.
texts.en:
'Espíritu Santo' (Holy Spirit) is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Villa Elisa.

The current leader of the group, Nilda (who sells food and drinks), contacted a loan advisor during a weekly meeting that she had in her area to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) worked.  Once she had been advised about the program, she managed to get together a group of 17 women who are now working very happily on their sixth loan cycle.  They are working jointly and supportively within the program.

Nilda is a very entrepreneurial woman who works hard to get her family ahead in life.  She works hard every day to support her family.  She plans to use her loan to extend her business premises from which she sells food and drinks.  In this way, she will be able to offer her customers more comfort and variety.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her business (beer, soda, etc.)

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell.

Jessica has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 49 years-old, married and blessed with four children aged 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old.  She buys and sells milk in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of ten years.  She earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

Rose has borrowed a loan of KES.20,000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD. This is her first term loan and she plans to use the money to purchase more gallons of milk from the local farmers for resale.  The profits to invest back will be used to educate her children.

Her dream is to own a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale.

loans.name: Ztt Club Group

texts.en:
Zandile is 28 years-old and unmarried with three children between the ages of 3 and 9 years old.  Two of her children attend school. She runs a clothing business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in this business for a year selling clothes for resale in a variety of locations. She also receives income form the goverment childrens grant. Zandile requested this loan throgh WDB and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that she hasn't faced any challenges to her business as she has just started. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her grow her business and improve her life and her familly. In the future, she would like to  own and start a new busines of a Bed and Breakfast.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.ru:
Ашоту 61 год, он живет в селе Варсер, Севанского района вместе с женой. Дети взрослые и проживают отдельно со своими семьями. По профессии Ашот бухгалтер и он проработал по своей специальности в разный организациях в течение долгих лет. 
На данный момент Ашот работает в сельской администрации и параллельно занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Жена помогает Ашоту на ферме, благодаря чему хозяйство развивается и на сегодняшний день они разводят коров, овец и кур. Также они обрабатывают собственный участок земли. Полученную от сельскохозяйственной деятельности прибыль они используют для нужд своей семьи. 
Ашот обратился за кредитом на сумму 1.000.000 драм для приобретения 15 голов баранов, что позволит увеличить доход семьи в будущем.
texts.en:
Ashot is 61 years old.  He and his wife live in the village of Varser in the Sevan region.  His children live with their own families.  By trade,  Ashot is a bookkeeper, and he has worked in his profession for many years for different organizations.  

At present, Ashot works in rural administration and, at the same time, farms.  His wife helps Ashot on the farm, and thanks to that the farm is expanding.  They raise cows, sheep and hens. They also work their own land.  They use the profit they get from farming for their family’s needs.

Ashot has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 drams to buy fifteen sheep which will  allow him to increase the family’s  income in the future.

loans.use: To buy fifteen sheep for his farm

loans.name: Kisakye Development Group

texts.en: 33-year-old Cissy has been in a retail business the last seven years in Lugazi. The mother of two says she began this business with her own savings. Farming was her first business. At her shop, she sells a variety of general merchandise retail items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, etc. Cissy says being determined, focused and diligent have been her calling cards. Weekly this retail business generates her about $82 as sales revenue.  Cissy says she is to use this loan to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, soap, plastics, maize flour, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, salt, plastics, maize flour, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay her casual workers.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products in her shop, by means of wholesale/retail.    

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.  She generates additional income through selling scrap metals. The main business challenges for Amina include the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to build her own house.  She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  She does small scale farming and sells all her produce in the local market.  She is 36 years old, married to Godfrey and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan.  She paid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to pay her casual workers who will help her in planting.

In future, Nancy hopes to become a successful farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Abd Al Razak

texts.en:
Abd al razak is a 54-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has worked at repairing cars for 36 years. He was young when he started in this activity, but he opened his own garage in 1980. His prices are affordable for anyone and his work is perfect.

He is a first time borrower with Al Majmoua. He is requesting a loan in order to do necessary maintenance to his garage, which is his main source of income. He hopes that one day he'll be capable of buying a special car paint oven that gives the car's color a perfect final touch.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his garage.

loans.name: Mrashi

texts.en:
Mrashi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while the other is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase cement and sand to complete the construction of her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to complete the construction of her rental houses.

loans.name: Olima

texts.ru: Олима жительница района Рудаки. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает в колбасном цехе. Сама Олима имеет  среднее образование. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В основном она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для приобретения электрической швейной машинки.
texts.en: Olima lives in Rudaki.  She is 25 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband works in a sausage shop.  Olima has a secondary education.  She works sewing traditional dresses.  She primarily takes orders to sew at home.  She has been doing this work for two years.  She is taking out a loan to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
For the last seventeen years Sarah has been operating a mobile hotel in Naivasha town. She is 41 years old and the single mother of three schooling children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 15,000 KES in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to open a restaurant and shift from mobile food supply.

In the future, Sarah aspires to open a chain of hotels in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to open a restaurant and shift from mobile food supply.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 43-year-old married mother of five children. Rehema runs a green grocery in Mariakani, Mombasa. She has been doing this business for the last three years. 

Rehema has been a KADET client and this marks her third loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges and avocados for resale. 

She hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her business. Her dream is to become prosperous and to be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges and avocados for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with one child who is one year old.  He has been operating a motorbike transport (bodaboda) business for three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he was able to buy a motorbike.  Prior to this, he owned a shop.  He wants 80,000 KES to purchase another motorbike. In the next five years, he wants to own a vehicle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Jesús Salvador

texts.es:
La Tienda de Jesús es el nombre que este emprendedor decidió darle a su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, ubicado en Medellín, a sus 60 años de edad la falta de oportunidades para conseguir trabajo hicieron que desde hace cuatro años, Jesús iniciara con su negocio. 

Actualmente Jesús necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos artículos que le permitirán ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes como harina, arroz, aceite, fríjoles, entre otros, así incrementará sus ventas y mejorarán sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“La Tienda de Jesús” (Jesús’ Store) is the name this entrepreneur decided to give his business.  He sells basic household items and is located in Medellín.  

At the age of 60, employment opportunities were few which led Jesús to start this business four years ago.

At present, Jesús needs a loan to buy some items like, rice, oil, and beans, among others, that will make it possible for him to offer greater variety to his customers thus increasing sales and improving profits.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, flour and beans, among others.

loans.name: Diabandor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 27 avril 2008. Il est composé de sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Siré, à la droite de la photo levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d'arachide, de poisson sèche et de l'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis huit ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, scolarité etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 27 April 2008. It comprises seven women who live in the same area. Their main activity consists of running small businesses.

Ms. Siré, whose hand is raised on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 35 years old. She is married and has six children.

She is active in selling peanut paste, dried fish, and palm oil. She has gained lots of experience in this field, which she has been involved in for eight years.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's standard of living (health, nutrition, education, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, dried fish, and palm oil.

loans.name: Begg Jamm Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 novembre 2009. Il est composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Julienne qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en charge deux autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle fait un petit de légumes et de citron. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 19 November 2009. It comprises eleven women who live in the same area. Their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Juliennne, whose hand is raised on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 58 years old. She is a widow and is the mother of one child. She also has two other children who were left in her care by their parents.

She runs a small business selling beans and lemons. She has gained lots of experience in this field, which she has been involved in for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, nutrition, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy beans and lemons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cat feed, chicken feed, yellow corn, puppy feed, Italcan Plus, 2 and 3kg bags, soup bowls, lunchboxes, straws, forks, spoons, cheese and chicken

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena es una barranquillera que vive en el barrio Ciudadela Cuarta Etapa, donD. tiene desD. hace 12 años su negocio llamado “Sala D. Belleza Mayito”, ella es estilista profesional con muchos años D. experiencia emprendedora, regularmente en su negocio funciona mediante el sistema a domicilio con clientes radicadas en diferentes barrios D. Barranquilla y Soledad y como la mayor parte D. su vida la ha vivido en el barrio el lucero D. Barranquilla  donD. aún residen familiares, allí tiene su mayor clientela. Su hogar está compuesto por su cónyuge que es taxista independiente D. un vehículo D. su propiedad, el cual genera  importantes ingresos que apoyan el gasto familiar y un ahorro para eventualidades del vehículo. El Balance y el PyG.  del negocio D. Maria muestra la situación D. un clásico negocio D. servicios que funciona con un costo bajo,  y maneja  cuentas por cobrar debido a las ventas D. productos D. belleza, que promociona cuando asesora en imagen personal y profesional a sus clientes;  sus indicadores financieros, muestran una estabilidad en el negocio y condiciones favorables para la inversión, que  realizará mediante su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , la cual se destinará a reparar el cromado D. las sillas, así como a invertir en insumos D. belleza y productos para la venta. Su meta es incrementar su capital D. trabajo con el fin D. ofrecerle a sus clientes un servicio confortable y generar mayores ingresos para aumentar el bienestar D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a working woman who lives in the Cuidadela Cuarta Etapa area, where she has worked for 12 years in a business called "Sala D. Belleza Mayito" (Beauty Salon).  She is a professional stylist with many years of entrepreneurial experience.  Regularly in her business she operates through a system at home with customers located in different neighborhoods of Barranquilla and Soledad.  For most of her life she has lived in the Barranquilla neighborhood where her family still lives and where she gets most of her customers.  

Her home is composed of her spouse who is an independent taxi driver with his own vehicle, which generates significant revenue that supports the family expenditure and savings for contingencies of the vehicle.  The balance sheet and the income of Maria's business shows the status of classic services that work at a low cost and manage accounts receivable due to beauty product sales, which she promotes when she provides advice on personal and professional image to customers.  

Their financial indicators show a stability in business and favorable conditions for investment, which she is going to achieve through this kiva loan.  This is her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This loan will be used to repair the chrome of the chairs, as well as to invest in beauty supplies and products for sale.

Her goal is to increase her working capital in order to proviD. a comfortable service for her customers and generate more income to enhance the well-being of her home.

loans.use: to repair the chrome of the chairs, as well as to invest in beauty products for sale

loans.name: Rulo

texts.es: el señor rulo es casado, tiene 2 hijos  de 2 y 5 años uno de ellos ya esta en edad escolar, rulo se dedica a manejar una moto taxi en sus inicios alquilaba dicha herramienta de trabajo y con el correr del tiempo logro adquirir su propia moto taxi, rulo es una persona muy trabajadora  de buenas referencias  por parte de sus  compañeros  y amigos, su sueño a futuro de rulo es comprarse otra moto taxi y con ello generar mejores ingresos, para mejorar su calidad de vida, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprarle el soat y también para integrar a una asociación de moto taxistas, el cual se paga un derecho. Rulo esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Mr. Rulo is married and has 2 school-age children ages 2 and 5.  Rulo drives a motorcycle taxi which was initially leased but after much time and work he was able to acquire his own moto-taxi.  Rulo is a very hardworking man with good references because of his friends.  

His future dream is to buy another motorcycle taxi and generate a greater income from it in order to improve his quality of life.  

He is requesting a loan to buy the soat and also become a member of the association for motorcycle taxis, which one must pay to be a member.  Rulo is very happy with the confidence that this brings him.

loans.use: to buy Soat for the moto-taxi, and pay a fee to belong to the Association of motorcycle taxi drivers.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Ermelinda es propietaria de Casa Rodas, una tienda de prendas de vestir elegante, como trajes para damas y caballeros, vestidos de novias y quinceañeras, ropitas para bautismos entre otros, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes.
La Sra. es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, lucha por ir adelante y gracias a todo su esfuerzo hoy dia se siente orgullosa de sus hijos quienes son todos profecionales, ellos on su mayor orgullo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de variados tipos,para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad, para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ermelinda is the owner of Casa Rodas, an elegant clothing shop with suits for men and women, wedding dresses, dresses for quinceañeras, clothing for baptisms among others.  

She is married and has 3 older children who are independent.  She is an enterprising woman, struggling to move forward and thanks to her efforts today she is proud of her children who are all professionals.  They are her greatest pride.  

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing of various types and offer a wider variety to her customers for the winter season.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing to increase her stock of goods

loans.name: 4 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres 4 de Octubre se originó a través de promociones que se hizo en la Zona de San Ignacio, todas las integrantes del grupo son conocidas, vecinas del lugar.
La Sra. Edita es la presidenta del grupo, esta trabaja en venta de leche y cria de pollos y demás actividades de una granja.
A través de este crédito desea incrementar su actividad y mejorar su venta inviertiendo en todos aquellos procesos que podrian aumentar su produccion y otorgando a sus clientes productos de mejor calidad.
El deseo de ella es que todas las integrantes cuente con una actividad y tengan ingresos para el buen pago de sus cuentas y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Mujeres 4 de Octubre group originated through promotions that were made in the area of San Ignacio.  All members of the group know each other and are area neighbors.

Mrs. Edita is the president of the group.  She works selling milk, breeding chickens and other farm activities. 

Through this credit she wants to increase her activity and improve her sales by investing in all those processes that would increase production and provide customers with better quality products. 

Her desire is that all members have an activity and have an income for good payment of their account so that they are able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed for all of the animals and clothing.

loans.name: Herika Liset

texts.es: La señora Herika comenzó su negocio hace unos 8 Años cuando se casó  y su esposo devengaba poco salario, fue así que se dedico a brindar el servicio de costura, entonces como ella aprendió a elaborar y confeccionar trajes de niños, de señoras y reparaciones de todo tipo de trajes de vestir, ella los fabricaba y los ponía a la venta y luego fue invirtiendo en mas mercadería y vendiéndola a sus clientes, con los financiamientos obtenidos ella ha logrado mejorar su negocio y su vivienda, ahora tiene una mayor clientela. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de telas, zipper, agujas, tijeras, hilos alfileres entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herika started her business 8 years ago when she was married and her husband was earning little salary.  It was then that she began providing a sewing service.  Then as she learned to develop and tailor dresses for children and ladies and repairs of all types of business suits, she manufactured them and put them up for sale and then was investing in more goods and selling them to her customers.  With the financing obtained she has managed to improve her business and home and now has a greater clientele. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase fabrics, zippers, needles, scissors, thread, pins, among others.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, zippers, needles, scissors, thread, pins, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks and food items for her business.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 3º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2010.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ana María, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, ella por las mañanas trabaja de empleada doméstica y por las tardes y los fines de semana se dedica a la fabricación y venta de productos de limpieza.
La Sra. Ana dice que con el credito  que recibira lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la fabricación de los elementos de limpieza, ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a el crédito que recibe puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de ropas, almacén , venta de tortas y panificados , venta de comestibles como empanadas, etc.
texts.en:
This group was formed as a result of promotional activities carried out in their area.  The group is currently in its third loan cycle and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2010.

One of the members of this group is Ana María who has two young children.  In the mornings, she works as a cleaner and, in the afternoons and on the weekends, she makes and sells cleaning products.

Ana tells us that she will use her loan to buy supplies for making cleaning products.  She is very grateful since, thanks to the loan that she is receiving, she is able to improve her income.

All the ladies in this group carry out business activities such as: selling clothes, running a store, selling cakes and baked products, and selling food such as empanadas, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cleaning products

loans.name: Koe Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Ko´e Pyahu, se conformó en  julio de 2.010, en la ciudad de Bella Vista y renuevan en el 3er ciclo, con 13 integrantes. En el ciclo anterior estaban 12 integrantes en el comité, e ingresó una persona más al grupo.
La directora general del comité, Adelaida tiene 40 años de edad, tiene un pequeño emprendimiento de creación y venta de bijouteríes, que con mucha imaginación combina los diferentes elementos a fin de obtener los mejores diseños para sus clientes. Posee la creatividad necesaria para la creacion de sus diseños y se denomina asi misma como una persona creativa y trabajadora.
Las actividades a las que se dedican las señoras son diversas, por ejemplo fabricación y venta de manualidades, artesanías varias, bijoueríes, al comercio, venta de ropas, entre otros.
Todas son muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras, ellas luchan para ayudar a sus familias para el sustento diario.
texts.en:
The Ko'e Pyahu women's committee first met in July 2010 in the city of Bella Vista.  They're starting their 3rd round of funding with 13 members.  There were 12 members for the last funding round and the've added one new member to the group for this one.  
The group's director, Adelaida, 40, operates a small business making and selling costume jewelry.  She combines different elements to create the best designs for her customers.  She's well known for being creative and her products reflect her flair for design.
The group's members operate a range of businesses.  For example, some make and sell handicrafts and costume jewelry and others work at various retails businesses. 
All the group's members are selfless and hard working, struggling day to day to provide for their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a costume jewelry business.

loans.name: Dilshad's Group

texts.en:
Dilshad is married with four children: two sons and two daughters.  Her eldest son has a business selling Punjabi food called Dahi Bhalay (made with yogurt and served with spicy sauces and salad) and the others are getting their education by going to a nearby school. Her husband has a business selling milk and yogurt. His shop is located in the market and he sells good quality milk and yogurt to his clients. 

Dilshad is 43 years old. She is a very active lady and sells clothes to share the financial burden with her husband. She takes orders from her community clients and fulfills them to earn an income. Besides her work, she also performs her activities of a housewife very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy the required ingredients such as yogurt, spices, potatoes, tomatoes and onion to be able to prepare better quality Dahi Bhalay to serve to his clients and improve his profits. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Dilshad hopes that an investment will bring even more profits to him.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as yogurt, spices, potatoes, tomatoes and onion

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 6º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2009.  
Una de las integrantes del grupo, la Sra. Pelagia, tiene 3 hijos estudiantes, su marido trabaja en metalúrgica y cuenta con un buen ingreso, ella se dedica a las manualidades (pintura sobre tela) y también a la repostería hace varios años.
Cuenta la Sra. Pelagia solicita el credito lo utiliza para la compra de telas, pinturas y también a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus tortas, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, a quien ningun desafio la asusta.
Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de ropas, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de comidas, etc.
texts.en:
This group was formed as a result of promotional activities that took place in their area.  The group is in its sixth loan cycle and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2009.

One of the members of this group is Pelagia.  She has three children who are all studying.  Her husband is a metallurgist and has a good income.  Pelagia makes crafts (she paints on fabric).  She has also been making confectionery for several years. 

Pelagia is requesting this loan to buy fabric, paints and also some supplies for making her cakes.  She considers herself to be a hard-working and responsible woman who isn't afraid of any challenge.

All the ladies in this group carry out their own business activities such as: selling clothes, selling cleaning products, selling meals, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paints and also supplies for making her cakes

loans.name: Silvia Melania

texts.es: Silvia Melania comenzó su negocio hace unos 7 Años, vendiendo cosméticos y perfumería en general, luego empezó a laborar en una zona franca y ahí vendía sus productos y se extendió con ropa, y calzados, ahora tiene una mayor clientela ya que sus compañeras de trabajo son la mayoría de sus cliente, también su esposo ayuda en la comercialización de la mercadería. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo y que junto a su esposo le enseñan a salir adelante para que su medio de vida mejore cada día. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa, perfumes, sabanas, cremas, toallas, bolsos y calzado.
texts.en:
Silvia Melania set up her business seven years ago, selling cosmetics and perfumes.  She then started working in a free trade zone and sold her products there.  She extended her business, selling clothes and footwear, and now has a larger customer base as her work colleagues make up most of her customers.  Her husband also helps her to sell her merchandise.  Silvia has two dependent children in her care and, together with her husband, they are teaching them to get ahead and improve their life day to day.

Silvia needs this loan to buy clothes, perfume, sheets, creams, towels, bags and footwear.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, sheets, creams, towels, bags and footwear

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto, tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y vive en su propia casa que está situada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Luis Alberto es de profesión herrero desde hace tiempo y posee su propia herrería y hojalatería en su domicilio situado la ciudad de Encarnación.  Además en su domicilio familiar que queda en San Isidro camino a Itacua y en donde se encuentra viviendo su madre, poseen una despensa bien surtida que funciona desde hace varios años. Gracias a esta actividad la madre de el se mantiene sin problemas, puede solventar los gastos de la casa y cubrir todas las necesidades que se le presente.
Solicita el credito para poder ampliar su despensa y poder surtirla con mas mercaderias, para que sus clientes tengan más variedad de mercaderias a la hora de elegir.
texts.en:
Mr Luis Alberto is 41 years old, married and lives in his own home which is located in the city of Encarnación.
Mr.Luis Alberto is a blacksmith by profession and he owns his own blacksmith and tin shop at his residence in the city of Encarnación.
