Also in his family residence which is in San Isidro on the way to Itacua, where his mother lives, they have been running a well stocked store for several years.  Thanks to this activity, his mother supports herself quite well, covers the house expenses and any other expenses that occur.
He is requesting the loan to enlarge the store and be able to stock it with more merchandise, so that the customers have more variety of products to choose from.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply his store, such as edibles, beverages and others.

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Mirando al Futuro” conformado por 17 socios que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre ellos elaboración de empanadas, tortillas, ventas de leña y carbón, además ventas de abarrotes en un minimarket. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.   
Nancy quien en la foto aparece en primera fila y segunda del lado derecho, viste una chaqueta color negro, una polera color rosado y calza botas encima de sus jeans. Se dedica a la realización de costuras desde hace 21 años, para esto cuenta con un taller de corte y confección al interior de su casa.  
Nancy realiza sus confecciones de acuerdo a las temporadas del año y pedidos que le realicen sus clientes. Sus clientes frecuentes son estudiantes durante la temporada de colegio, para la temporada de fiestas patrias (fiesta costumbrista de la independencia de Chile), sus confecciones son en base a trajes folklóricos. A partir del mes de agosto en adelante sus ventas aumentan debido a la confección, arriendo y venta de disfraces. 
En su taller Nancy cuenta con la maquinaria necesaria para desempeñarse en sus labores, una overlock, una maquina multipunto y una maquina recta. Comenta que le va muy bien con sus ventas. 
Su mercadería la compra en tiendas especializadas en ofrecer insumos de  costuras.
Con el crédito comprará género, elástico, hilos y lentejuelas, específicamente insumos para la confección de disfraces.
Sus metas son seguir trabajando en su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos, le gustaría perfeccionarse en la confección de disfraces y anhela tener una tienda especializada en el arriendo y venta de éstos. 
Nancy vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 11 y 3 años de edad, sus sueños a nivel familiar es que sus hijos algún día se independicen y sean profesionales. Además se encuentra ayudando a su marido con el negocio de venta de abarrotes que quiere comenzar.
Nancy está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, comenta que las reuniones han sido un espacio para compartir y conocer otras experiencias desde otro punto de vista. De ésta manera se ha generado confianza y solidaridad con las demás socias del grupo del banco comunal. Además es un grupo solidario y comprometido.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Looking at the Future" and is composed by 17 members who are dedicated to differing activities, among them the making of empanadas, tortillas, sale of firewood and coal, also sale of groceries in a mini market.  They are all from the city of Chilan.  Nancy, who in the picture is in the first row, second from the right, is dressed in a black jacket, pink polo shirt and boots on top of her jeans.  She has been a seamstress for the last 21 years, and has a shop in her home. 
Nancy makes her clothing based on the season and the orders she receives from her customers.  Her customers are frequently students during the school season, for the independence holiday season (Chilean independence day festivities) her clothing is based on native folk attire.  Starting with the month of August her sales increase due to the making, renting and selling of costumes.  In her shop Nancy has the necessary machinery to carry out her craft, an overlock machine, a multipoint and a straight machine.  She says that her sales are doing well. 
She buys her supplies in stores that specialize in sewing supplies.  
With the loan she will buy material, elastic, thread and sequins, specifically supplies to make costumes.
Her goals are to continue working in her business to increase her income.  She would like to perfect her ability to make costumes and she wishes to have a store specializing in the sale and rental of these.
Nancy lives with her husband and two children of 11 and 13 years of age.  Her dreams for her family are for her children to become independent and professionals.  She also finds herself helping her husband with the start of a grocery store business.
Nancy is very happy and grateful with the help that she gets from the Esperanza Fund.  She says that the meetings have been a way to meet and share experiences from different point of view.  This way confidence and solidarity is generated with the other member of the communal bank group.  Besides, the group is very caring and committed.  
Chillán is a community in the south central area of Chile.  The name means " seat of the sun" in mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches.  Chillán is known as the "cradle of the country" or "land of artists", due to several famous persons in Chile's history being born there, as for example the known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to purchase material, elastic, thread and sequins, specifically supplies for the making of costumes.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina tiene 54 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Roberto y tienen una hija ya mayor de edad independiente económicamente. Viven en su propia casa que está situada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Marcelina es comerciante desde hace tiempo, ya que posee una pequeña despensa en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma o por su esposo o hija que los ayuda constantemente. Gracias a esta actividad ellos pueden mantener su hogar, solventar los gastos necesarios y llevar una vida digna y tranquila sin privaciones.
La Sra. Marcelina solicita el credito para poder renovar su almacen y llenarlo de productos para satisfaccion de sus clientes, proporcionándoles mas variedades de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs Marcelina is 54 years old, has been married for some time with Mr. Roberto and they have a grown daughter who is financially independent.  They live in their own home in the city of Encarnación.
Mrs. Marcelina has been a merchant for some time.  She has a small sore in her residence which is attended to by either her or her husband or daughter who constantly helps them out.  Thanks to this activity they can support their home, cover the necessary expenses and have a dignified and quiet life without many hardships.
Mrs. Marcelina is requesting a loan to update her store and stock it with merchandise that will satisfy her customers, providing them with a larger variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to renew the stock of the store.

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es: Ilva casada, su esposo trabaja como conductor le ayuda con los gastos, sus hijos están estudiando, planes a corto plazo que sus hijos se profesionalicen. Mujer trabajadora tiene su propio negocio una pulpería. Desde hace tiempo iniciando con fondos propios, planes a futuro es agrandar su negocio con mayores cantidades para obtener mayores beneficios. Con el préstamo comprara abarrote, granos básicos, accesorio de limpieza, frutas, entre otros productos siendo de gran consumo en las familias nicaragüense.
texts.en: Ilva is married.  Her husband works as a driver and helps her with expenses.  Her children are in school and her short term goals are that her children become professionals.  She is a very hard working woman who has a grocery store.  She started it a long time ago with her own funds.  Her future plans are to expand the business with larger amounts of merchandise in order to obtain larger benefits.  She will use the loan to buy groceries like basic grains, cleaning accessories and fruit, among other products that are much in use among Nicaraguan families.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marjorie Gardenia

texts.es:
Marjorie de 36 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 7 años que estudia en escuela fiscal. Tiene una tienda.

Comenzó su actividad hace un tiempo atrás viendo que por su barrio no había tienda ella decidió abrir su negocio y así tener sus ganancia para solventar los gastos del hogar. Labora sola de 6h00 am a 9H00pm diariamente vendiendo víveres como arroz azúcar y aceite. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería para sus venta en su tienda como arroz por quintales azúcar y aceite para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea construir su casa de cemento y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marjorie, 36, lives in a peri-urban zone of El Fortín in Guayaquil.  She’s single and has a 7-year-old son who goes to public school.  She has a store.

She started her activity some time ago noticing that her neighborhood lacked a grocery store so she decided to open her business to earn profits with which to cover household expenses.  She works alone from 6am until 9pm every day selling foodstuffs like rice, sugar and oil.  

With help from the loan she wants to buy more merchandise to sell in her store like rice by the quintal, sugar and oil to increase profits.  In the future she’d like to build her house out of cement and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Alia's Group

texts.en:
Alia is a caring & supportive lady by nature. She not only carries out her responsibilities as a housewife well but also operates her business selling bed sheets very efficiently. She does this work to support her husband financially. They both help each other to sustain their finances. Her husband also sells bed sheets and he sells rugs. He is a very hard worker. He puts the bed sheets on his bicycle everyday and sells by visiting different areas of the city. They both have no children yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who also sells bed sheets and rugs. With the loan, he will buy bed sheets and rugs in larger quantity to be able to offer more variety to his customers and earn better profits. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Alia is hopeful that an investment will help him make better profits by improving his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets & rugs

loans.name: Clemencia Pilar

texts.es:
Clemencia de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Esa casada y el trabajo haciendo vallas publicitarias tienen dos hijos de 13 y 15 años que estudian en colegios fiscales. Es maestra particular en una institución educativa.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás en una institución educativa ya que ella es licenciada en educación decidió abrir ese tipo de negocio. Ella labora de lunes a viernes de 7H00 am a 14H00 pm con ayuda de tres maestras mas. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillos, pinturas para en un futuro construir otra institución educativa.
texts.en:
Clemencia, 44, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because at its beginning there were many orchid flowers) in Guayaquil.  She is married and her husband works manufacturing advertising fencing.  They have two children who are 13 and 15 years old and attend public school.  She is a private teacher at an educational institution.

She started some time ago working at an educational institution because as a licensed teacher she decided to open that type of business.  She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 2pm with the help of three additional teachers.  

With help from the loan she plans to buy building materials and supplies like cement, bricks and paint to build another educational institution in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
El  Sra. Nidia  tiene una hija mayor de edad pero que aun vive con ellos.
Ella tiene  una lavandería, cuyo servicio cada vez está más en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso y piensa que una remodelacion la ayudaria a poder generar mas capital y poder seguir con su honesto trabajo.
Con la ayuda de su hija  y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio, esfuerzo y por sobre todo con mucha honestidad.
Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadoraq y reposanble a quien el trabajo no la asusta.
Solicita el credito para poder remodelar su lavanderia e invertir un poco en los equipos para poder mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, dando un servicio eficiente y de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Nidia has an adult daughter but she doesn’t live with her anymore.  She has a laundry which is growing more and more every day generating good income.  She thinks that a remodel will help her generate higher income in order to continue working at an honest occupation.

With help from her daughter and all of her family they are getting ahead with much sacrifice and effort but, above all, with much honesty.

She defines herself as a very hard working, responsible person who is not frightened by work.

She asked for the loan to be able to remodel her laundry and to invest a bit in equipment to improve customer service providing efficient and good quality service.

loans.use: to buy items to remodel the laundry as well as laundry supplies.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta  es una persona muy reconocida ya que tiene un puesto en el mercado en donde vende refacciones además es una tejedora muy reconocida en el municipio ya que hace güipiles muy lindo y eso mismo hace que la gente la busque mas, por lo que solicita nuevamente otro crédito par poder invertir en la compra de materia prima,para seguir confeccionanado guipiles ella promete ser puntual en cada pago adema estaría muy agradecida si se la llegara a autorizar otro crédito mas ya que su ultima hija esta por graduarse es por eso que doña Alberta tiene que trabajar mas para que su anhelo se cumpla.
texts.en: Alberta is a very well known person who has a stand in the market selling snacks.  She’s also a very well known weaver in town because she makes very pretty güipiles (traditional Guatemalan skirts) that people seek out.  Because of this, she’s asking for another loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials to continue making güipiles.  She promises to be punctual with each installment.  In addition, she’d be very grateful if another loan were granted because her oldest daughter is about to graduate and Alberta has to work harder to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her textile weaving.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La   Sra. Rafaela, es viuda, tiene  1 hija, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, en forma ambulante, este trabajo le genera un buen dinero, pero pese a eso desea ir progresando con su trabajo.
Con la ayuda de su hija están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación. Ella sueña con poder ampliar la variedad de sus productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes mas tipos de cosmeticos. Desea poder seguir siendo el sustento de su familia continuando con este trabajo tan honesto, que hasta ahora ha sido fuente de sustento de su familia.
Con el día a día, demuestra ser una trabajadora honesta, responsable y con ganas de seguir progresando.
El credito lo utilizara para ampliar las variedades de sus productos, como ser esmaltes, polvos, rubores, rímeles, etc.
texts.en:
Rafaela is a widow.  She has a daughter.  She’s a cosmetics vendor.  This work generates good money but still she wants to continue making progress with her work.

With help from her daughter they are getting ahead with much sacrifice and dedication.  She dreams with being able to expand the variety of her products to offer her customers more types of cosmetics.  She wants to be able to continue to be her family’s source of support continuing in this work that’s honest and which to date has been a source of support for her family.

Day to day she shows herself to be a hard working, honest, responsible person with a strong desire to continue making progress.

She will use the loan to buy more variety of cosmetics like nail polish, powder, blush, mascara, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Bolingo Plus Group

texts.en:
Bolingo Plus is a group of 20 owners of small businesses, chaired by Nzola. Its members are jointly responsible for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Nzola is 45 years old, married, and the father of five children between ages 6 and 21, all attending school. Nzola became a microentrepreneur selling fruits in 1998. Currently earning a profit of US$120 a week, he intends with this loan to buy more fruits for resale in order to reinforce his working capital and increase his profits. Determined to be a successful businessman, Nzola's ambition is to diversify his business by opening a general boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale to increase profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité, fue a iniciativa de la Sra. Celsa, quién vive en  la zona de Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
Las mismas ya formaron parte del Comité Emprendedora de la Fundación Paraguaya.
La Directora General del Comité que se denomina “Mujeres Activas”, es la Sra. Celsa. Ella es una señora luchadora, responsable y muy activa junto con sus compañeras que conforman el grupo. El comité se encuentra en el   Segundo   Ciclo con 25 integrantes, quienes desarrollan diversas actividades, todas en busca de generar mayor ingreso en sus hogares y tratar de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar. Anhelan poder brindarles todo a lo que ellas no pudieron acceder.
Son muy unidas, responsables, trabajadoras y solidarias.
Solicitan el credito para la compra de mercaderias para la venta, las mismas consitirían en: comestibles de primera necesidad: verduras, frutas, arroz, harina, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Ceslsa is the general director of the communal bank, which is called “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women).  She is a tenacious and responsible woman.  She is very active together with her colleagues in the communal bank.  The communal bank is in its second cycle, and it is comprised of 25 women who carry out diverse business activities.  

All of them look to generate greater income for their households, and they try to give their children a better education and well-being.  They strive to be able to give them everything that they were not able to have.  They are very united, responsible, hard-working, and supportive.

They are requesting the loan to buy basic needs food, which includes vegetables, fruit, rice, four, and sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic needs food like vegetables, fruit, rice, four, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Prophète Plus Group

texts.en:
Prophète Plus is a community bank made up of nine micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is JP. These members are united for the same goal to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

JP sells soft drinks in his area located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in the business world for years, selling the same product. After hard work and good management, he succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received seven different loans and has repaid them properly. 

He intends to reinforce the capital with the next loan by adding some more crates of soft drinks. The business gives him a profit of $70.00 every week. 

JP’s ambition is to open a soft drink facility in his environment. He is 37 years old, married and the father of four children whose ages vary between 3 and 15 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some more crates of soft drinks to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Maria Ines; tiene 31 años de edad; la socia es soltera; la socia se dedica a la administración de su restaurante, la socia tiene un restaurante y ella es la que organiza todo en este local, desde que se cocinara día a día, también ve la distribución de las mesas y de la caja, la socia ahora desea invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros insumos  al por mayor  para elaborar los alimentos; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los diferentes platos típicos.
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Maria Ines is a member of the Sr. De Tayancani Communal Bank.  She lives in the Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Maria Ines is 31 years old and single.  She manages her restaurant.  She has a restaurant, and she is the one that organizes everything at this site.  She does the day to day cooking, she sees to setting up the tables, and she is also the cashier.

She now wishes to buy wholesale supplies like rice, sugar, noodles, and other ingredients to make the food.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy the ingredients needed to make the different typical dishes.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan she was granted.  This will allow her to grow with her business and to improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: lto buy supplies to make different typical dishes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana es madre D. 3 hijos y su esposo es taxista en el municipio D. Sumpango Sac, doña Juana es tejedora y también se dedica a sembrar diferentes verduras en esta época ya que aquí en Guatemala en esta época es en donD. se aprovecha  a sembrar ya que esta es la época D. lluvia es por eso que solicita otro crédito para poder invertirlo en agricultura y tejidos ella promete ser puntual en los pagos. El Sueño D. ella es sacar adelante a sus hijos y así mismo ayudar a su esposo.
texts.en: Juana is the mother of three children. Her husband’s a taxi driver in Sumpango Sac.  Juana is a weaver and also grows various seasonal vegetables because here in Guatemala this is the planting season because it’s the time of the rains.  She is asking for another loan to invest in farming and in textiles.  She promises to be punctual with her payments.  Her dream is to move her children ahead and to help out her husband.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and textiles.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel está casado con la señora Susana hace ya varios años, tienen 2  hijos menores que aún están cursando la escuela primaria.
Miguel es taxista, tiene un vehículo propio que había comprado con  mucho esfuezo  sacrificio.
Además de su trabajo,su esposa Susana trabaja como vendedora de ropas que trae provenientes de la Argentina y el Brasil para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar. Ellos viven en una casa modesta, pero propia.
Gracias a su trabajo logran educar y dar lo necesario a sus hijos, ademas de esto pueden compran todas las necesidades de su hogar, tratando de dar a su familia una vida digna y decorosa.
El se define como una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
El Sr. Miguel ya obtuvo créditos con Fundación Paraguaya, y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones. Ahora solicita otro crédito para la compra de ropas, para poder ayudar a su esposa a obtener mayor variedad de mercaderias.
texts.en:
Miguel has been married to Susana for several years.  They have two minor children who are still in elementary school.  Miguel is a taxi driver.  He has his own vehicle, which he bought with much effort and sacrifice.

In addition to his work, his wife, Susana, works selling clothes that she gets from Argentina and Brasil.  She does this to help her husband with the household expenses.

They live in a house that is modest, but it is their own.  Thanks to their work they manage to educate their children and to give them the necessities.  Through their work they are also able to buy the household necessities.  They are trying to give their family a decent and respectable life.  He defines himself as a very responsible person who is honorable about his commitments.   

Miguel has received previous loans with the Fundación Paraguaya.  He met his obligations in an excellent manner.  He is now requesting another loan to buy clothes.  The loan is to be able to help his wife get a greater variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothes to increase the variety of products.

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira is a housewife as well as a working lady. She sews clothes for her neighbor clients and earns a good income from her skills. Her income helps pay the household expenses. She also carries out her household responsibilities very well along with her business. She is very active and performs her daily routine tasks with a great sense of responsibility. 

Sumaira has given birth to four children. Two of them are enrolled in a local school for their education, while the other two are too young and are not of school-going age yet. Her husband is a barber by profession and operates a barber shop. He provides hair cutting and facial services to his clients at good prices. 

Sumaira has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy items such as scissors, face products (creams, masks) and mirrors, etc., for the improvement of his business. He has been doing his business for the past seven years and Sumaira hopes that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy items for a barber shop.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras La Alegria del Chaco, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la  venta de articulos de consumo(despensa o almacén)donde ofrece una variedad de productos a sus clientes. Todas las actividades las realiza con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
En el grupo La Alegria las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras. Con mucho esfuerzo realizan sus tareas para poder dar una vida digna a sus hijos e hijas.
Por medio del credito desean ampliar su pequeña despensa para poder asi tener una mayor variedad de productos ya que hacia la localidad del Chaco no existen muchas despensas y poseer mas variedad seria sinonimo de mas ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras La Alegría del Chaco” (Joy of Chaco Enterprising Women) committee is currently in its fourth cycle.  

María sells consumer goods (grocery store) stocking a variety of products for her customers.  She carries out all her activities with much effort and sacrifice.

In the “La Alegría” group the women are very hard working and, above all, enterprising.   With much effort they carry out their tasks in order to provide a proper life for their sons and daughters.

Through loans they want to expand their small store to have a larger variety of products because in Chaco there aren’t very many stores and having more variety is synonymous with more profits.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Maris Odilia

texts.es: Doña Odilia es madre de 4 niños todos estudiando su esposo es repartidor de gaseosas, todos habitan en el municipio doña Odilia es muy trabajadora y se dedica a tejer y bordar blusas típicas de Sumpango ella necesita otro crédito mas para poder invertir en compra de matria prima para confeccion de ropa tipica ella promete ser puntual en cada pago, al adquirir otro crédito mas le ayudaría a que su negocio creciera ya que  siempre tiene encargos, ella sueña que sus hijos sean personas de éxito y siempre estudiaran.
texts.en: Odilia is the mother of four children all of whom are in school.  Her husband is a soft drink delivery man.  They all live in town.  Odilia is very hard working and is dedicated to weaving and to embroidering traditional Sumpango blouses.  She needs another loan to buy raw materials to make traditional clothes.  She promises to be punctual with each payment.  Acquiring another loan will help her business to grow because she always has pending orders.  She dreams that her children will stay in school and become successful people.

loans.use: to buy weaving raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La sra. Estela tiene 48 años, es soltera tiene 1 hijo menor de edad, que está estudiando.
La sra. Estela es costurera, desde pequeña su madre le habia enseñado la dicha profesion, tiene un local propio, una casa propia, tiene una antigüedad de 10 años en la profesion. Se define como una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, que siempre lucha por brindarle lo mejor a su hijo.
Para perfeccionarse empezó a estudiar corte y confeccion, en vistas a mejorar las condiciones y calidad de su trabajo, gracias a esto pudo formar una clientela ya muy bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar telas de todo tipo y ademas de otros insumos de costura para poder hacer gran variedad de ropas y asi poder innovar a su clientela. Piensa que este crédito la ayudara a obtener una mejor calidad de vida, no solo para ella, sino tambien para su hijo.
texts.en:
Estela is 48 years old, single and has one minor son who is in school.  She is a dressmaker.  Her mother taught her said profession while she was still a little girl.  She has her own locale, a house of her own and has been in business 10 years.  She defines herself as a tenacious, hard working woman who always strives to provide the best for her son.

To perfect her skills she took dressmaking courses aiming at improving her conditions and the quality of her work.  Thanks to this, she was able to establish a well defined customer base.

She is asking for the loan to buy all kinds of fabric as well as other sewing supplies to be able to make a variety of clothes to attract new customers.  She thinks this loan will help her attain a better quality of life not only for herself but also for her son.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La Sra  Perla tiene 38 años, tiene 2 hijos colegiantes. Empezó vendiendo pescado como 10 años y luego viajo a España por 2 años y luego regreso para poner el copetin donde vende todo lo que sea pescado.
Ella se considera una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora. Tiene gran creatividad en la elaboracion de todo tipo de platillos con pescado.
El sueño de la sra Perla es que su hijos sean unos grandes profesionales, y no quiere que sigan sus mismos pasos ya que considera que una vida muy sacrificada, ya que en el comedor donde trabaja se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y empieza la actividad. Su trabajo no tiene fin de semanas ni feriados, es por eso que ella se sacrifica por sus hijos,para que no pasen por eso.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado y demas ingredientes para sus platillos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pearl is 38 years old and has two college age children. She has been selling fish for the past ten years. Before that she traveled to Spain for two years. When she returned she started a café where she sells all types of fish. 
Pearl is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She creatively prepares all types of fish dishes. Mrs. Pearl dreams that her children will be professionals. She doesn’t want them to follow in her footsteps, as she has had to make many sacrifices in life. She wakes up very early in order to work in her café. Her work doesn’t stop on weekends or holidays. This is how she makes sacrifices so that her children do not have to work this way.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy fish and the other ingredients she needs for her dishes.

loans.use: to buy fish and the other ingredients she needs for the dishes that she prepares.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yfenia is one of the members of the Group Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. Yfenia sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories. After her first loan with Esperanza, she expanded her business from clothing sales to many other products. 

After successfully repaying her previous loans and thus taking a step towards expanding her business, Yfenia is very excited to receive her second loan from Esperanza International. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in more of these products and get more clients for her business.  

She tells us that her challenge is to help her two children and husband to improve their lives by saving and bringing extra income to their household. She is planning to reinvest her profits in the business to make it bigger and sustainable. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals and good people.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and accessories

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana, es una pequeña comerciante del municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera, los planes hacia su familia es poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida a sus dos pequeñas hijas, doña Ana desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa, pero en los últimos años la rotación del producto no es muy constante; lo que la llevo a tener un pequeño kiosco donde vende, golosinas, comida rápidas, gaseosas entre otras cosas .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda atrávez de fondo Kiva para que las personas que no cuanta con un capital de trabajo puedan salir y crecer como comerciante .
texts.en:
Ana is a small merchant in the municipality of Ticuantepe.  She’s a single mother.  Her plan for her family is to provide better living conditions for her two small daughters.

For several years now Ana had been selling clothes but during the last few years stock rotation hasn’t been constant which led her to have a small kiosk where she sells snacks, fast food and soft drinks, among other things.

She is grateful for the support provided through Kiva for people who don’t have working capital so that they can get ahead and grow as merchants.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Simma Group

texts.fr:
Mme Dadissa est la représentante du groupe SIMMA. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. Tous les 2 vont à l’école et elle a 2 personnes à sa charge.

Elle vend des chaussures et habits de puis 11ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 30paires de chaussures et 7complets de pagnes.

Elle veut économiser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de pagnes et chaussures.
texts.en:
Madam Dadissa is the representative of the Simma Group.  She is married and the mother of two children.  The eldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 13.  Both attend school and she looks after two others in her household.  

She has sold shoes and clothing for 11 years.  She buys her merchandise at the market in Sector 10 in the city.  Her clients are women.  She would like to purchase 30 pairs of shoes and seven complete outfits.  She wants to save her profits in order to grow her business.  Madam Dadissa aspires to one day open a small boutique for clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pairs of shoes and seven sets of clothing.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es: Olga es madre D. 8 niños 2 casados y 6 solteros su esposo es agricultor al igual que ella además se dedica a tejer güipiles en esta época se dedican a sembrar variedad D. hortalizas es por eso que solicitan un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes semillas y abono y así sacarle provecho a esta época D. invierno ya que el dinero no es suficiente, ellos prometen ser puntuales en los pagos y cumplir con las fechas establecidas  que se le requieran ella estaría muy agradecida si se le autorizara otro crédito mas ya que sueña con que sus 6 hijos que están  a su cargo puedan salir adelante.
texts.en: Olga is the mother of 8 children, two married and six still single.  Her husband is a farmer like her.  In addition, she also weaves güipiles (traditional Guatemalan skirts).  This season they are farming a variety of vegetables and this is why she’s asking for a loan, to buy fertilizer, seeds and manure, to take advantage of the winter season because money is insufficient.  They promise to be punctual with the payments and to honor the established dates that are required of them.  She would be very grateful if another loan were granted because she dreams that the six children she still has in her care will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and manure.

loans.name: Yadira Isabel

texts.es:
Yadira satisfecha con su pasado credikiva, está aplicando el segundo financiamiento  porque sacó nuevos diseños y requiere materiales como cuerina, sinteticos, telas de forros, correderas, herrajes y broches, los cuales planea comprar en volumen para ganardescuentos y vender a precios competitivos. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: " Muy agradecida por el crédito porque fue de mucha ayuda para mi negocio, espero seguir contando con su apoyo para futuros creditos."

Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Yadira ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/223601
texts.en:
Satisfied with her previous CrediKiva, Yadira is requesting a second loan. She found new designs and she needs materials such as imitation leather, synthetic fibers, fabric, lining, zippers, iron decorations and buckles. She plans to buy a great quantity of these products in order to get a discount and then sell her clothes at competitive prices. This is what she would like to say to her Kiva lenders: “I am deeply thankful for the loan because it has been a great help for my activity, and I hope to keep on counting on your support for future loans.”
You can find out more about Yadira’s history following this link: http://kiva.org/lend/223601

loans.use: To buy materials such as imitation leather, synthetic fibers, fabric, lining, zippers, iron decorations and buckles.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Business man.  He is married and has 5 children aged 16,13, 9, 6 and 4. In 2001, he established his DVD and VCD cassettes and DVD players business. 

He began his business because he wants to make himself self-reliant. It is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 10,240,000 every month from this business. He now requires a loan of Le 5,000,000. Le2,000,000 is for buying DVDs and VCDs and Le3,000,000 is for buying a DVD player and laptop.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, he plans to establish a bigger and more modern electronic shop, to build more houses and become an international business man. He also plans to educate his children and send them abroad. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more video cassettes for rental

loans.name: Canquixaja Group

texts.es: El señor Benito Ricardo es casado, tiene 54 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. contar con estudios escolares, tiene 6 hijos 4 D. ellos estudian, se dedica al comercio a la venta D. ropa, inició este negocio siendo vendedor ambulante y lleva 20 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposa quien se dedica a la crianza D. animales domésticos. DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra D. más mercaderías: suéteres, bufandas, gorras, playeras, camisetas, etc. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en: Benito Ricardo is 54 years old, he is married and he has 6 children, four of which go to school, but her himself did not have the chance to study. He engages in selling clothes: a street vendor, he has been engaged in this activity for 20 years, and he can count on his wife’s support, as she engages in breeding animals. He decided to create a group in order to ask for a loan that he will use to buy more products, such as sweaters, scarves, caps, T-shirts and jerseys. The other members of his group engage either in trading or in breeding animals.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, scarves, caps, T-shirts and jerseys.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que trabaja en la venta diaria posee una pequeño almacén donde ofrece una pequeña variedad a todos sus clientes.
Ella trabaja en este rubro hace más de 3 años. Tiene 3 hijos y esta casada hace ya 13 años, ella tuvo conocimiento del programa de comité de Mujeres y al conocer acerca de lo que ofrece, quedó encantada con la idea de formar un grupo de señoras que tengan una misma visión de progreso personal y familiar, desea salir adelante con ellas para que todas crezcan de la misma manera para que asi sus familias tengan una vida digna y decorosa.
El grupo esta formado con 16 señoras que actualmente estan en el 9no ciclo, estas señoras son muy responsables y tienen mucha voluntad de salir adelante gracias a la ayuda que les podria brindar la Fundación Paraguaya.
Solicitan el credito para la ampliacion de la despensa, para poder aumentar la variedad que va a ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works daily in her small store where she can offer a limited variety of goods to her customers.

She has worked in this manner for some 3 years. Maria Luisa has 3 children and has been married nearly 13 years. She learned about the program of “Mujeres” and about what it offers. She was enchanted with the idea of forming a group of women who, having similar vision of personal and family progress, desired to get ahead together, so that everyone could grow in the same manner and their families might lead a dignified and decorous life.

The group is composed of 16 women who are presently in their 9th loan cycle. These women are very responsible and show great drive to advance, thanks to the help the Fundacion Paraguaya can offer.

They are requesting a loan to expand their stock of food, so they can increase the variety of merchandise they offer their customers.

loans.use: buy groceries and other products to resupply the stock of food she offers her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and other tools for his work

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 43-year-old business man.  He is married and has 5 children aged 24, 21, 18, 14 and 10 years. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him because they are his nephews.

In 1993, he established his welding, steel doors and windows business. He began his business because he wants to achieve his dream of independence through apprenticeship. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy steel metals rods. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, he plans to develop a plot of land and give his children good educations. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy steel metal rods for his business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Alicia tiene 32 años de edad; es soltera y tiene una hija de 7  años la cual está cursando el 2do grado de primaria.
La sra. Alicia cuenta con un almacen desde hace 1 año, anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la venta ambulante de articulos de belleza y prendas de vestir, con la ayuda de su familia y con algunos ahorros que poseia, pudo construir una casilla en su domicilio y abrir su propio negocio, ahora ya cuenta con una amplia clientela en su barrio, esto constituye la fuente principal de sus ingresos economicos. Por medio de su pequeña despensa puede procurarse una vida mejor para ella y la de su familia.
Solicita el crédito para abastecer con más productos su pequeño añmacen, quiere poder ofrecer a sus clientes mas variedad a la hora de elegir y además poder generar un poco más de ingresos para su sustento y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia, 32, is single and has a seven year old daughter in the second grade.  Mrs. Alicia has had a store for a year.  She used to sell beauty products and clothing door-to-door.  With some savings and help from her family, she built a small store in her home and opened her business and she has many customers in her area.  This business is her main income and has helped her created a better life for her and her family.  

She is taking out a loan to stock the store with more goods.  She would like to be able to offer her customers more variety to choose from and also earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more products like food and canned goods to fully stock her small store.

loans.name: Veronica Amalia

texts.es: Veronica es madre de 1 linda niña que tiene dos años y medio su esposo es cocinero de un restaurante de la capital, verónica se dedica a tejer Güipiles Típicos ella y le ha ido muy bien en este negocio ya que teje dos en el mes, ella termino de pagar un crédito y fue muy puntual por lo que nuevamente solicita otro para poder comprar hilo por mayor ya que esto le ayudaría a tener mas ganancias ya al comprar hilo por mayor sale mas barato y eso le tendría mucha cuenta, ella sueña en tener en un futuro mayores ingresos y así poder darle estudio a su hija para que sea una persona de bien.
texts.en: Veronica is the mother of one beautiful daughter who is two and a half years old. Her husband is a cook in restaurant in the capital. Veronica weaves güipiles (typical Guatemalan woven blouses). Her business is going well now that she is able to weave two in a month. She has finished paying her loan and was very punctual with her payments. Therefore, she is requesting one again in order to purchase thread. This would help her to earn more profit and purchase the thread at wholesale prices which is cheaper. She dreams of having a larger profit in the future, so that she can give her daughter an education and she can be a good person.

loans.use: purchase thread to make textiles.

loans.name: Munyao

texts.en:
Munyao is a 45-year-old single man. For eleven years, he has been earning a living from his laundry business. Most of his customers are people of his local community. Munyao is known for his good service, and this has helped him to retain his customers. He also farms to generate more income.

Munyao says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his money. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy detergents. He hopes to expand his laundry business in five years.

loans.use: To buy detergents

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La sra. Lucía se dedica a este negocio de panadería desde hace 2 años, anteriormente solo contaba con una despensa y con la ayuda de su pareja pudieron juntar un poco de dinero y  pudieron comprar una modesta panadería, ahora ya cuenta con una camioneta para distribuir los productos que ellos elaboran, además hacen cosas dulces como boquerón, media luna y los comercializa por los barrios de la ciudad siempre ayudada por su pareja.   
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de materia prima como harina, manteca, aceite, anis, levadura para tener suficiente stock para las temporadas en que las ventas aumentan por cambio de clima y por ende aumentar  sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Lucia has been engaging in the bakery activity for 2 years. She previously ran only a small store then, with her life partner’s help, she succeeded in saving money to buy a modest bakery. She now owns a small truck to distribute her products; she also prepares pastries such as Boquerón (typical Paraguayan sweet bread) and croissants, and she sells them in the neighborhoods of her town with her partner’s constant help.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic ingredients such as flour, butter, oil, anise and yeast, in order to stock up her bakery with enough ingredients to face the sales increase in the upcoming seasons, and to consequently increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients such as flour, butter,oil, anise and yeast.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Elena, tiene 22 años y esta casada. Doña Elena se dedica a la venta de articulos en general como frazadas, camperas, buzos, etc.
Doña Elena se dedica a este rubro hace más de 7 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2004; comenzó con el capital que su madrele habia dado para empezar a adquirir sus prendas para luego poderlas vender y asi poder obtener algún ingreso para ella y tambien para la familia.
En la actualidad tiene una pequeña cantidad de mercaderías y clientes formados, y con miras a complacerlos y ofrecerles aun mas variedad, solicita este crédito, es decir, con el mismo podra comprar adquirir mas championes, frazadas, camperas, busos, etc.
texts.en: Elena is 22 years old and married.  For 7 years, from approximately 2004, Elena has worked selling casual clothing such as jackets, sweatshirts, caps, etc.  She began with money that her stepmother gave her,  purchasing her initial inventory and later selling it, and generating an income for herself and her family.   Right now Elena has a small amount of merchandise and an established customer base.  She would like to offer them more variety, and the loan will enable her to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her small clothing business

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es: Angelina es madre de 8 niños el mas pequeño es de 1 año y medio su esposo es albañil del municipio,que esta cerca de la capital de Guatemala, ella se dedica a  tejer fajas y asegura que ha sido un  negocio muy rentable además le ha ayudado a que sus hijos estén estudiando es por eso que solicita un crédito mas, y promete ser puntual en los pagos ya que si se le otorgara ayudaría a invertirlo en hilos y fertilizantes  para sembrar maíz y frijol en esta época  y eso mismo ayudaría a que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y ser personas de éxito.
texts.en: Angelina is the mother of 8 children; the youngest is one-and-a-half years old.  Her husband’s a bricklayer in town which is near Guatemala’s capital.  She weaves sashes and assures us that it’s been a very profitable business.  In addition, it’s helped her keep her children in school.  This is why she is asking for another loan.  She promises to be punctual with all her payments because if the loan were granted it would be helpful to invest in yarn and fertilizer to plant corn and beans this season.  It will also help her children continue studying to become successful people.

loans.use: to buy textile weaving raw materials.

loans.name: Sorbeh United Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sorbeh United” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 4,200,000 for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ibrahim is the leader of this group. He is approximately 30 years old and is married, with three children who attend primary school. Ibrahim sells rice and palm oil (the most favorite cooking oil). With many years of experience in business, Ibrahim is going to use his share of the loan to buy rice and palm oil in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil in large quantities

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Tomas is the coordinator of the Group Dios es mi pastor 5 & 7 (God is my Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. Tomas sells shoes, such as sneakers, casual shoes and slippers, and many cosmetics products. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in both to expand her inventory.

Tomas is very excited to receive her second loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and thus having taken a step towards expanding her business. Her challenges are raising and educating her three children. She lives with them and her long-term partner. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business.

Tomas is a very hardworking and young mother of only 26 years old. She is hoping to make her dreams come true, to have a prosperous life and a good business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Rabassiburkina Group

texts.fr:
Mme Salamata est la responsable du groupe RABASSIBURKINDI. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Il a 4ans. Il ne va pas à l’école d’abord. Elle 1 personne en charge.

Mme vend des condiments depuis 4ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de toécé (un village environnant).Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter un sac de gombo, un sac de potasse et un sac de sel.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider son mari à s’occuper de sa petite famille. Elle a pour ambition d’agrandir son commerce et de scolariser son enfant.
texts.en:
Madam Salamata is the leader of the Rabassiburkindi Group.  She is married and has one child.  He is four years old and has not yet begun going to school.  She supports one additional person.  Salamata has sold seasonings and foodstuffs for four years.  She buys her merchandise at Toécé Market (in a nearby village).  Her clients are women.

She wants to purchase a sack of okra, a sack of potatoes, and a bag of salt.  With the profits, she wants to help her husband in supporting her small family.  She aspires to grow her business and to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of okra, a sack of salt, and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Aristotle

texts.en: Aristotle is married, with 2 school-aged children. He has been a farmer working in the Philippines for 6 years. Aristotle is asking for a loan of PHP 37,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and a variety of seeds for his farm. Aristotle hopes that this loan will expand his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 45,000 for each crop. Aristotle has no other desires in life than to provide a good future for his family by sending his children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en la Ciudad Caaguazú, la Sra Juliana, participo de una reunión informativa por la zona, y le encanto la idea de formar un comité pero en su cuadra con sus vecinas, las mismas se reunierón con mucho entusiasmo, en total son 18 señoras, que actualmente estan en el cuarto ciclo,  cada una realiza su trabajo de forma responsable y con mucho entusiasmo. Ellas poseen las ganas y la responsabilidad que se necesita, se ayudan mutuamente y trabajan en equipo.
Ellas solicitan el credito para la compra de ropas que luego destinarán a la venta, y con lo cual se podran sustentar, no solo a ellas sino tambien a sus familias.
Se ven asi mismas como unas personas que quieren salir adelante y para ello se esfuerzan al maximo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the City of Caaguazú. Mrs. Juliana participated in an informational meeting in the area and loved the idea of forming a committee on her own block with her neighbors, who gathered together with great enthusiasm. They are 18 women in all and are currently in their fourth loan cycle. Each one does her work responsibly and with a great deal of enthusiasm. They have the necessary desire and the responsible nature. They help each other and work together as a team. 

They are seeking the loan to purchase clothing which will then be sold, by which they will be able to support not only themselves but their families as well. 

They see themselves as people who want to get ahead and put out maximum effort to that end.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for sale.

loans.name: Adim Din Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Adim Din” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member in order to expand their respective businesses. 

Kadiatu, 42 years old, is the leader of the group. A native of Matham village, she is married to a tailor and the couple has 5 children – 2 in primary school and 3 in secondary school. 

Kadiatu has been in business for nearly 30 years; she currently sells cigarettes, soaps, biscuits, mints, etc. With the help of a Kiva loan, Kadiatu is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soaps, biscuits, mints, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico is 51 years of age and is married with seven children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. Federico's wife is a housekeeper and vegetable vendor. He is asking for a loan to buy inputs needed for their farm such as fertilizers (manure), corn seeds and pesticides. He will also use the loan to pay for preparing the land. In the future, Federico hopes that his business will earn higher income from the harvest to provide for his family's necessities. He also dreams of his children finishing their education and having good futures.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizers, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos de 34 años de edad, padre ejemplar de un hijo, acompañado de su amada señora, residen en la ciudad de Itá. El junto a su familia se dedica al servicio de taxis en dicha ciudad, hace ya como 6 años. Actualmente tiene dos vehículos en circulación, uno que está en el centro de la comunidad y el otro en el cruce de la compañía de la cuidad de Itá.
Él cuenta que en el negocio le genera muy buena ganancia por el gran movimiento de personas que existe en la zona, lo cual para dar un buen servicios a los pasajeros debe mantener el vehículo en buenas condiciones para poder brindar la comodidad a los mismos. Por todo esto solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de sus automoviles, como así también para las reformas que estos pudieran necesitar.
Su objetivo prioritario es de crecer como micro empresario y de ver a sus hijos ser alguien importante el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos, 34, is a model father of one child, along with his beloved wife. They reside in the city of Itá. Along with his family he works providing taxi services in said city, which he has done for about six years now. Currently he has two vehicles in circulation, one in the community's downtown area and the other at a crossroads in the neighborhood of Itá. 

He tells us that he makes very good earnings in the business because of the great mobility of the people in the area. Therefore in order to provide good service to the passengers he must maintain the vehicle in good condition so that the ride will be comfortable. For these reasons he is seeking the loan to maintain his automobiles, as well as for any reconditioning they may require. 

His priority is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and to see his children be someone important in the future.

loans.use: to maintain vehicles.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married, with 7 children. He has been farming in the Philippines for 34 years. Samuel is asking for a loan to acquire corn seed to be planted on his farm and fertilizers such as manure.  At present, Samuel earns only PHP 40,000 for each crop. He uses his earnings from the yield to pay his obligations to the merchants. Samuel hopes that this loan will expand his operations. He hopes for additional earnings from the yield to provide for his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: No One Knows Tomorrow Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born 45 years ago in Magburaka. She is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. With nearly thirty years of experience in business, Fatmata sells biscuits, batteries, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. 

This is not the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan, however, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy biscuits, batteries, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Cerrito, se conformo gracias a su presidenta, la Sra Antolina, ella se informó del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 10º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Es un excelente grupo, gracias al  trabajo solidario realizado continuan trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
La Sra Antolina se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, desde muy pequeña, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, logro aprender este oficio y hoy en día esto ya le sirve de sustento no solo a ella sino a toda su familia.
Ella olicita el credito para la compra de los elementos que utilizaran para sus artesanias, es decir, todo aquello indispensable para la realizacion de sus obras como telas, pinturas, agujas y demás.
Esta segura que con la ayuda que le podra brindar la Fundacion Paraguaya podrá seguir con sus tareas e ir sumando clientes y aumentar sus ingresos, para poder tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The “Cerrito” (Little Hill) women’s committee was formed on 24 March 2008 thanks to Antoliana who sells crafts and contacted the advisor who had a group in the same zone.  She learned about the Enterprising Women’s Committee Program and managed to get 17 women together who are working comfortably in their 10th cycle now together and unified within the program. It is an excellent group; thanks to the supportive work they do they continue working with the program to date.

Since she was a little girl, Sra. Antolina has worked making artisinal crafts. Thanks to the training her mother gave her, she succeeded in learning this trade and today her income supports not only her but her entire family. She is asking for the loan to buy the supplies she need for their crafts, that is, everything indispensible for her work such as fabric, needles, and paints.

They are sure that with help from Fundación Paraguaya they will be able to continue with their tasks, add customers and increase income to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, needles, and paints

loans.name: Tabasineh Ii Group

texts.en:
Gbassay is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Gbassay was born in a place called Marah, in northern Sierra Leone. The 35-year-old is married to a schoolteacher and the couple has two children: one in primary school and one in secondary school. 

For 18 years now, Gbassay has been selling fish, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. This is not the first loan that Gbassay and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Gbassay will use her share of the loan (SLL 700,000) to expand her business. She  will buy fish, onions, margi, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy fish, onions, margi, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy manure.

loans.name: Kalamera Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Kalamera” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu. Mariatu is age 37. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a driver and two of her children are attending secondary school. For many years now, Mariatu has been selling market food including onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice, salt, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, Mariatu will buy the above- mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi, rice, salt, sugar, etc. in large quantity to add to her stock

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is 42 years old and married. He is blessed with three children, all of whom are studying. Rolly is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 15 years. Rolly is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds of corn to be planted on his farm. Rolly hopes that this loan will grow his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 40,000 each crop in this field of work. Rolly wants to enlarge his farm to earn a higher income and continue sending his children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to acquire farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Lunsar Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Lunsar Group. They are petty businesswomen in the northern town of Magburaka. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones each in order to expand their respective businesses both in terms of size and quality. 

The 35-year-old Isatu is the leader of the group. Isatu sells drinks, foodstuffs, batteries, soaps, etc. Isatu is requesting this loan in order to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, foodstuffs, batteries, soaps, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Galo Evaristo

texts.es:
Galo Evaristo tiene 42 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofia, pertewneciente al Canton Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agricolas deciclo corto siembra de maiz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Galo se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener casa propia y terrenos.

Le gusta hacer deporte y caminar con los padres.
texts.en:
Galo Evaristo is 42 years old, single and lives with his parents, he has no children. He lives in the Ventanas area, province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank is called October 27, it is located in the San Sofia neighborhood, part of the Ventanas area, they work in short cycle agriculture corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Galo works in agriculture, especially in corn, rice and beans. He buys his items each month in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same area.

He needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The support from the loan will help him to meet his economic needs. Galo faces different challenges like plagues and diseases that hurt his crops. His dream is to have his own home and land.

He enjoys sports and walking with his parents.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Bisimilia Group

texts.en:
Alie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alie was born in Magburaka town, about 40 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Alie sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, groundnuts/peanuts, etc. 

With the help of this loan Alie and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. Alie will use his share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone leones) to buy palm oil, rice, groundnuts, etc., in larger quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, groundnuts, etc., in larger quantities to add to his business.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is 57 years of age and is married with nine adult children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. Melecio's wife is a housekeeper, and at the same time, she is planting and harvesting vegetables to sell. 

Melecio is asking for a loan to buy inputs needed in his farm such as fertilizers (like manure) and seeds of corn. He will also use the loan to pay for the services of land preparation of his farm. Of his nine children, only two have not yet finished their education. 

In the future, Melecio hopes that his business will earn a higher income from the yields to continue sending the last two children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of corn for his farm.

loans.name: Felix Alfredo

texts.es:
Felix Alfredo tiene 35 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofia, perteneciente al Canton Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agricolas de ciclo corto siembra maiz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Felix se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz, frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y tener casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felix Alfredo is 35 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children. He lives in the Ventanas area, province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank is called October 27, it is located in the San Sofia neighborhood, part of the Ventanas area, they work in short cycle agriculture corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Felix works in agriculture, especially in corn, rice and beans. He buys his items each month in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same area.

He needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The support from the loan will help him meet his economic needs. Felix faces different challenges like plagues and diseases that hurt his crops. His dream is to have his own land and home.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Tamemkoh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Tamemkoh Group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They run small businesses and have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Fatmata. Fatmata was born in Magburaka town, 36 years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a teacher. Three of her children are attending primary school and two are in secondary school. Fatmata has been selling bowls and buckets for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more bowls and buckets to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more bowls and buckets to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to build a room.

loans.name: Sorry For Me I I Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sorry For Me II” Group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to invest in their respective businesses. 

Idrissa is the leader of this group. Idrissa is 40 years old and married with seven children – four in primary school and three in secondary school. Idrissa is a local dealer in gold. He also sells rice and palm oil (the country's most popular cooking oil). With his share of this loan, Idrissa is going to buy gold, rice and palm oil to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy gold, rice and palm oil to add to his business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a farmer and a tricycle operator. Marites is a farmer working in the Philippines. She has been growing corn for 22 years. 

Marites is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos to purchase fertilizers (like manure) and seeds of corn to be planted in her farm. She wants to maintain her agricultural business for the future of her family. Getting high yields and income are her desires to attain her daughter's wish of going abroad to help them uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Normal Isabel

texts.es:
Norma de 38 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Empezó con la tienda ya que por el sector donde vive no había otros negocios de venta de víveres. 

Poco a poco fue incrementando la mercadería y víveres para que sus clientes hasta ahora que sigue con su pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vende arroz, aceite, azúcar etc. su esposo también trabaja es maestro albañil. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques. 

En el futuro quiere ampliar la tienda.
texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old, she is a hardworking woman who has a small store in the front part of her home. She started her store in an area where there weren’t any other grocery store businesses.

Little by little, she began to increase her merchandize and supplies for her customers that go to her small store in the front of her home. Norma sells rice, oil, sugar, etc. her husband also works as a master mason. Norma has many hopes for her business which is why she needs the loan to be able to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

In the future Norma would like to expand her store.

loans.use: buy cement, concrete blocks, and sand.

loans.name: United Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “United Tamemsu” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are bothl local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leone leones each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Lucy is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have two children who are attending primary school. Lucy has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells cigarettes, biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, soaps, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, biscuits, toothpastes, toothbrushes, soaps, etc., wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Channel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "CHANNEL". Está ubicado en Puebla, en México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Ma D. los Angeles es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 44 (años), estudió hasta el primer año D. primaria y es comerciante. Ella elabora y venD. donas y empanadas en su comunidad afuera D. las escuelas y en diferentes lugares, es casada , inicio el negocio hace 4 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. insumos como (azucar, leche, harina D. trigo y huevos etc.) para la elaboración D. su producto y así comprar en cantidades más grandes y a mejor precio, ya que ha tenido mucha demanda y tiene pensado contrar a una persona que le ayuD. para brindar un mejor servicio. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente con mas animos D. seguir adelante y muy contenta por la oportunidad D. adquirir este prestamo para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y apoyar en los gastos familiares.
texts.en: This communal bank is named “Channel” it is maD. up of 10 people and located in Puebla, México. Mrs. Ma D. los Angeles is a member; she is 44 years old, studied up to first graD. and is a salesperson. She works selling doughnuts and wraps in her neighborhood outsiD. of schools and in other places. Mrs. Ma D. los Angeles  is married and has been in this traD. for 4 years. She needs the loan to buy supplies like sugar, milk, wheat flour, eggs and other items to make her products, and to buy in greater quantities to have better prices. She has had a lot of demand for her goods and is thinking of hiring someone to help her give better service to her customers. At the time of asking for the loan she is even more optimistic about getting ahead as well as being very happy for the opportunity of receiving this loan to give her family a better quality of life and to help meet the household expenses.

loans.use: buy supplies like sugar, milk, wheat flour, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis Huberto tiene 19 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofía, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz, frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos y los precios del mercado. Su sueño es tner una finca y comprar un vehiculo.

Le gusta estar con los padres y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Huberto is 19 years old, is single and lives with his parents, he has no children.
