loans.name: La Merced (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La Merced.
 
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que hasta la fecha tienen. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, agricultura, etc.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Margarita, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, dos son independientes y el menor estudia medicina en Cuba. Su esposo es Abogado.

Ella es Lic. En Ciencias De la Educación y trabaja de maestra en un colegio en la ciudad de Tosagua, también se dedica a la venta de productos de Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja vendiendo sus productos los fines de semana en las tardes  y noches cuando puede, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas ya que ahí ella compra a mitad de precio y luego las vende a precio real y con esto le queda mejores ganancias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. son siete meses que se  dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su meta es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the communal bank "La Merced", made up of 15 members, meets in the residential area known as Los Jazmines in the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí capital known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.  This group is comprised of people who decided to unite and form this communal bank which is very helpful since the loans allow them to improve their small businesses.  They are involved in different activities such as commerce, services, agriculture, etc.

Here we meet Mrs. Margarita, 50, who is married and has three adult children, two of whom are independent while the youngest studies medicine in Cuba.  Her husband is a lawyer.  She has a degree in Education and works as a teacher at the school in the city of Tosagua.  She also sells Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She sells her products on the weekends and in the evenings when she can.  She takes advantage of the offers since she can buy at half price and then sell at the real price, so earns a good profit.  She delivers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been in this business for seven months and it is going well for her.

The loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  This is her first term in the communal bank which she likes because loans are granted quickly and without many requirements.

Her goal is to own a bazaar.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana mujer trabajadora, casada, tiene estudiando a su hijo, en estos momentos requiere mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda, con su propio negocio de venta de ropa  que lo inicio desde hace un tiempo con fondos de micro créditos vendiendo menores cantidades de productos. A la actualidad vende mayores cantidades y variedad. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio e nivel de vida. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: perlines, láminas de zinc, golosa,  estribu entre otros para el cambio del techo de la casa obteniendo protección y comodidad.
texts.en: Ana, a hard-working woman, has a son in school and is currently in need of home improvement.  She has her own business selling clothing which she set up some time ago with micro loans and by selling small quantities of items.  She now sells more volume and variety.  She is grateful to the institution for the support that has helped her develop her business and improve her lifestyle.  The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as: profiles, zinc sheeting, studs, and supports, among other items, to change the roof on her house for better protection and comfort.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Aguilas De Atenco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Aguilas de Atenco" este grunpo esta conformado por 10 integrantes, se ubica en el estado de México. La señora Kenia tiene 28 años de edad, estudio una carrera tecnica, tiene una hija de 8 años, es casada, tiene una tienda escolar que inicio cuando nacio su hija ya que queria dedicarle tiempo a su hija y así ofrecerle una mejor vida. Pide este prestamo para comparar articulos escolares para su negocio, dulces y alimentos que le so0licitan los niños de la escuela. Ella se siente feliz ya que puede aportar a su casa y familia el apoyo economico que necesitan para darle una buena vida a su familia y así poder invertir mas en la tienda siendo el sustento de su familia y poder ahorrar para cualquier emergencia que se presente.
texts.en: This group, called "Aguilas de Atenco", is comprised of 10 members and located in the state of México.  Mrs. Kenia, 28, has a technical education, an 8-year-old daughter and is married.  She has a school supplies store that she began when her daughter was born since she wanted to dedicate time to her daughter and give her a better lifestyle.  She is requesting a loan to buy school supplies for her business and sweets and snacks that she gets requests for from the school children.  She is happy to be able to contribute economic support to the household and improve the family's quality of life.  She wants to invest more in her store and be able to save for whatever emergency may arise.

loans.use: To buy school supplies, sweets and snacks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw material for weaving

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Zenobia; tiene 19 años de edad; la socia es soltera; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa la socia trabaja viajando a diferentes lugares como Cusco, Lima para comprar ropa al por mayor para la venta, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y desea prosperar, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de ropa al por mayor  para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa ala por mayor.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SR. DE TAYANCANI".  She lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

Zenobia, 19, is single and buys and sells clothing, working in different places around Cusco.  Lima is where she buys wholesale clothing for resale.  She is a hard worker and wants to get ahead.  The loan will be used to buy wholesale clothing.

She is very grateful for the loan since it will help her expand her business and improve her lifestyle.  She is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tosi (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tosi está formado por 5 mujeres y un hombre quienes viven por el centro y alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad fue nombrada en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio de la humanidad por su belleza arquitectónica, su cultura y tradiciones, su gente es amable y cordial como nuestras socias quienes son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras que trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias. 

Una de las socias es la Señora Rosa, ella vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es su primer crédito que lo realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga.

Tiene 36 años, es casada y ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 11, 7 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad.
 
Doña Rosa tiene un restaurante,  trabaja todos los días de domingo a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, se dedica a  este negocio hace 4 años.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en al compra de víveres y vajillas para su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un restaurante más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank Tosi consists of five women and one man who live in the center and outskirts of the city of Cuenca. In December of 1999, this city was named a world heritage site because of its beautiful architecture, its culture, and its traditions. Its people are kind and cordial, like our communal bank members, who are hard-working and entrepreneurial women who work in different businesses that allow them to support their household finances and advance with their families.

One of the members is Señora Rosa. She lives in the Totoracocha sector of the city of Cuenca. This is the first loan she has taken out in the communal bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She is 36 years old and has four children, ages 21, 11, 7, and 5. Her oldest son works and helps her financially. Her second child, a daughter, studies in secondary school, and her two youngest children attend a city school. Her husband works as a security guard.

Doña Rosa has a restaurant. She works every day of the week from 9 in the morning until 8 at night. She has been working in this business for four years. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of provisions and table service for her business. Her goal is to have a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: to buy provisions and table service.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth vive en Guanacaste, específicamente en la bella comunidad de Ostional.
Ella vive de la agricultura, pero su salario no es suficiente para arreglar su casa, y el problema es que ya se aproximan la época lluviosa. Es por eso que necesita un préstamo de ₡600 000(seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de  Zinc, madera y los materiales necesarios para reconstruir su techo.
Ella es  socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostional, una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Guanacaste, specifically, in the beautiful community of Ostional.

She earns a living from farming, but doesn't make enough to afford repairs on her home. This is a problem because the rainy season is approaching, so Elizabeth needs a loan of 600,000 CRC to buy corrugated iron sheets, wooden beams, and other materials to reconstruct her roof. 

She is a client of Crédito Comunal de Ostional, one of 110 Community Credit Enterprises (CCEs) funded by EDESA microcredit services in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy corrugated iron sheets and wood for roofing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inventory for store (sweets, soft drinks, juices and canned foods)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un emprendedor de la comunidad rural de Ostional.
El tiene su propio negocio, una venta de alimentos para animales domésticos. Hasta el momento su idea ha tenido mucho éxito a tal punto que hoy necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de mas mercadería (alimentos, concentrados, vitaminas para animales)  para vender en su negocio, ya que la demanda es cada vez mayor. El espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  
El socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostional, una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carlos is an entrepreneur in the rural community of Ostional.  He has his own business selling pet food.  So far his idea has been very successful, to the point where he needs a loan of 500,000 CRC to buy merchandise (food, concentrates, and vitamins for pets) to sell in his store since demand is increasing.  He hopes to offer better service to his customers.

He is a member of the Ostional Communal Loan group, one of the 110 lending members of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy pet food.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Don Ines se dedica a la agricultura desde hace barios años,el siembra,maiz frijol etc, el nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le a hido bien en sus cultivos ahora el quiere sembrar un poco mas ya que tiene la oportunidad de dedicarse solo a la agricultura por eso el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono y de la misma manera comprar un poco mas de semillas, le sueño de el es darles lo mejor a sus hijos para que tengan mejores aportunidad en el futuro.
texts.en: Ines has been a farmer for many years.  He grows corn, beans, etc.  He tells us that thanks to God he has done well with his crops.  He now wants to plant a bit more since he has the opportunity to dedicate himself only to farming and this is why he’s asking for this loan to buy manure and to have a bit more seed.  His dream is to provide the best for his children so that they will have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es de la comunidad Rural de Ostional, es  conocida por ser una mujer muy trabajadora.
Rosa ha estado teniendo problemas con su casa de habitación, ya que esta por empezar la sesión lluviosa,  y el techo esta en muy mal estado. Es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de Zinc y madera para arreglar el techo de su casa.
Ella está muy contenta, ya que en la comunidad existe la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo como este, ya que de otra manera seria muy difícil.
texts.en:
Rosa is from the rural community of Ostional and is known as a hard-working woman.  She is having problems with her house because of the rainy season and the roof is in a very bad state, so she is requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC to buy zinc and wood to repair the roof.

She is very happy to be able to receive a loan like this in her community because it would be very difficult otherwise.

loans.use: To buy wood and zinc for her roof.

loans.name: Alianza Unida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Alianza Unida esta formado por 12 mujeres, quienes son muy amables, trabajadoras y luchadoras, cada una de nuestras socias laboran en diferentes actividades  que les permiten ayudar y mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. 

Una de las socias es la Señora. Wilma, ella vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca. Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana.
 
Tiene 39 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 18 y 13 años de edad, sus dos hijos son casados e independientes y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial y labora en su propio taller, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.
 
Doña Wilma labora como empleada privada, se encuentra en este trabajo hace 11 años y labora de lunes a viernes.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos detalles.

Las tres fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de tres socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes en la reunión que se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alianza Unida" is comprised of 12 women who are kind, hard workers who struggle to get ahead.  Each one of our members works in a different activity which helps support and improve their household economy.  They live in different places around the city of Cuenca which is the third largest in the county.  Its architecture is a blend of colonial and modern and its people maintain the culture and traditions.

One of the members is Mrs. Wilma who lives in the center of Cuenca.  This is her first loan through the communal bank, which her sister invited her to join.  She is 39, married and has three children, ages 19, 18 and 13.  Two of her children are married and independent and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic and works in his own shop.  Together they have been able to build their own house.

Doña Wilma has been a private sector employee for 11 years and works Monday through Friday. She plans to use the loan to buy consumer goods for the household.  Her goal is to finish her home because some things are still missing.

The small photos are of the three members who could not be present for the group picture due to work obligations.

loans.use: To buy consumer goods.

loans.name: Piñafor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; El socio vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Piñafor; tiene 35 años de edad; la socia es casado; el socio tiene 5 hijos, el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de carne al por mayor, el socio trabaja comprando ganados vacunos del camal del poblado, el luego los troza o los vende según sea el pedido de los diferentes clientes, el socio les provee carne al por mayor y es bien conocido en el pueblo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carne al por mayor.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SR. DE TAYANCANI".  He lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco.

Mr. Piñafor, 35, is married and has five children.  He buys and sells meat wholesale.  His work involves buying cattle from the village herd which he later butchers and sells on an order basis to customers, as he is well-known in the village.  He is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale meat.

He is very grateful for the loan which will allow him to incease business and improve his lifestyle.  He is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale meat.

loans.name: Jose Filadelfo

texts.es: Jose trabajador, honesto, junto a su esposa tiene los planes de que sus hijos se profesionalicen. Tiene como proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, perlines, bloques, piedras cantera, camisa, piedrines, golosa, ladrillo, tablones, hierro, persiana entre otros materiales. agradeciendo a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo del nivel vida, mejorando la comodidad, seguridad de su familia.
texts.en: Jose, who is a hard and honest worker, has plans with his wife to make sure their children become professionals.  He wants to improve his home's infrastructure and will use the loan to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, profiles, blocks, quarry stones, liners, gravel, studs, bricks, planks, iron and blinds, among other things.  He is grateful to the institution for the support which will allow him to improve his lifestyle and ensure his family's comfort and safety.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; EL  socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La socia Yovanna; tiene 22 años de edad; la socia es soltera; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de frutas, la socia tiene este pequeño negocio y se dedica desde hace 2 años a trabajar como comerciante minorista, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas al por mayor para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas.

 La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Sr. de Tayacani". She lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

Her name is Yovanna. She is 22 years old and she is single. She is dedicated to the buying and selling of fruit. She has had this small business for the past 2 years, working as a retailer. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of fruits in wholesale to resell. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan that has been granted to her. It will help her to grow her business and to improve the quality of her life. She is committed to making her loan payments at on schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fruits.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la comunidad de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia que es de clima frió, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Se caracterizan por ser personas muy amables y trabajadoras.
 
Doña María tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 24, 20, 18, 16 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segunda hija ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa, su tercera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su cuarta hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, a su ultimo hijo no le gusta el estudio por lo que pasa en casa. Su esposo labora fuera del país, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora María tiene una pequeña fábrica en donde elabora postes de hormigón, esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años y trabajan de lunes a sábados. También en su casa se dedica a la cría de chanchos, cuyes y gallinas.

Este es su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y hierro para fabricar los postes y así continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es que su fábrica crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Junventud", meaning "New Youth". She lives in the Del Valle parish. This parish is of cold climate and the population retain their culture and traditions. They are dedicated to commerce, animal farming, and agriculture. They are known to be very kind and hardworking people.

Maria is 42 year old, married, and from her common-law marriage she has had 5 children, now aged 24, 20, 18, 16, and 13. Her eldest son is married and independent. Her second daughter helps her with the household chores. Her third daughter works and contributes financially. Her fourth daughter attends high school in the city. And her youngest dislikes school so he stays at home. Her husband works outside of the country. They don't have a house of their own so they rent their home.

Maria has a small manufacturing plant where she makes utility posts. She has had this business activity for the past 2 years and she works from Monday to Saturday. She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, and poultry.

This is her fifth loan that she has with her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of cement, sand, and steel to make posts and to continue on with her business.

Her goal is to make her manufacturing plant grow more each day.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and scrap materials.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Vive en Sabanagrande, municipio localizado en el departamento del Atlántico a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, es padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 9 años, con los  sueña tengan éxito futuro. En Sabanagrande Pedro es muy conocido debido a que tiene el negocio de vender comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, hamburguesas y chuzos de carne, pollo y embutidos, en un vehículo que instaló inicialmente en una esquina muy cerca a su casa, donde ha acreditado una buena clientela y creció paulatinamente hasta llegar a comprar el lote y construir su propio local. Su meta más adelante es hacer mejoras locativas, para lograr ofrecer un lugar confortable a sus clientes y potenciar su crecimiento. Su mayor desafío es el capital con el que cuenta porque se torna insuficiente para realizar todos sus planes. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará salsas, e insumos para la preparacion de las comidas rápidas, porque proyecta aumentar sus ingresos en un 15%, pues  tiene un buen potencial de crecimiento y sus razones financieras muestran una liquidèz que le permite cumplir los compromisos a corto plazo y adquirir otros, a un plazo mayor.
texts.en: Pedro lives in Sabanagrande, a municipality located in the department of Atlantico, at 30 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. He is the father of 3 children between the ages of 6 and 9. His dreams for them is to have a successful future. In Sabanagrande, Pedro is very well known given that he has a business selling fast foods, such as hot dogs, hamburgers, kebabs, chicken, and sausages form a cart. It was initially set up at a corner very near his house where he earned a good clientele. His business grew gradually until he managed to purchase a lot of land where he built his own restaurant. His goal for the future is to make improvements to his restaurant to offer his clients a more comfortable space and to stimulate growth. His greatest challenge is the insufficient working capital he has available for all of his plans. His Kiva loan is the first loan he has accessed with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it he will purchases condiments and ingredients to prepare fast foods. He hopes to increase his profits by 15%. He has a good growth potential and his finances are fluid enough to meet the short term commitments and to work towards greater goals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and ingredients to prepare fast foods.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; El socio vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Juan; tiene 45 años de edad; la socia es conviviente; el socio tiene 6 hijos, el socio se dedica a la construcción, el socio trabaja como albañil y siempre esta tras de las contrataciones en las obras grandes, el socio desea invertir el credito en la compra de herramientas, el socio implementara sus herramientas de trabajo, el socio solicita el prestamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo para el uso diario en las diferentes obras en las que lo contratan.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Here is a member from the communal bank "Sr. de Tayancani". He lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

His name is Juan. He is 45 years old and he is married common-law. He has 6 children. He works in the construction sector, working as a construction worker. He is always in search for the large construction projects. He wishes to invest his loan in the purchase of tools. He will use his tools in his work. He requests a loan to purchase working tools to use daily in the various projects that he is contracted to do.

He values and is infinitely grateful for the loan that has been granted to him. It will help him grow his business and improve the quality of his life. He is committed to making his loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase work tools.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
mOscar, es un joven que vive en la comunidad de Ostional. Es un joven muy respetuoso y le gusta mucho trabajar.
El está a punto de iniciar la universidad y desea comprar una computadora y varios libros que son muy necesarios para los cursos que tiene que llevar, es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de ₡598 000 (quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones) para la compra de la computadora, libro y otros materiales didácticos que necesita para sus cursos.
Oscar  está muy contento porque va a estudiar y podrá tener mejores oportunidades para superarse.
El socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostional, una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who lives in the community of Ostional. He is a very respectful young man and he very much enjoys to work.

He is ready to start going to university and he wants to purchase a computer and various books that are very important for the courses that he wants to take. He needs a loan of 598 000 (five hundred and ninety-eight thousand colones) to purchase a computer, books, and other school supplies that he needs for his courses.

Oscar is very happy because he will be studying and he will be able to have better opportunities to improve himself. He is a member of the communal bank "Ostional", one of the 110 credit organizations which are members of EDESA (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and other school supplies.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la comunidad de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Se caracterizan por ser personas muy amables y trabajadoras.
 
La Señora María tiene 23 años, es casada y ha concebido una hija de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una fábrica de bloques, no tienen casa propia por lo que están viviendo en casa de su suegra pero independientes.

Doña María labora en la agricultura, cultiva los campos de otras personas. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y chanchos a los que los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y esta contenta de tener muy buenas amigas en el, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y chanchos para segir con su negocio.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Juventud", meaning "New Youth". She lives in the community of Del Valle Parish. This parish is of a cold climate and the population retain their culture and traditions. They are dedicated to commerce, livestock farming and agriculture. They are known to be very kind and hardworking people.

Maria is 23 years old, married, and she has a 3-year old daughter. Her husband works at a construction block manufacturing plant. They don't have a house of their own so they live with her mother-in-law, although they are independent.

Maria works in agriculture, working fields belonging to others. At home, she raises poultry, guinea pigs, and pigs which she sells in her community.

She is on her sixth loan with her communal bank and she is happy to have such good friends there. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry, guinea pigs, and pigs to keep up her business.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortensia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del Distrito de Calleria, departamento De Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde el año 2000, todos sus préstamos le han servido para poder ayudar económicamente a su esposo que es operador de maquinas pesadas.  Sus préstamos fueron invertidos en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y lo realiza de forma ambulatoria (en la esquina de su casa).
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 docena de platos medianos de loza, 6 jarritas de vidrio de medio litro, 2 paquetes de bolsas, 1 saco de carbón, 3 fuentes de fierro enlozado, 6 manteles  de tela, 2 paquetes de servilletas.
"Manuela Ramos otorga préstamos a las socias para que trabajen y puedan mejorar su calidad de vida".  Hortencia está muy contenta porque está mejorando su economía y gracias a las ganancias de su negocio puede solventar otros gastos. 
En la foto se muestra atendiendo a sus clientes, la foto está algo oscura debido a que fue tomada de noche.
texts.en:
Hortensia is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Solidarias", meaning "Unified Women", of the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old, married, and she has three children. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) since the year 2000. All of her loans have helped her to support her husband financial. He is an operator of heavy machinery. Her loans have been invested in her business. She sells prepared foods and she sells from a cart (located in the corner of her house).

With her new loan in the amount of S./2000 nuevos soles she will purchase: 1 dozen medium-sized porcelain dishes, 6 half-liter pitchers, 2 packages of bags, 1 sack of charcoal, 3 kettles, 6 fabric table cloths, 2 packages of paper napkins.

Manual Ramos grants loans to members to help them work and to improve their quality of life. Hortencia is very happy because she is improving her finances and thanks to the profits earned through her business she is able to cover other expenses.

In the photo, she is serving a client. The photo is dark because it was taken in the evening.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, kettles, and other implements.

loans.name: Miriam Marlene

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de cuatro años. El marido es chofer. Ella lleva en el banco comunal cinco ciclos, es la tesorera del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que además de ser vendedora también dirige a un grupo de vendedoras ya que ella es líder de un grupo, nos cuenta que deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y luego ella tiene que distribuir a todo su grupo, ella como líder de grupo trabaja más y también gana un porcentaje por las ventas de todas las integrantes del grupo. Tiene más de un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Su sueño es tener una distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
In the community of 30 de Septiembre in the village of Rocafuerte, the members of the communal bank "Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro" meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the villagers, known throughout the country.

Here we meet Miriam. She is 21 years old and she is married common-law. She has a four-year old daughter. Her husband is a driver. She has been with her communal bank for five loan cycles. She is the treasurer and she appreciates the benefits that she receives from the institution.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own income, sells Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She works every day. In addition to being a salesperson she also directs a group of salespeople, as the leader of a group. She tells us that she sells her products on credit and she takes payments every two weeks. She receives the products at home and she later distributes them to the other members of her group. She has more than one year in the business and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and jewelry.

Her dream is to open a distribution centre for this products.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Las Rosarinas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lina es secretaria del grupo LAS ROSARINAS  son  07 socias  ellas viven en San Martín D. Porras -  Lima Perú, Lina es casada  tiene 04 hijos  con el negocio que ella tiene pueD. ayudar a solventar algunos gastos familiares y así ayudar a su esposo. Su librería bazar se llama “GISEL” que es el nombre D. una D. sus hijas  empezó a trabajar por que quería ser independiente y fue por medio D. un familiar que se animo a poner ese tipo D. negocio  los útiles escolares y  las fotocopias tienen demanda todo el año por la época escolar  estos ingresos le permiten  cubrir los gastos  D. sus hijos sobretodo  sus estudios,  su meta próxima es ampliar su librería  sobretodo el bazar quiere tener mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes  también incursionar el rubro D. productos D. limpieza  para esto que invertirá su préstamo ya que desea seguir progresando.
texts.en: Lina is the secretary of the group "Las Rosarinas". They are 7 members and they live in San Martin D. Porras, in Lima, Peru. Lina is married and she has 4 children. Through her business she is able to help cover some of the family's expenses, to help her husband. She has a bookstore gift shop is called "Gisel". It is the name of one of her daughters. She started working because she wanted to be independent and she was encouraged by a family member to set up this type of business. School supplies and photocopies are in demand all year by the schools. This income helps her cover her children's expenses, especially for their schooling. Her next goal is to improve her bookstore and gift shop to have more products to offer her clients. She also wants to start selling cleaning products. She will invest her loan in all of this to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning supplies for resale.

loans.name: Teresa Maricely

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Teresa, ella tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 7 años de edad de los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es cerrajero.

Ella realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo que es un negocio familiar, tienen un taller de cerrajería en el cual realizan una gran cantidad de trabajos con el metal, fabrican ventanas, puertas, techos, cerramientos, entre otros trabajos, trabajan de lunes a sabados con la ayuda de una persona y cuando tiene bastantes trabajos hasta dos personas más a  quienes  les paga su sueldo semanal, los materiales para su trabajo los compra en Portoviejo y a veces trabaja sin materiales solo la mano de obra.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales como varillas de hierro, laminas de metal, techos y soldaduras. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener una ferretería bien surtida.

En la foto nuestra socia tiene en sus brazos a un bebé, pero este no es su hijo.
texts.en:
In the community of 30 de Septiembre in the village of Rocafuerte, the members of the communal bank "Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro" meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the villagers, known throughout the country.

Here we meet Teresa. She is 34 years old, married, and she has three children from her relationship. They are 12, 10, and 7 years old. They are in high school and in primary school. Her husband is a welder.

She takes out loans for her husband's business; it is a family business. They have a metal shop where they carry out large numbers of projects, working with metal to make windows, doors, roofing, latches, and others. The work from Monday to Saturday and they have one person working for them. When they have a large number of projects they have up to two others more working for them. They pay them their wages every week. They buy the materials for their shop in Portoviejo and sometimes they don't work with their own materials, just charging for the labor.

This loan will be used to purchase materials such as steel rebars, metal sheets, roofing, and soldering. She is the founding member of the communal bank and she appreciates the additional benefits that the institution provides.

Her dream is to have a well-stocked hardware store.

In the photo, she can be seen with a baby in her arms. But the baby is not her child.

loans.use: to purchase steel rebars, metal sheets, roofing, and soldering.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 40 años de edad. Actualmente, Roxana vive en la misma ciudad donde nacio junto con sus tres hijos. Roxana se dedica a la venta de cerámica y sus productos son muy reconocidos en la ciudad del Cusco.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Roxana requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de adornos. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Roxana was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 40 years old.  Currently, she lives in the same city in which she was born, together with her three children.  Roxana's business is selling pottery and her products are very well-known in the city of Cusco.  She has been in this business for several years now and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Roxana needs a loan to buy decorative materials.  She is a very responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina" community bank.

loans.use: to buy decorative materials

She has been in this profession for several years and her work is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into it.  Catherine gives private piano, violin, singing and percussion lessons.  She has a small studio in her home.

On this occasion, Catherine needs a loan to set up a music school.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina" community bank.

Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella en sus horas libres se dedica a hacer manualidades. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y otra parte los destinara para uso personal ósea para la matricula de su colegio de su hijo. La socia es la segunda veces accede al crédito de la Asociación Arariwa y le ha ido muy bien.
texts.en:
Miriam Caterina is 40 years old, divorced, and was born in the city of Cusco.  She currently works as a secretary for the NGO "Green Works".  She has been in this job for four years and is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  In her spare time, she makes handicrafts.

On this occasion, Miriam needs a loan to buy materials.  She will also use part of her loan money for personal use (she will pay her son's registration fee at school).  This is the second time that Miriam has taken a loan from Asociación Arariwa and she has done very well.

loans.use: to buy materials and also to pay her son's registration fee at school

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, de 15, 10 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian el mayor en colegio y las menores en escuela. El marido es chofer profesional.
 
Ella para poder ganar algo de dinero y  sentirse útil se dedica al comercio y al cuidado de su hogar. Ella vende telas y productos naturales, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes a los que vende sus productos, las telas deja en ciertos colegios y escuelas que elaboran los uniformes de los estudiantes y también entrega a costureras y sastres. Trabaja cuatro días de la semana y da crédito a sus clientes. Lleva más de cinco años en esta actividad y la mercadería  le envían desde Quito cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito es para comprar telas de todo tipo y productos naturales. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un almacén
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro community bank meet in 30 de Septiembre neighborhood, in Rocafuerte canton.  This area is known for the delicious sweet treats that the locals make.  They are famous all over the country.

Here we meet 36 year-old Ana who lives with her common-law husband and has three children aged 15, 10 and 8.  Her eldest is in high school and her younger two are in elementary school.  Her husband is a professional driver.

In order to earn some money and feel useful, Ana is a saleswoman and also looks after her household.  She sells fabric and natural products door to door.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers to whom she sells her products.  She leaves the fabrics in certain high schools and elementary schools that make student uniforms and also delivers to seamstresses and tailors.  Ana works four days a week and provides her goods on credit.  She has been in this business for more than five years and she is sent her merchandise from Quito when she needs it.

Ana will use this loan to buy all kinds of fabric and natural products.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are easy to obtain.

Ana's dream is to own a store.

loans.use: to buy fabric and natural products

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
Si hay algo que a la Sra. Rosa la caracteriza es su buena sazón ella recuerda que en una oportunidad  le pidieron  200 tamales para una fiesta D. matrimonio a raíz D. eso recibió muchas felicitaciones debido a que sus tamales eran muy ricos  así se inicia en el negocio D. la cocina preparando alimentos para toda ocasión aparte también venD. en su misma casa  estos ingresos le permiten ayudar a su hija y sus nietos que están en edad escolar, la Sra. Rosa lo que mas quiere es terminar la construcción D. su casa para instalar una bodega , el dinero D. su préstamo lo va a usar  para avanzar  su proyecto .
Estar a cargo del grupo “SOLIDARIDAD” es una nueva responsabilidad  y como presidenta quiere aportar lo mejor  ya son  6 años que pertenece al grupo.
 
 * La Sra. Rosa tiene puesta una manta a cuadros, tambien aparece un joven que es pasivo.
texts.en:
If there is something that Rosa is noted for, it is the good flavor of her food.  She recalls that on one occasion somebody asked her for 200 tamales for a wedding party.  She received a lot of compliments as her tamales were delicious and so she started a business preparing food for all occasions.  She also sells food from her own home.  This income allows her to help her daughter and her school-age grandchildren.

What Rosa would like more than anything is to finish building her home so that she can set up a grocery store in it.  She will use her loan money to make progress in her project.  Rosa is in charge of the "Solidaridad" group.  This is a new responsibility for her and, as the group's president, she would like to do her best as she has belonged to the group for six years.

* Rosa is wearing a chequered shawl.  There is also a young person in the photo who is not a member of the group.

loans.use: to build her future grocery store

loans.name: Chuluun

texts.en:
Chuluun is 49 years old and lives with her two children and one grandchild in a house in Sansar area, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia.  Her two children, ages 19 and 22, both go to a college.  

She manages a meat trading business at a rented booth at a local market.  She started her business in 2000 and is planning to continue her business in the future.  She is one of the experienced businesswomen in her business field.  She says, "I never applied to a loan service before. I heard from my colleagues that the loan service is quite good in expanding and continuing business operations consistently.  Therefore I planned to apply for a loan in order to increase my business sales."  She is requesting a 950,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is 43 years old and lives with his wife in his younger brother's ger, Mongolian yurt, in Sansar area, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia.  He manages a leather goods manufacturing business with the help of his wife.  They started their business in 2006 and gained much experience.  They make variety of leather clothes such as bag, coat, pant, skirt and gloves etc.  Now they have many regular customers.  He is a hardworking man who says, "I am planning to have my own house in the future."  He is requesting a 1,150,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee is 49 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter helps with the family business and her husband herds chickens. Managing a construction material trading business at a rented stall at a trading center, Tsetsgee purchases her inventories from Ulaanbaatar wholesalers during the summer and Chinese wholesalers during the winter.

Now that she has many regular customers, Tsetsgee is planning to expand her business in the future. A responsible woman who says, "I want to sell more goods in order to earn more during the summertime," she is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventories from China.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories from China

loans.name: Zavhanaa

texts.en:
Zavhanaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Mongolia's Zavhan Province. Her husband is a herder, while her two younger children are pupils and her older children secondary school teachers. Zavhanaa manages a clothing-making business in her town, an enterprise she started in 1988 and worked hard to stabilize and expand. She now makes all kinds of Mongolian traditional clothes called Deel.

An honest and hardworking lady who is trying hard to provide all the necessities for her children's education and support, Zavhanaa is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her clothes-making business.

loans.name: Tseveen

texts.en: Tseveen is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He manages a shoe-making business with the help of his wife in his town. They started their business in 2006 after working as shoemakers in a private company for several years. Now they make a variety of Mongolian traditional shoes for all ages. They sell their products both in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and countryside areas. Their products are well-known amongst their customers for quality and durability. His wife is going to conduct a taxi service business after graduating her driving school, so they can earn more compared with before. He is a hardworking man who says, "One can achieve success if he works hard." He is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase a new car for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his wife's taxi business.

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
Manchita is 53 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school. Manchita is in the agricultural business of raising hogs in the Philippines. Manchita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Manchita has been raising hogs for one year, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Manchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sardines, shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Marilou has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from handicrafts.

Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Lolita Friolo's Group

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with three children. 

Lolita has a grocery store that sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap and any other items used for the home. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and any items for household chores.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for one year. 

Lolita is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and any items for household chores.

location.town: Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, 30, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Phalla is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family is also assisted by her mother who grows vegetables to sell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 15 on the other necessary expenses. Phalla is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase vegetable seeds to grow more crops to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds to grow more crops

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita, 39, is married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Mercelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas, ginger, etc., to sell.

Mercelita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Mercelita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and ginger to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with one child. She is 38 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy.
Marilou sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap for her general store to earn a living.  She has had this business for ten years. 
She earns PHP 3,000 each month from her business. Marilou has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more products such as soap, toothpaste and other household items.
Marilou has been a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Marilou hopes  that the extra income from this business is for her child education .

loans.use: to purchase more products such as soap, toothpaste and other household items

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Merioda

texts.en:
Merioda is 55 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Merioda works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa palm leaf vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa palm leaves to sell.

Merioda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa palm leaves to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old, married and has three children. Myrna is in the agricultural business of raising hogs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising hogs for five years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va, 44 years old, is a construction worker with her husband. Both of them can earn $6 per day for their income. She has six children, three are studying and the other three are also working as construction workers. Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $26 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy female pigs to feed instead of working as a construction worker. The reasons she wants to stop working are because she wants to stay home to take care of the children and because feeding pigs can make more income. She plans to repair her house and send the rest of her children to study so they can at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed at home

loans.name: Genel's Group

texts.en:
Genel is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Genel is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Genel has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Genel is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden

location.town: Sangay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a banana business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her boarding house. Nelinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell in her business.

Nelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married and works hard to support her family. For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosa is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruit and young corn to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married and the mother of three children. She works hard to support her family. Rosalia operates a fish-selling business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from raising pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities with the help of her previous 18 loans with NWTF. 

Rosalia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker; his income is $4 per day. She has four children, three are working in a factory and the other is working as a construction worker; each of them can earn $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, and $20 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy cement, sand, and bricks to repair her house. She plans to send her daughters to study tailoring and will open a small tailoring shop at her house for them. She hopes that after she receives this loan she will have a better house, with a toilet and bathroom, in which to stay and feel more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair her house

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a butcher shop in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from selling longganisa (Filipino sausage) and bacon. Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF.

Salvacion is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional pork, beef, and poultry to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, and poultry to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en: San, 59 years old, is a farmer. Her husband cannot do anything because his eyes are not good and he can’t see things clearly. She has four children, and they are 29, 25, 18, and 16 years old. Two are studying. One of her children is working as a housekeeper in Malaysia, the other is working in a factory, and both of them can earn $6.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $20 on school fees, and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a hand tractor for plowing her farm field. She expects to use this tractor to make more income by helping to plow other farmers' farmland when they need. She wants to prepare her house to be more comfortable to live in and to send her children to study in the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for farming

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married with one child. She is 54 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lilia sells different household products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to earn a living.  She has had this business for ten years. Lilia earns PHP 6,000 from her business each month.  She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more products for her general store.

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha, 30 years old, is working in a factory. Her husband is working in a cake shop, they both can earn $6.50 per day for their income.  She has two children and they are aged 7 and 3. One of her children is studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $8 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She wants to send her children to study until they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Ketut and the other members of the Sri Cendana group breed pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Through many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to care for pigs to maximize income. 

Ni Ketut hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Ketut will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork roll.  

With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband.  Ultimately, Ni Ketut hopes that increased income will enable her to buy more pigs and further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito, 46, is a married man with two children aged 21 and 14.

Anecito is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice crops to sell. Anecito works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, he hopes to improve his farming and build a better house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: 48.ttvanha.thieuhoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhu operates a food stall selling meat. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Nhu is 65 years old, and she is married with two children. Nhu is the group leader of the 48.TT Van Ha solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhu has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Nhu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With the profits from her business, Nhu hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to resell

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is 22 years old and single. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 30,000 per harvest. 

Ryan is asking for a loan of PHP35,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. He also will use the loan to pay for planting and land preparation. He grows large crop of rice and has been doing it for four years. 

Ryan wishes to maintain his business to improve the living situation for his parents and himself.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with three children.  Her eldest child is 26. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Aida helps her husband till the land where they grow rice crops. She helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests. Aida also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sell them at the market.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seed and feed. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and feed

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora plants cassava in their vacant agricultural land nowadays. Production of cassava is in great demand now. Pastora is 60 years of age and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is happily married with three children. Pastora's income from cassava production is 50,000 for one year. She spends at least half a year planting.

She requested a loan to buy planting materials for cassava production. Pastora has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Pastora hopes that she can produce more cassava and build a house for the family from their income.

loans.use: to buy planting materials for cassava

loans.name: Ore

texts.en: Ore is 41 years old. She works for the government as a consultant in her village. Her husband is a rice seller, and they both can make $6.50 per day in income. They have 5 children who are all studying. Every month, Ore has to spend $88 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $200 to buy fertilizer for her field. Ore plans to buy a stock of rice to sell when the price is high.  She is working hard for a higher income to be able to send her children to school until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a married mother of three children who works hard to support her family. She has a candy-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities with the help of her previous eight loans with NWTF.

Trinidad is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients to make candy. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, 43 years old, is a married woman with four children. Her eldest child is 22 years old. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Dolores is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice at their farm. Dolores also raises hogs.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seed and feed. In the future, she hopes to be be able to support her children's education. She also hopes for their farm to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed and feed

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 29 years old, is a farmer. Her husband works in a bakery shop.  The couple's income is $4.50 per day. Chanthorn and her husband have 2 children, 8 and 5 years old. One is in school.

Every month, Chanthorn must spend $55 on food, $5 on electricity, and $5 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $350 to buy land near her house so that her house will be bigger than before to make a barn for her cattle. She wants to support all of her children in their studies through at least high school.

loans.use: To buy land to make a barn for her cattle

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 41 and is a married woman with two children. Her eldest child is 21. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Janette has a hog-raising business. She has a backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. Janette also helps her husband at their rice farm when she can.

This loan will be used to purchase feed for pigs and also for her children's tuition fees. In the future, she hopes to pay all her debts and let her kids finish school.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs and to pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Minda Lee

texts.en:
Minda Lee is 39 years old and is married with two school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines. Minda Lee's husband is also a farmer. 

Minda Lee is asking for a loan of PHP25,000 to purchase inputs needed for their field, such as fertilizers and rice seeds. In the future, Minda Lee hopes that she will earn a higher income from her farm yields in order to financially support her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, such as fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 56 year old, runs a bakery that earns $3 per day in income.  Her husband is a soldier and his salary is $60 per month.  they both have 3 children and they are 25, 20, 18 years old. They have jobs as a garment factory worker, driver, and car repairer and they can make $8.50 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $60 on food and $15 on electricity.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy wood for repairing her house.  In the future she wants to sell wood instead of selling cake because it can make more profit.

loans.use: To buy wood for house repairing

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence works as a farmer in Surallah, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for five years. According to Laurence, he earns about 10,000 PHP per month from farming. He also raises pigs in his backyard piggery.

Laurence plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizer and feed. In the future, he hopes to improve his farm business.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan, 57 year old, is a farmer.  She is a single mother with one daughter who is working in a factory.  She can make $5 per day with her daughter. 

There are 4 members in her family and she has to spend $79 on food.  She would like to request a loan of $600 to repair her son in law’s motorbike. She wants to repair her house because it is not in good condition.  There is no toilet, bathroom or fence.  More than that, she wants to change her career as a farmer to sell groceries in her village.

loans.use: To repair her son in law's motorbike

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 and is a married woman with four children. Her eldest child is 20 years old. Letecia and her husband are both farmers. She helps him grow rice crops and keep the farm productive. Letecia also raises hogs to fatten and sell.

This loan will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Giri Puteri Group

texts.en:
The Giri Puteri group is made up of 15 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of 30M IDR, and each member will receive 2M IDR.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their first loan with MUK.

Ni Made is the head of the Giri Puteri group.  She is married and has one child, aged 7, first year in elementary school. Ni Made would like to help support her family with her pig raising business.   She plans to use the loans to buy four piglets. She plans to sell the piglets after five months fattening.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees and expand her economic life.

loans.use: To buy four piglets.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and lives in Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gil, a farmer, and is mother to their seven children, four of whom are working while the youngest is still studying in grade school. Wilma is working hard to put her children through college, because like most Filipino parents she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give their children.

Wilma makes a living by selling bags, watches, hair accessories and other merchandise. She has been in this business for almost three years and is very knowledgeable about the preferences of her customers, most of whom are students and young people. She earns a minimum of Php 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 30,000. She will use the money to buy more products and merchandise to sell. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Wilma dreams of having a new outlet store for her products. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners which gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, 39 years old, is a married and has three children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Lilian is also a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for five years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month doing farming. Lilian also provides manicure services to the people in her community and she is an Avon dealer.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn, 23 years old, is married and has two children age 5 and 3. 

Lovelyn and her husband are both farmers working in Surallah, South Cotabato. According to Lovelyn, they have been growing rice for six years. Lovelyn also raises pigs in their backyard.

This loan will be used to purchase feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her livelihood, pay her debts, and send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun (pictured here) sells kitchenware and household tools. She buys them from Takhmao market, approximately five kilometers from her house and sells them in her village. In addition, she is also a rice farmer. 

Aun is asking for a loan of $700. She will use a part of the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm, and also buy more kitchenware and household tools for resale.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Qamar's Group

texts.en:
Qamar is 29 years old married with four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Qamar is a caring and supportive lady by nature. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She also operates a business of embroidery on a small level. She learned this art in her teenage years and now she is an expert in her work. She receives a good number of orders every month from her community clients and earns well after completing the orders on time. 

Her husband is a driver and drives a rickshaw. He provides pick-up and drop-off services to his passengers and to school children. 

Qamar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity that will allow her to prepare beautiful dresses and earn better income. 

She is a very confident that her business will improve a lot after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is 46 years old and married with 10 children. She earns a living by raising hogs and fattening cattle in the Philippines. Welma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock as well as feed.

Welma has been raising hogs and fattening cattle for 15 years, and she earns additional income from rice farming. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock as well as feed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.
