Yolanda runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, toothpaste, sardines, noodles, etc., to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns income from selling fish. Yolanda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Melindy

texts.en:
Melindy, 48 years old, is married and has three children. The oldest child is 27. Her husband works as a farmer and a Barangay official. 

Melindy is a pig farmer. She has a backyard piggery in their home in Surallah, South Cotabato. She also helps her husband grow rice at their farm. 

This loan will be used to purchase pig feed and vitamins. In the future, she hopes not to borrow money anymore and to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is married and has four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Farmintong, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Cynthia sells different kinds of products in her general store to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. Cynthia has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, 38 years old, is married and living in the village of Ambalatungan Santiago. Patricia has three children and they are generally school-age. Patricia’s spouse works as a farmer.

Patricia has been in the business of hog raising for two years. She is grateful for the big improvement of her business because through that she is able to sustain the school fees of her children. According to her, she is earning about PHP 3,000 when she sells one of her raised animals.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed needed by her hogs. Also, she is planning to use some of the amount for the maintenance of their rice farming activity.

In the future, Patricia hopes that she can borrow bigger capital for her to purchase more hogs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 34, is married and has a 4-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer and welder.

Nida is in the business of hog raising. She works hard to support her husband in providing for their family's needs. 

She plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending (catering) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her catering business.

Melanie has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from making cakes and pastries.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food catering business

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s grocery store business. His store is located in the market and he sells different grocery items to his clients such as cooking oil, sugar, spices, etc. at reasonable rates. He started this business two years ago and it has worked well for him. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to sell in his store. 

Shazia is a housewife, staying at her home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very active in her work and takes care of her family very well. She has given birth to four children. Three of them are studying while the youngest one is not of school-going age yet. 

Shazia is confident that an investment will help her family to live a better financial life by improving her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Teresa works hard to support her family. She has a lobster and fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Teresa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more lobster and fish to sell at her business.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more lobster and fish for resale

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek is 29 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has two children, aged 10 and eight.  Her younger son is in second year in elementary school and her older son is in fourth year in elementary school.   Her husband works as a farmer.  Though Ni Kadek often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Kadek is the head of the Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah group, which is made up of 15 neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s third loan with MUK.  With the 1.5M IDR that Ni Kadek receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as meat.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
This is Marcela, 35, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rey, a security guard, and is a mother to her children. 

Marcela has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continue to provide income for her children's everyday expenses as well as their schooling. Marcela believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Marcela operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from the food stall, she sells frozen food like hot dogs and ham. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,690 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, as well as frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marcela dreams of giving all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and raw ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is married and has three children. She is 32 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Lea has a snack vending business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 13,000. Lea has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Lea has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 57, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Nestor, and is the mother of two children who are both in high school. 

Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. Adelaida herself has been an undergraduate, and she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Adelaida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Adelaida earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 560 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Adelaida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
This is Veronica, 45, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo and is mother to their children. 

Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Veronica operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She also sells frozen food products like hot dogs and ham. 

Veronica earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 775 in sales every day.

 Aside from the store, she also has a van for rent.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan for van accessories. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Veronica hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to buy another van to add to her van-for-rent business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Naseema's Group

texts.en:
Naseema is a 43-year-old widow and doesn’t have any children. After the death of her husband, Naseema had a very difficult life. She started selling crockery and blankets to survive financially. She also sews clothes for her neighboring clients on order. 

She lives with her nephew who sells fruit. His shop is in the market and he offers fresh seasonal fruit to his customers at cheap rates. 

Naseema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her nephew who wants to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit in larger quantity that will help him sell more and earn larger profits. He has been running his business for the past 10 years and Naseema is very hopeful that an investment will put a positive impact on his business and improve his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseema.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Rose Marie Cortes Group

texts.en: Rose Marie is 41 years old and lives in Cogon, Ozamis City. She is married with four children. To earn a living, Rose Marie has a business selling snacks. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Rose Marie has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Rose Marie has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s electrician business. He provides electricity repair services and also makes tube light parts. With the loan, he will buy repair tools and items for making larger quantities of tube light parts (rods, starters) to increase his income. 

Meena is a 46-year-old lady. She started a sewing business a few years ago to help her husband who is also an electrician when his income was not enough to meet the expenses of his family. Now she is well known in her area for her good quality of work and she earns good income from her skills. The income she earns helps her to manage the household expenses. Besides her business, she also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

She is hopeful that the loan will help her son improve the financial condition of his business.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Meena.

loans.use: To buy repair tools and items for making tube light parts.

loans.name: Anteneta

texts.en:
Anteneta is 51 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 8 children.

To earn a living, Anteneta sells a variety of products from her general store. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to purchase products for her general store. Anteneta has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia is married but doesn't have any children.  Her husband is a fruit vendor. He operates his business from his home and provides fresh seasonal fruit to his clients for a profit. Due to his good behavior and the quality of his fruit, he has a good number of clients in his community. 

Aasia supports her family by sewing clothes. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. In between her work, she also gets some time to manage her household tasks. She is very active and performs her tasks very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase seasonal fruit to sell. This will earn him more profit and also improve his business. He has been operating his business for  the past 10 years and Aasia is very hopeful about its positive growth after the investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Aasia.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Novembrita

texts.en: Novembrita is 52 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. To earn a living, Novembrita has a business selling groceries. She earns about 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Novembrita has a requested a loan to purchase products for her grocery store. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase products for her grocery store

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen operates a business selling clothes to share the financial burden with her husband. She purchases clothes from different clothing markets and sells to her neighboring clients for a profit. 

Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant business in the market. He offers his customers very good tasty food as well as tea. Most of his community prefer to come to his restaurant due to his good quality of food and tea. He sells "Daal chawal" (made with rice and lentils) and "Nan Chanay" (made with chickpeas and served with bread). 

Yasmeen is the mother of three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is a very kind mother and a very good housewife. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase required ingredients such as chickpeas, lentils, spices, cooking oil, etc. used in preparing better quality food. 
 
Yasmeen is hopeful that the loan investment will help her husband in making more income and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for Punjabi food restaurant.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is married with 2 school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this type of work for 14 years. Rowena is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and rice seed to be planted on her farm. Rowena hopes this loan will increase her rice production. Currently, she earns 30,000 PHP per harvest. She desires to expand her farm site soon for an additional source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and rice seed to be planted on her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and rice seeds to be planted on his farmland

loans.name: Philis

texts.en: Philis is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children who are five and 11 years old. For the last eight years, she has worked hard at making a living by selling clothes. Before starting her own business, she was a housewife, but by joining Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money and manage her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business into a much bigger operation. Her dream is to own an apartment which she can live in and use as an office. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 42 years old and married with two children: a son and a daughter. Her son operates a lathe machine while her daughter does embroidery. Her husband works in a private firm for a reasonable income. In order to help her husband financially, Perveen sews clothes for her neighboring clients and also does embroidery. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity that will allow her to offer better quality services to her customers and increase her income. 

She is very experienced in her business and has operated it for the past 10 years. She is confident that a loan investment will bring more profits to her and expand her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 42 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. Jerry is a farmer working in the Philippines. He engages in growing rice and has been doing it for 22 years. 

Jerry is asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds to be planted in his farmland. Jerry earns PHP35,000 when he harvests his rice crop. He hopes that, through his loan, he will further increase his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds to be planted in his farmland

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is a seamstress by trade. She does this work to earn a living for her family. She is very talented in her work. She can sew designer & non-designer dresses very easily. Her good work enables her to attract many customers and get more orders from them. 

Her husband operates a gym center and a video game shop. Through his gym, he provides good quality health and fitness related equipment & machines to his clients and earns reasonable profits from his business. His video game shop also very famous with kids and earns him good profit every month. 

Abida’s nephew also lives with her family and has an embroidery business. He operates his business from home and provides good quality services to his clients.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her nephew’s business. With the loan, he will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread, cloth and sketches in bulk to be able to fulfill the demand of his clients and increase his profits. 

Abida is hopeful that by improving his business conditions, her nephew will be able to save some profit for his marriage in the near future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Abida.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru: Мичгона проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 22 года. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж занимается торговлей на рынке "Ганчина". Сама Мичгона имеет среднее образование. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки электрической швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mijgona livesin Rudaki.  She is 22 years old, married, and has one child.  Her husband trades at Ganchina market.  Mijgona has a high school education.  She sews traditional dresses at home.  She has been doing this for six years.  She is taking out a loan to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Alisa's Group

texts.en:
Alisa is the leader of this group. She is 24, and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up a three year-old son. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds cattle. The family started to breed cattle four years ago with an initial investment of 45,000 soms.

Alisa applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing a calf to increase the cattle stock. In the near future, Alisa plans to enlarge a shed, where she keeps cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and is 50 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells eggs,onions, biscuits, candies, soap, shampoo and condiments to the people in her community. Teresita has had this business for five years.

Teresita is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase cases of soft drinks and vegetables, such as tomatoes and cabbages. She believes that, with the vegetables, her income will increase. Teresita usually earns about PHP 3,000 each month in this business.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks and vegetables, such as tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en: Lorie is 42 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver and she helps him support their family by selling different kinds of beauty products, including cosmetics and perfumes. She has been in this business for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional items to sell to her customers. In the future, Lorie dreams of starting a second business so that she can generate more income to support the needs of her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a farmer in her native town of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. She is 47 and married, with six children between 25 and 7 years. Her farm produces milk and tea, with the help of one farmhand. She has been in mixed  farming for the last ten years.

Rosemary has requested a loan amounting to 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase poultry birds for her poultry business. She believes the business will grow and provide income to pay for the education of her five children who are still in school.  Rosemary states that milk price fluctuation is the greatest challenge in dairy farming. She, however, remains optimistic the venture into poultry will supplement the dairy business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 30 years old and married, with 3 children. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years in his hometown in western Kenya. His  farm produces milk, maize and beans which are all sold locally. He is also a driver.

Anthony has made his second loan request of 60,000Kes through Kiva Partner, Juhudi Kilimo. He intends to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to help transport his farm produce to the market. He says that this will enable him get access to the market without any problem.

His major challenge in the farming business has been unpredictable weather conditions, which affects his production. In the future, he would like to purchase a quality dairy cow that will help increase his milk productivity.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help transport his farm produce.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and is 47 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and products for daily use, such as soap and shampoo, as well as instant noodles, cigarettes, soft drinks, condiments and eggs. Susan has had this business for five years. 

Susan is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase cases of soft drinks, canned goods, and condiments to increase her sales.
In the future, Susan would like to increase her profit and be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks, canned goods and condiments.

loans.name: Mach Trang-1-4 Group

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1983. She lives in Mach Trang village with her husband and two children who are still young. She has an internet shop and has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). Huong has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 5.750.000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy a computer. Huong is the leader of a five-member group loan in SEDA.

Thu is 28 years old. She has two children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy feed for the chickens.
Hoa is 30 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed pigs as well as poultry.
Lan  is 28 years old. She wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy feed for chickens.
Nam is 39 years old. He has four children. He wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed pigs as well as poultry.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Sarfraz's Group

texts.en:
Sarfraz is a housewife, staying at her home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very good administrator and manages the household expenses with full responsibility. She is the mother of four sons. Three of them do different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially while youngest one is 16 years old and studying in class 10. 

Her husband deals in scrap. He provides scrap to different factories on order and to other scrap dealers. Sarfraz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap such as used papers, cartons, and plastic bottles in bulk to be able to fulfill the demand of his clients and earn good profit. 

He has been operating this business for many years and Sarfraz hopes that an investment will be  a productive one for him. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sarfraz.

loans.use: To buy scrap.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a 52-year-old widow who makes a living by running a general store where she sells soap, shampoo, toothpaste, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce and other items. She has been in this business for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She earns about PHP 2,500 from her work. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her store to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bottles of cooking oils, vinegars, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Xom Ngoai-2-9 Group

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1974. She lives in Xom Ngoai village and she has a shop where she sells shoes. Her husband helps her in her shop. They have had this business for ten years and have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Hoa has participated in SEDA since 2010. The last cycL., she borrowed 5.014.000 VND. In this loan cycL., she would like T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. expand her shoe shop. She is the leader of a five-member group loan in SEDA. About the other entrepreneurs in her group:

Dung is 32 years old. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. breed pigs.

Tu is 37 years old. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. expand her shop.

Tuan is 35 years old. He wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. raise livestock.

Quang is 43 years old. He wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. repair his house.

loans.use: to expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman is a 43 year old farmer.  Her husband is a worker and their combined income is $5 per day.  They have 2 children, 17 and 13 years old, and they both are working in weave factory right now with $5 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $20 on food, $6 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $25 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy equipments for repairing her house.  She wants to prepare her house and then rent it to a weave merchant so she could earn some money from that.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
To generate income for her family, Felisa decided to venture into the food-selling business. She sells fruits and vegetables house to house in her community. With the business she is able to earn an income of PHP 2,000 a month which she spends for daily expenses and for the expenses of her three children.

Felisa is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase variety of vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

In the future, Felisa hopes to own a stall in the market to make her business more profitable and generate more income to support her family and provide a better life for them.

loans.use: to purchase variety of vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children.
 
Gorgonia has a shop that sells home-made ice cream in different flavors. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for her ice cream.

Gorgonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Gorgonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.

loans.name: Orlino

texts.en:
Orlino is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Orlino is a farmer working in the Philippines. He engages in growing a large crop of rice and has been doing it for 21 years. 

Orlino is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds of rice to be planted in his two hectares of farmland. 

He wants to maintain his business and dreams of expanding his farm to gain income for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to be planted in his two hectares of farmland and fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nematjon

texts.ru: Неъматжон проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. Детей, не имеет. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам Неъматжон занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает стройматериалы. Его магазин находится на главной дороге. Поэтому он хочет купить холодильник для продажи прохладительных напитков на летний сезон. В этой области он более 8 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых материалов и покупки холодильника.
texts.en: Nematjon lives in Dushanbe.  He is 39 years old, married, and has no children.  His wife is a housewife.  Nematjon works in trade.  He has a shop where he sells construction materials.  His shop is located on a main street.  Therefore, he wants to buy a refrigerator so that he can sell cold drinks in the summer.  He has worked in trade more than eight years He is taking out a loan to procure necessary materials and buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to procure necessary materials and buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 33 years old, married and has four children. Her eldest son makes electric wires while the 2nd one is an embroidery expert. Her remaining two children are young and getting their education. 

Robina is a housewife, staying at home and managing her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also sews clothes for her neighboring clients.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who also lives with her and operates an embroidery business. With the loan, he will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread, and sketches in larger quantity that will help him in providing better embroidery services to his customers and allow him to earn more profit. 

He is very talented in his work and started his business some years ago. Robina hopes that an investment will bring more profit to him and increase his income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married father of six children aged between 21 and 5 years. Five are still in school.

He has been in mixed farming for the last seven years, producing and selling eggs and maize in the local market in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. 

Fredrick has made a request for a loan worth 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition will help him improve his income as well as provide supplementary food for the family.

Fredrick says providing animal feed is a serious challenge, especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Larediza

texts.en:
Larediza is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Larediza has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits and noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Larediza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Larediza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a dairy farmer who lives in the west Kenyan town of Kitale, where he has made a living as a farmer for the last 10 years. His farm produces milk, maize, vegetables and beans, all of which he sells in the local market. He mainly depends the income he earns in this market to meet the needs of his family. He is applying for a loan for 83,200 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure two dairy cows. His goal is to increase his income by having more milk to sell. A higher income will also allow him to buy more animal feed and treat the diseases which affect his farm's output. Gilbert is 37 years old,  married and has seven children, all of whom attend school.

loans.use: To buy and insure two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for utilities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 47 years old and married with six children. Her oldest child is 24 years old and her youngest is only two. Tessie is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice but also raises pigs to augment her family’s income. 

Tessie is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and feed. In the future, she hopes to see her children graduate from school and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a young woman and a mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband Sameh, who is photographed in the bookshop as she is a conservative woman, has a bookshop and wanted to add an accessories section besides the books and stationery he sells, as in the picture.

Riham took out a loan from FATEN to cover the price of the accessories her husband bought which will improve their financial situation as, due to the financial hardship in Palestine, book-selling income does not cover household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase stationery and accessories to sell with the books.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 46-year-old lady who shares the financial burden with her family by operating a shirt-sewing business. She receives orders from different garment shops and fills their orders to earn a profit. 

Her husband earns money by polishing shoes. He leaves his home early in the morning and visits different areas of the city to look for clients. 

Parveen has three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a welding business, and the 2nd one is a tailor. Her other two children are studying in the nearby school. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her business further. With the loan, she will buy an over lock machine that will help her filling the client orders on time and increase her profit. She has been operating her business for the past six years and hopes that after the investment, her business will improve further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy an over-lock machine.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 30 years old and married with five children between the ages of two and 15. She practices mixed farming in her hometown of Litein in South Rift Kenya. Edna produces maize, eggs, and milk, which she sells to the local market. She employs two farmhands on her farm. Edna’s main business challenge is finances.

Edna is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from the Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. She says the poultry business will help her meet her family’s basic needs, especially educating her children. Edna is very optimistic that her business will grow significantly.

loans.use: to puchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 56 years old and single. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Valentina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 36 years, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure a future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Xom Ngoai-1-6 Group

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1980. She lives in Xom Ngoai village with her husband and two children. She and her husband sell birds, and she also grows vegetables and flowers. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Phuong has participated in SEDA since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5.014.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6.758.000 VND to grow vegetables and flowers. 

Phuong is the leader group of five-member group loan. About the other members in her group:

Phuong is 31 years old and has two children. She sells clothes in the market and wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to expand her shop.

Oanh is 28 years old and has three children. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND for her small business.

Sam is 55 years old and has four children. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to expand her shoe store.

Ha is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to buy stainless steel for producing doors.

loans.use: to grow vegetables and flowers

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a shop that sells used clothing (ukay-ukay). She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of used clothing for resale.

Lida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing, called "ukay-ukay" in the Philippines.

loans.name: Upendo Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Alfred, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been a mobile banking agent for two telecommunication companies, Voda and Tigo, for two months now.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to use it to increase his stock by buying more "Tigo-pesa" and "Voda-pesa". His dream is to one day own a pharmacy.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Upendo Kigogo" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy and sell more "Tigo-pesa" and "Voda-pesa" (mobile phone banking).

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Galtulga’s wife is hairdresser and works in a beauty salon. 

Since 2009, Gantulga has been running a taxi business using his family car, and in January this year, he got the job as a driving instructor at a local driving school. Instructors can use their own car as a driving school car and obtain a small rental price. So Gantulga does this and it helps his family to earn some extra income on top of his salary. 

Currently, his car needs some proper service. The loan Gantulga is taking will be used to buy necessary spare parts and to do some repair and service to his car, which he uses as a driving school car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and to service and repair his car, which he uses as a driving school car.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 56 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melita requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business.

Melita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production and vending business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old single man. He has owned a furniture gallery since 2000, with 16 years of experience in this field. Ali’s  work is going just fine. He sells living room, bedrooms and dinning room furniture.

Ali is a hard worker, his clients like dealing with him because his prices are competitive. Many of his clients recommend him to others who would like to buy or change their home’s furniture.

To improve his business, Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new furniture styles necessary to attract new customers.

He hopes this loan will improve his business in the future and he will be able to open a new branch.

loans.use: To increase his furniture collection with new styles and models.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Mercedita provides habal-habal services. (Habal-habal is a motorcycle with extended seating for two to six passengers.) Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the habal-habal service.

loans.name: Georgyn

texts.en:
Georgyn,34, is married and has three children. She lives in the Philippines.

Georgyn is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan to redeem a parcel of land. 

Georgyn has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To redeem a parcel of land.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina, 63 years old and married with three children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. Having borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a PHP 15000 loan to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.  Paulina aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a housewife who does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her duties very well.  She is a mother of three daughters and a son.  Three of them study and the last one is very young. 

Her husband operates a business selling sweetmeat. He has a great taste in his hands and his sweetmeat items are in high demand in his area. He has been doing this business for the past six years. In these years of experience, he has built a good reputation among his clients for his good behavior and tasty sweetmeat items.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who sells bulb holders. With the loan, he will buy bulb holders in bulk quantity to sell to different electric shops and increase his profits. Samina is confident that her brother-in law-will be able to increase his profits successfully after the loan investment.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Samina.

loans.use: To buy bulb holders to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She is 32 years old, married to Karanu, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of KES 40,000 well and in good time. 

She plans to use the loan amount to buy a milking cow as she looks to start mixed farming.

In the future, Leah hopes to become a leading mixed farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Paz has a shop, where she sells green & yellow bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy green & yellow bananas. Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green & yellow bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 26 year old married mother of one child. Luvuno sells clothes and tailoring materials in Shanzu, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the past three years.
 
Luvuno has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing cycle to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase bales of Lesos (colourful Kenyan cloths). The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to maintain her family. Her future dream is to own her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Lesos to sell.

loans.name: Raaouf

texts.en:
Raaouf is a 33 year old married man, father of two children. He has worked as a car mechanic for the past three years, when he opened his own car maintenance garage.

Raaouf is a man with a good reputation, recommended by most of his customers. To improve his business, Raaouf has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary hardware and spare parts for cars.

Raaouf works hard to provide the best living for his family, in addition to expanding his business more and more.

loans.use: to buy necessary hardware and spare parts for car maintenance.

loans.name: Melsie

texts.en:
Melsie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Melsie has a furniture shop that sells dining & living room furniture. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan, for PHP 14,000, to buy raw materials for furniture making.

Melsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Melsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Lukovani

texts.en:
Lukovani has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the past three years. He also plants sugarcane, to sell, on his farm. He is 33 years old, married to Susan, and they have three children. 

Lukovani was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to plant sugar cane on his farm and to sell the cane after its maturity. 

In the future, Lukovani hopes to buy a taxi which he will operate in Naivasha town. The taxi business is more profitable, compared to motorbikes.

loans.use: to plant sugarcane on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda, salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren has been fishing in Naivasha town for the last ten years. She normally sells her fish in the local market. She is 32 years old, a single mother of three school-going children.

Carren was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our her friends and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a deep freezer for storing fish, especially when she gets many fish.

In the future, Carren hopes to grow in her business and to get tenders to supply major hotels in Naivasha town with fish.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer.

loans.name: Merly Group

texts.en:
Merly is 46 years old and lives in Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 6 children. 

To earn a living, Merly has a business selling of different snacks. She earns about PHP 3500 each month doing this type of work. Merly has a requested a loan to purchased raw ingredients for her snack vending.

Merly has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is  a farmer, aged 30, in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya. His farm produces maize and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Peter has made a loan request amounting to  50,000 KES to help him purchase a motorcycle, which will enable him to venture into the transport business. He says the business will enable him to earn more income and to purchase more dairy cows of quality breeds. He adds that this will, in the end, improve his living standard.

Peter is glad that Juhudi Kilimo provides agricultural loans, but notes that animal diseases remain the worst challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a 43-year-old single mother with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has had a bar business for two years. She started with two crates of beer and now has 10 crates and four jerrycans of super local brew. Her hardship is bad debtors, and her vision is to stock 50 crates of beer, plus educate her family. Dinah needs the loan facility to buy cement for renovating her business premises and buying crates of beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement for renovation plus 10 crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has been fishing in Naivasha for the last two years. She normally sells her fish in the local market. She is 36 years old and married to Christopher. They have three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fish to add to her stock, as she does not want to disappoint her clients.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to grow in her business and get tenders to supply fish to major hotels in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to boost her stock

loans.name: Jayette

texts.en:
Jayette is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Jayette provides motorcycle, or habal-habal, services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the maintenance of the service. 

Jayette is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jayette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the maintenance of her service

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 and married. She has two children, a 7-year-old and a 5-month-old. She has been in mixed farming for the last six years, producing peas, wheat, and potatoes, which she sells to the middlemen in the local market. She engages the services of two farmhands. She earns additional income from retailing kerosene in the local market.

Janet has requested a loan worth 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to enable her venture into poultry farming. She says the loan will help her buy poultry birds. This is Janet’s fourth loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. She hopes the business will improve her family's living standards.

Janet points to her lack of sufficient funds, and rainfall, as the greatest impediments to her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Lida has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods. Lida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 37-year-old lady who has given birth to three sons and two daughters. All of them are young and unable to attend school because Samina is not in a position to afford their school fees. 

Her husband operates a horse cart with which he provides transport as well as loading services to his customers.
 
Samina also supports her family by sewing clothes. She takes orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills the orders to earn an income. She also has a buffalo from which she gets milk everyday and sells to her community clients to earn an extra income. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a horse for his horse cart. He will buy a young horse with which he will be able to provide better transport and loading services to his customers. He has been operating this business for the past seven years and Samina hopes that her husband will be able to increase his income successfully with the loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is a young mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband Rafat is a National Palestinian authority employee who had to find another source of income besides his work. Safa's husband started buying charcoal in bulk to sell to stores in the city. Safa's husband's charcoal work is bringing him a good income.  Therefore, he wanted to purchase a transportation car in order to start distributing to stores outside the city and gain more customers, Safa took out a loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Safa is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a car to distribute charcoal

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim is a twenty four year old hardworking man renting a house in Kasese Uganda. He has been in the coffee business for five years and this has enabled him to provide for his parents. His hardship is bad debtors and his vision is to own a coffee store plus building a house. Joachim needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Bruna

texts.en:
Bruna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Bruna has a food shop that sells waffles, hot cakes & serves coffee. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making waffles & hot cakes.

Bruna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bruna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making waffles & hot cakes.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 56 year old single woman, working in tailoring since 1978. This is  her one and only source of income.

Fadwa is a hard worker. She is specialized in sewing and tailoring curtains, in addition to bed shields and blankets. She's very talented and creative. That's why her customers work hard on recommending her to others. Most of Fadwa's customers are restaurants and schools, in addition to small hotels and individuals. 

Fadwa has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four cycles, her previous loans helped a lot in increasing and improving her business. She is requesting a loan, this time, in order to buy new textiles, fabrics, needles and necessary threads. She needs these items to improve her quality and quantity of work.
Fadwa hopes to open a big factory of her own in the future.

loans.use: to buy new textiles, fabrics, needles and necessary threads.

loans.name: Bodesmus

texts.en:
Bodesmus is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, in Western Kenya. He has been in farming for 5 years, producing and selling eggs and milk to the local market. He is married and has 2 children, aged 6 and 3. His eldest is already attending school.

Bodesmus has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. He will use the funds to purchase poultry birds for 40,000 KES and to build a poultry unit at 20,000 KES. He believes the poultry project will provide for the family and enable him to educate his children.

Bodesmus says animal diseases are the greatest challenge in farming. He remains hopeful that he will be able to service the loan and acquire more.

loans.use: to pay for poultry birds and to construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Esbon

texts.en:
Esbon has been in the mining industry for the past nine years, in Naivasha town. He is 39 years old, married to Mary, and they are blessed with four schooling children.

Esbon was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his second loan, after he repaid his previous loan of KES 30,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to employ manpower and to add stock for his spouse’s retail shop. She is currently having a challenge in managing the number of clients who come to her shop.

In the future, Esbon hopes to buy a lorry for transporting extraction products to the market.

loans.use: to employ manpower and add stock for his spouse’s retail shop.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated his tailor shop in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 43 years old, married and has three school-going children. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more textiles and items he uses, i.e threads and buttons in bulk. 

In the future, Daniel hopes to become a leading tailor in Naivasha and to get big contracts for making clothes for organizations and different groups of people.

loans.use: to buy more textiles and items he uses, i.e threads and buttons.

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Maima, who is in her late 40s, is married and has two children who are still going to school. She has been running a business of selling shoes and bags for 5 years now. She works from 6am to 5pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maima's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy the missing items from her shop and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy more shoes and bags to sell. Her dream is to one day travel to Thailand and select her own choice of bags and shoes.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Minazini", which has a total of 16 members holding each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and lives with eight family members. Four of his family members work.

In 2007, Haydar opened a cafeteria. He gained his experience from his father. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to make an advertising light box and to buy a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make an advertising light box and buy a generator.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey has a mixed farm in Kitale town in western Kenya that produces milk, maize, vegetables and fruits. He has been in the farming business for 20 years now and sells most of his produce locally. He earns additional income from his butchery shop in the same location. Godfrey is 46 years old and married. He has 7 children whose ages range between 7 and 25 years.

Godfrey has requested a loan of 62,400 Kes through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that with the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this project will enable him to pay school fees for his children.

Godfrey hopes that in the next 5 years, he will have acquired 2 high yield dairy cows that will increase his milk production. He faces the challenge of fluctuation in the market prices of milk.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jerus Tan Group

texts.en:
Jerus is married and has 2 children. She is 33 years old and lives in Baliangao.

Jerus sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,400 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3,000 to purchased a variety of products for her general store. 

Jerus has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. She is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchased additional inventory.

loans.name: Arther

texts.en:
Arther has worked in Quarries in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He extracts stones to sell in the local market. He is 36 years old, married to Caroline and they have four school going children. 

Arther was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He is planning to start poultry farming and he will use the loan amount as capital for the business. 

In the future, Arther hopes to grow in both business, i.e quarry and poultry rearing.

loans.use: to start poultry farming on his piece of land.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 36 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. She makes a living by running a snack shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and candies. She has been in this line of work for four years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and candies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Claryce

texts.en:
Claryce is aged 53. She is a married mother of 5 children, all adults. She has been in the farming business for 20 years now and sells her products of milk, eggs, maize and beans to the local market. She earns additional income from her business of selling shoes and handbags in the local market.

Claryce has made a loan request of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her to pay school fees for her son who is in the university. She plans to buy another quality dairy cow that will help boost her production in the near future. Fluctuation in the market prices of her products has been her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has worked on his Quarry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 27 years. He extracts stones to sell in the local market. He is 53 years old, married to Hannah and they have four school going children. 

Charles was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his 1st loan. He plans to use the loan amount to employ a casual worker to help him in his quarry.

In the future, Charles hopes to expand in his quarry stone extraction and be able to employ more people.

loans.use: to employ a casual worker to help him in his quarry.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is married with five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son operates a horse cart while her elder daughter does embroidery. Two of her remaining three children are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

Her husband has a business selling buffalo milk. He wakes up early in the morning and milks his buffalos. His clientele base is his community and he also delivers milk to people's homes. 

Shahida is a very good housewife and performs her routine tasks very well. In her spare time, she also takes care of cattle and helps her husband operate his business. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah loan for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo, which will help him increase the milk production and also his sales. 

He started this business 10 years ago and Shahida hopes that an investment will bring more profits to him, which will help her family to have a better standard of living. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has been selling groundnuts and cereals in Naivasha town to retail shops for the last six years. He is 37 years old, married to Mary, and they have two children.

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy three sacks of ground nuts to sell. He will repack them into smaller packets and distribute them to shops for sale.

In the future, Julius hopes to open up a shop from which he will be selling the groundnuts.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 3 children. 

Vilma has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the annual rent for her nursery.

loans.name: Kadambi

texts.en:
Kadambi is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, millet and groundnuts and she employs the services of one farmhand. She has been in farming for seven years and runs a retail business for additional income. Kadambi is married and has four children, aged between 3 and 16 years, all attending school.

Kadambi has requested for a loan of 31,200 KES  to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes the additional cow will enable her to educate and feed her children. She hopes to be a major supplier in the area in the future.

Kadambi is glad that Juhudi provides agricultural loans, but mentions that diseases and poor prices for the products are the major impediments to the farming business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a 39 year old farmer. She and her husband Bedan are blessed with two children ages 13 and 8. She has been a mixed crop and dairy farmer for the past two years, with an income of Kenya shillings 8,000 per month, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Rahab will use the loan to buy farm manure, seedlings and animal feed. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her dairy farming activities. Her future dreams are to venture into large scale dairy farming and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm manure, seedlings and animal feeds

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs.Dulamsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in the city’s ger district. Her eldest daughter attends a school and her young son attends kindergarten. 

Dulamsuren owns a minivan and she runs a transportation business. She has a contract with a construction company to carry workers and builders to construction sites in the morning and  to carry them back home in the evening. She has been running this business for 9 years. Last year, together with her husband, she started a family house-building project. The project was stopped due to lack of funding and the coming winter time. The project is 70% complete and by the plan, the house will to be environmentally friendly and green. The house is made of wood. The loan Dulamsuren is taking will be used to buy windows, doors, insulation material, roof tiles, a central heating system which works without a coal fired stove and to complete the house.

loans.use: to buy windows, doors, insulation material, roof tiles, a central heating system which works without a coal-fired stove and to complete the house.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She does small scale farming and sells all of her products in the local market.  She is 33 years old, married to Isaac, and they have four school going children.  

Hanna was introduced to KADET LTD, by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid for all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow and start selling the milk on the side to support her crop income.

In the future, Hannah hopes to buy more cattle and to increase her dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Almend

texts.en:
Almend is 35 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga. She is married and has 2 children. 

To earn a living, Almend has a business selling different kind of products such as canned goods, soap, toothpaste, rice and anything that is needed in the household. She earns about PHP 6,500 each month doing this type of work. Almaend has a requested a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.

Almend has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en:
Jemalyn is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Jemalyn has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jemalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Jemalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него 2 детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Чамшед занимается строительными работами по найму. В этой области он более 10 лет. Кроме того на сегодняшний день Чамшед занимается растениеводством. При доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и бобовые культуры. Кредит берет для повторного посева кукурузы и тыквы. То есть он хочет купить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the Rudaki region. He's twenty-eight years old, married and has two children. His wife takes care of their household and Jamshed contracts out as a construction worker. He's worked in this field for the past ten years. Additionally, he grows vegetables and legume cultures on a plot of land adjacent to his home. He's asking for a loan to get assistance in planting a second round of corn and pumpkins. He needs to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to sow corn and pumpkins

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 38 years old and married to Philomena. The couple is blessed with two school-aged children. For the past 18 years, David has been in the stone mining industry in Ndunyu Njeru town. 

David was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff credit officer at the Ndunyu Njeru office and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to pay for land that he is going to lease and to add manpower for his stone mining.

In future, David hopes to use modern mining technology to become more efficient in his mining business.

loans.use: to pay for leased land and hire employees

loans.name: Mpande Yempilo Group

texts.en:
Philisiwe is 39 years old and single. She has four children between the ages of 9 and 21. Philisiwe runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal in Empangeni, South Africa. In this photo, she is pictured raising her hand. 

For the past six months, Philisiwe has been in the snack-selling business. She also receives income through the government’s child support grants. Philisiwe is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner WDB to buy chips and snacks to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family’s standard of living because buying additional inventory for her new business will help her manage to put food on the table for her family. 

Philisiwe comments that she thinks WDB and Kiva will help her a lot by improving her life. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and she would like to sell additional products.

loans.use: to buy chips and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds and installing a watering network

loans.name: Zafer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has one child.

Zafer has had a food market since 2009 where he sells all kind of food and beverages. He has more than six years experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 30 years old married to Daniel, who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children whom Jennifer he supports. For the past four years, she has been buying and selling milk at the Mutwot trading center. Jennifer earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Jenifer is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to buy and pay milk suppliers. This will be her third loan. She has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

Jenifer plans to use her anticipated profit to build and start a retail shop. In the future, she hopes that her family will be financially stable and also that she will prosper in her business.

loans.use: to pay milk suppliers and trade milk

loans.name: Fanice

texts.en:
Fanice is married with three children between the ages of two months and eight years. She is a farmer in Kitale town of Western Kenya and has been in farming for the last six years. She produces and sells milk, maize, and beans at the local market. 

Fanice is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her construct both a poultry unit for 30,000 KES and a dairy unit for 20,000 KES. She will use the rest of her funds to purchase poultry. Fanice is optimistic and focuses on having at least 1,000 birds on her farm. She says the high cost of artificial insemination is the main undoing of dairy farming. Fanice knows her loan will enable her to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to construct poultry and dairy pens and buy poultry

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is 58 years old and married with three children. She lives in Migpangi, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. For the past two years, Paulita has operated a retail shop where she sells a variety of products such as shampoo and toothpaste. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP.
