Paulita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Florebelle

texts.en:
Florebelle, age 24, owns and operates a shop that sells animal feed and medicines. She has had this business for three years. She and her husband have two children.

Florebelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy sacks of animal feed and medicines to offer for sale in her store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed and medicines

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah, age 44, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. He engages in small-scale farming and sells all his produce at the local market. He and his wife Esther have four school-going children.  

Isaiah was introduced to KADET Ltd  by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds to plant on his piece of land, as well as fertilizer.

In future, Isaiah hopes to be a successful farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been engaged in mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband Julius.

She got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff members in Ndunyu Njeru town. This will be her fourth loan, and she repaid her most recent previous loan of KES 75,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy one cow, fertilizers, and seedlings, and to pay for necessary farm labor.

In the future, Nancy aspires to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy one cow, fertilizers, and seedlings, and to pay for necessary farm labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, window glass, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en:
Fatemah is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has worked since 1997 at selling baby diapers and sanitary napkins from her house. She intended to work from her house in order to stay next to her children. Taking good care of them at the same time made for the best management of her business.

This is Fatemah's eleventh cycle with Al Majmoua. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her capital through buying big quantities with special prices. In addition, she will help her son in building his own house, through a small payment she will give him.

Fatemah is encouraged by most of her customers, neighbors and family, and this what has helped her to stay this long and expand her business. She hopes to open a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying big quantities at special prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
For the last 43 years Mburu has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru Town. He is 74 years old and married to Kezia. 

He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru Town. This will be his fourth loan, after he repaid his previous loan of KES 55,000 in full and on time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy two sheep, a heifer, and farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

In the future, Mburu aspires to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru Town.

loans.use: to buy two sheep, a heifer, and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement, iron, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens for resale and to grow her egg and chicken business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, tissue and buttons

loans.name: Mtana

texts.en:
Mtana is 35 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of nine and 14.  Mtana runs an electronics repair shop in Kilifi. His business has been in operation for three years and has been a success as he is able to meet the needs of his family. 

Mtana has been a KADET client for a while and this marks his fourth loan to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase more stock of electronics for his repair shop. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.

Mtana’s future dream is to become prosperous and to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of electronics

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chemba, Provincia de Sofala, centro de Mocambique é viuva e mae de 2 filhos de 15 e 20 anos de idade todos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com os seus filhos .
Saiu de Chemba para Maputo devido a transferencia dos serviços onde ela esteve incorporada. Ė pensionista do Ministerio da Defesa ha mais de 11 anos e recebe 6.250.00mt por mês que depois de aplicar nas suas despesas familiares o resto poupa na sua conta bancaria mensalmente.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (varoês de ferro, cimento cola, barrotes e outros) para concluir a sua obra. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt para a habitaçao.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Filomena was born in Chemba District, Sofala Province in central Mozambique. She is a widow and has two children who are 15 and 20 years old. Both children go to school. Filomena only finished fourth grade and did not continue with school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her children.

She left Chemba to move to Maputo because of a work transfer. She has received a pension from the Ministry of Defense for more than 11 years and receives 6,250 meticais per month. After paying her household expenses, she saves the rest in her bank account every month.

Filomena has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution, and this is her third loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais, and she intends to buy construction materials (iron rods, adhesive, beams and other items) to finish her construction project. The earlier loans were for 10,000 meticais and 18,000 meticais, and they were for housing.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan with no problems, and she will ask for more loans to furnish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron rods, adhesive, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 49-year-old married lady. She is involved in a dairy business. For this purpose, she has a buffalo at her home from which she gets milk that she sells to her community people for a profit. The income she earns helps her to manage the household expenses. Besides her dairy business, she also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well.
 
For the last seven years, her husband has been involved in the business of selling soil. He provides his product to different nurseries (garden centers) and earns reasonably good profits from it. She has given birth to three children. All of them stay at home and don’t do anything. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy soil in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill the demands of his clients and increase his profits. Farzana hopes that the loan will be a profitable one for her husband and her family will be able to live a better financial life as a result. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy soil to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 38 years old, married, and has four children all of whom attend school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years and employs two farmhands. His main produce is eggs, milk, and maize which he sells locally. He depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family.

Simon is requesting his seventh loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to construct a poultry unit. The extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of insufficient capital to expand his farm and diseases which affects his production. He hopes that in the near future his poultry farm will have expanded and that he will also have acquired a machine for processing poultry feeds.

loans.use: To construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Mushtaq

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has two children.

Mushtaq has had a workshop since 1995, selling spare parts, accessories and wheels for cars. He is very experienced in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 52-year-old housewife and the mother of a 12-year-old daughter. Fatmeh and her husband started selling home products and supplies at their house 5 years ago, and, from their profit, they were able to buy a bus and use it as a portable store for home supplies and products (as shown in the picture). Now, Fatmeh wants to help her husband more by applying for this loan to buy more supplies so he can have a variety of products to sell and, therefore, increase their income so they can open their own store for home products and supplies in the future.

Since Fatmeh is a conservative person, she suggested that her husband appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her husband's retail business selling home products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell products (oil, soap, peanuts, rice, and other)

loans.name: Colletta

texts.en:
Colletta is  33 years old, single, and has three children. She owns a boutique shop in Mariakani where she sells new and used clothes to her clients. Her business has been in operation for the last eight years. 

Colletta is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of clothes for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and sustain her family. Her future dream is for her business to expand to other areas of operation.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 39 years old, married, and has eight children.  She lives in the Philippines. Charita has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods.

Charita has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Charita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is married with seven children. Felisa is 61 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Felisa sells different kinds of products for her general store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store.
Felisa has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Gabriel Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Provincioa de Maputo, sul de Moçambique é casado e pai de 2 filhos de 03 e 06 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a Escola. Frequenta 12ª classe e nunca parou de estudar. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Magude para Maputo ao encontro dos seus pais que ja residiam nesta ciadade. Trabalha no Ministerio da Educação como docente ha mais de 7 anos e tem um salario de 3.903.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e sempre tem conseguido poupar algum  na sua conta bancaria porque a sua esposa tem ajudado nas despesas de casa.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 15.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para aplicar na conclusaõ da sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Gabriel was born in Magude District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has two children, 3 and 6 years old. The eldest goes to school. Gabriel attends 12th grade and has never stopped studying. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

He left Magude to come to Maputo in search of his parents, who were already living in the city. He has worked for the Ministry of Education as a teacher for more than seven years and has a salary of 3,903 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and has always been able to save some money in his bank account because his wife helps with household expenses.

Gabriel has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This is his first loan, and he is asking for 15,500 meticais which he will use to buy construction material (stone, cement, iron, sand and other items) to continue construction on his house.

He is confident that he will pay off this loan with no problems, and he will ask for more loans to finish his house and make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, cement, iron, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Sukan

texts.en:
Sukan, 48 year old, is a farmer.  Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is $6.50 per day.  They both have 4 children, all of them are working in the factory with $3 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $27 on food, $6 on electricity, $25 on rent house fee, $30 on transportation, and $33 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy construction equipment in Phnom Penh.  She wants to buy more equipment and tools for her husband's career because the family income is dependent on him.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment for her husband's career

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  She is 46 years old, married to Moses, and they have five school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid off her previous loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Ann hopes to practice mixed farming, hence diversifying her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique é maê de 1 fillho menor de 3 anos que ainda não vai a Escola. Frequenta 11ª classe e nunca parou de estudar excepto quando ficou gravida. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane com os seus pais e mais tarde criou o seu proprio lar. Trabalha no Ministerio da Educação como docente ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM) porque conta com ajuda do seu marido.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 18.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 11.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 16.500.00mt aplicados na habitação e bens.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para aplicar na conclusaõ da sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Sonia was born in Maputo city, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She has one son who is younger than three years old and does not yet go to school. Sonia attends 11th grade and has never stopped studying except for when she became pregnant. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Maputo city to come to Boane with her parents, and later she established her own residence. She has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education for more than six years and has a salary of 4,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM) because she relies on her husband's help.

Sonia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This is her fifth loan, and she is asking for 18,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and other items) in order to continue construction on her house. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais, 11,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais and 16,500 meticais, and were used for housing and property.

Sonia is confident that she will pay off the loan without problems, and she will ask for more loans to finish her house and make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 27-year old single woman and has been the owner of a clothing shop since 2007. She started her business to make a good source for living and to have a good career to develop. She worked hard to improve and succeed, and with the help of Al Majmoua and her family's and friends' support, she has succeeded and is working hard on her continuity.

She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles. Her previous loan helped a lot in achieving part of her goals, and now she's requesting another loan in order to increase her summer season collection. Most of her customers are relatives, friends and passersby. She stated that through the new collection's income, she'll be able to increase her autumn/winter collection.

Zeinab is working hard on expanding her business, and she's willing to open a bigger shop with men's, women's and children's wear.

loans.use: to increase her summer collection.

loans.name: Cremildo Elias

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Xai-Xai, Provincioa de Gaza, sul de Moçambique é casado e pai  de 1 fillho de 7 meses de idade. Fez somente 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras na altura. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Xai-xai para Maputo com seus pais ainda menor de idade. Trabalha numa empresa denominada ICL-LDA ha mais de 9 anos e tem um negocio proprio que o ajuda aumentar o rendimento familiar. Recebe um salario de 5.500.00mt por mês e cerca de 4.000.00mt apartir do seu negocio onde aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar alguma parte por mês na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhos do seu bairro que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, areia, cimento, ferro e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para iniciara um negocio para a sua esposa.
texts.en:
Cremildo was born in the city of Xai-Xai, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of one 7-month-old son. He only went to school through the seventh grade and had to drop out because of his family's financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He and his parents left Xai-Xai for Maputo when he was still young. He's worked at a company called ICL-LDA for more than 9 years, and also has his own business, which helps the family supplement their income. He receives a salary of 5500 meticals a month and earns around 4000 meticals through his business. He uses the income to cover household expenses and is able to set aside a portion of his earnings in a savings account each month.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from neighbors who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (stone, sand, cement, rebar, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.
He is confident that he will be able to pay off the loan without difficulty and request new loans to start a business with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (stone, sand, cement, rebar, etc.).

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 32, is married to Charles, who works in a security firm. They are blessed with two children between the ages of two and five. She sells curios, which she has been doing for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of about $107.

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD. She will use the loan funds to buy more curios, specifically soap stones.

Sarah intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and hopes to join a group of international exporters in future.

loans.use: To buy curios, specifically soap stones.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a shop that sells green bananas. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy green and yellow bananas.

She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Timane

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  Provincia de Cabo Delgado, Norte de Moçambique casado e é pai de 3 fillhos de 08, 12 e 14 anos de idade e todos vaõ a Escola. Fez 9ª classe e naõ continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado para Maputo concretamente no Distrito de Boane afim de continuar com os estudos e acbou formando seu lar. Trabalha numa fabrica de produçaõ e venda de cimento ha mais de 7 anos e tem um salario de 3.800.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria e conta com o ajuda da sua esposa.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende pagar a legalização do seu terreno onde ira erguer obra para o seu negocio.
Espera pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos na Hluvuku para aplicar na construção de um etabelecimento e iniciar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Timane was born in the province of Cabo Delgado in northern Mozambique. He is married nd the father of three children 8, 12, and 14 years of age. All of his children attend school. He went to school through the ninth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Cabo Delgado for Maputo, specifically the district of Boane, in order to continue his studies, and ended up settling down. He's worked in a cement plant for more than 7 years and earns a salary of 3,800 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is able to save a little in his bank account and his wife also contributes to the household income.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from coworkers who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he will use to pay for the legal paperwork for his land, where he plans to start construction for his business.
He intends to pay off the loan without difficulty and request new loans from Hluvuku, which he will use to construct a building and start a business.

loans.use: for legal paperwork for his land.

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a food shop that sells snacks like rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making rice cakes.
 
She is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Creselda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making rice cakes.

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema is a talented lady who owns and operates a sewing business from home. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She got her talent from her mother and adopted it as a profession after her marriage. Now her talent is bringing in good profits which she utilizes to manage the household expenses. Her clientele base is her neighbors. They give her good orders due to her good sewing. 
 
Haleema has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become old and takes a long time to sew a single dress. The new machine will enable her to complete her orders in less time and earn maximum profits. She hopes that after the loan investment her business will grow further and improve the standard of living of her family as a result. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Haleema.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 64 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, she operates a restaurant business. She earns about $125 each month doing this type of work. Felicidad has requested a loan to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell staple goods.

loans.name: Umidahon's Group

texts.en:
Umidahon is the treasurer of this group. She is 33 and married to a driver, whose monthly salary is 2,000 KGS. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons, both of whom study at school.  In order to earn money to meet the daily needs, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds cattle. At the moment Umidahon breeds three bulls.  Reselling cattle after fattening, she earns about an additional $110 per month. This profit makes it possible for them to cover the family’s daily expenses. With money received from the loan, Umidahon wants to purchase a bull-calf for breeding and fattening. In the future she wants to expand her business, and with the profits gained from reselling cattle she plans to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with only one child. Virginia is 62 years old and lives in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Virginia sells canned goods and other daily needs such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, noodles and so on to earn a living, and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns about $150 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products which people need daily.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Virginia hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap and other daily needs to sell.

loans.name: Anuba

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  Provincia de Tete, Norte de Moçambique casada e maê de 5 fillhos de idades entre 04 a  17 anos de idade e todos vaõ a Escola excepto o mais novo. Fez somente 4ª classe naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras e mais tarde foi incorporada ao serviço militar obrigatorio. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia as vezes tem ajudado a seus parentes que estaõ em Tete.
Saiu de Tete para Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatorio, actualmente é pensionista do Ministerio da Defesa e recebe 5.323.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu marido consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de outros clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu setimo emprestimo no valor de 16.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, cimento, chapas de zinco, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.400.00, 8.000.00, 10.000.00, 10.000.00, 15.000.00 e 15.000.00mt todos para habitação.
Espera pagar sem problemas e pretende solicitar mais emprestimos para comprar o mobiliario da sua casa.
texts.en:
Anuba was born in Tete Province in northern Mozambique. She is married and has 5 children between 4 and 17 years old, and all but the youngest child go to school. Anuba only finished fourth grade. She did not continue with school because of financial difficulties and later began compulsory military service. She lives in her own house with her family and sometimes helps her parents, who are in Tete.

Anuba left Tete to move to Maputo while completing her compulsory military service. She has a pension from the Ministry of Defense and receives 5,323 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. With her husband's help she is also able to save some money in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through some of this institution's other customers. This is Anuba's seventh loan. She is asking for 16,500 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (doors, cement, zinc sheets, sand and other items) to continue with improvements on her house. The previous loans were for 6,400 meticais, 8,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais; all were for housing.

She expects to make her payments with no problems and intends to ask for more loans to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, cement, zinc sheets, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, sewing thread and hair chemicals  for her salon and tailoring business.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Gemalyn sells local delicacies such as suman and biko, which are both types of rice cakes.  She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
Vale, who is in her early 30s, is married with one small child.  She has been running a fruit-and-vegetable business for 3 months now.  She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to take care of her baby's needs, household expenses and also increased on her fruit-and-vegetable business. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Azizi, which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (corrugated iron, cement, iron, sand etc. ) to build his home.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 28-year-old married mother of one child. She runs a retail vegetable selling shop called Kilifi, a business that has been in operation for the last nine years. 

Florence has been a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase cooking oil, sugar, rice, and maize flour into her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to maintain her family.

Her dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, rice and maize flour.
